description: You will be responsible for product promotion in both local hospital and retail market using scientific-based facts and materials in orderto achieve the company vision of integrated Personal Diabetes Management (iPDM) for patients.Cooperate with distributors to open new customer accounts, build up the company’s image, perform after-sell service, toachieve or exceed sales target for the assigned sales territory within sales expense budget pre-set by line manager.  Main Tasks & Responsibilities Carry out daily promotion tasks through professional detailing and promotion of company’s products with the eventual aim to achieve or exceed sales target pre-set by company Possess and maintain good product knowledge and be competent to conduct product presentation to customers in group setting Provide regular market and competitive information and timely reporting to AM/SV/Marketing in format and contents agreed by Company. Develop and update on regular basis customer data files. Pay planned visits to target customers based on pre-defined customer territories (clinical departments, device purchasing dept., store staff and manager, chain management and hospital management) according to call plan submitted and approved by SV/Area Manager Conduct promotional activities within expense budgets based on monthly action plan submitted and pre-approved by line manager Plan and carry out quality service on meters placed in hospitals and conduct high-quality service and expiry inspections on the machines and test strips placed in the retail terminal along with daily visits. Develop and maintain good relationships with KOLs and key procurement depts. Maintain an active coordination with local distributors to ensure enough stock-holding and coverage.  Basic Requirements of the Job College or above, Medicine or Pharmaceutical Preferred Good command of English in both spoken and written About 1-year related working experiences, good personality, skillful at communicating with others. Strong ability of working independently; Strong ability of bearing hardships

Sales Representative  Smith is currently looking for experienced sales professional to join their Asia-Pacific Sales Team. As one of the world’s leading independent electronics distributor, the successful applicants will play a significant role in Smith’s market leading expertise on global electronics sourcing, logistics and distribution.     At Smith, we encourage our sales team to take an entrepreneurial approach to their work, believing that every impact can make a difference. We are looking for talented individuals who are driven, self-motivated and hungry for success. If you are not afraid of a challenge and looking for a rewarding environment, we would like to speak with you.  More senior candidates with more than 4 or 8 years of experience may be considered for a Senior Sales Representative or Sales Manager position.   Key Responsibilities Develop and maintain a portfolio of prospective OEM customers within the region and internationally Become an expert in the customers’ industry and act as the main point of contact for any client related inquiries Identify potential customers and develop sales strategies Provide effective cost-saving solutions (PPV) to customers based on accurate marketplace insight Assist customers to remove excess stock proactively  Requirements Bachelor degree in any disciplines At least 2 years of sales experience in electronics or any relevant industries is highly preferred Passionate, proactive, self-motivated and result-driven Ability to handle work independently, systematically in a fast pace environment Excellent communication skills and passionate in cold calling Good command of both written and oral English and Chinese, Japanese is a plus  About Smith Founded in 1984, Smith is a global distributor of semiconductors and electronic components and a trusted provider of efficiency-enhancing supply chain services to electronics and high-tech manufacturers. Smith’s investment in advanced in-house labs, a highly trained professional team, and strategically located global support centers offers our partners complete sourcing, inventory management solutions, cost-saving program, and more.  A privately held company, Smith employs more than 600 people worldwide, with over $1.39 billion in sales annually. Smith's regional hubs in Houston, Hong Kong, and Amsterdam are ISO-certified. In addition, sales and purchasing offices are located in Austin, Beijing, Silicon Valley, Guadalajara, New York, Beijing, Shanghai, Shenzhen, Seoul, Taipei, Penang, Cluj-Napoca, Munich, and Bangalore. #LI-AC1

Job Description Achieve team & individual business target, drive revenue growth and gain market share Identify the projects with high growth potential, coordinate necessary resources (distributors PM, FAE, Sales force.) and acquire resources / competencies to maximize design wins, including the involvement/support of the relevant BU Monitor the sales and demand creation activities, and provide appropriate sales reporting timely Team up with marketing, application engineers, system engineers & management to achieve defined target Build strong and long-lasting relationship with focus core accounts  Job Requirements BSEE or equivalent, Electrical Engineering preferred At least 3 years work experience related to sales is preferred, experience of sales at power semiconductor market is a plus Good interpersonal & communication skill for business propositions Ability to work under pressure from both internal & external Ability to articulate well business proposal along with technical across all levels of hierarchy Fluent written & oral English for business Experience to manage the key account with team cooperation preferred

Key Responsibilities • Fulfill the customer agreement and to keep stable relationship with customer as client-related target and on the other hand execute the project in accordance with Time-Cost-Quality-Scope agreed during project planning phase as internal target. • Set up project plan and update the project status weekly, and follow the project milestone on schedule • Manage project risks and provide mitigation support and management • Provide transparent and open communications with China management • Work with PM’s in the USA on joint project management of contracts, accounts Receivables and customer communications • Work independently with stakeholders in supporting customers to support project requirements. • Perform sales & marketing activities that ensures attainment of company sales target and profitability, and provide risk review and oversight on new bids, proposals and projects.  Qualifications • Bachelor or Master degree • More than 5 years’ experience in the project execution and engineering, or in sales and tendering • Technical skills & knowledge required, and experience in hydraulic industry is preferred • Good communication skills • Willing to travel • Ability to speak and write English  Disclaimer: This job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not intended to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this position

This role supports the Global Sales Offices who service Rosewood Hotels and Resorts, KHOS and New World Hotels & Resorts in responding to general client inquiries and requests, assisting clients in the absence of a manager or director, follow-up and handling of leads/opportunities, oversight and optimization of sales technologies, and overall management of office administration functions.  Responsibilities: Provide direct sales support to the Director(s) of Global Sales in China Provide direct administrative and data support to the Senior Director, Commercial, Asia Pacific Respond to general incoming sales inquiries/opportunities and facilitate any follow-up required to the appropriate director of global sales or hotel sales manager Assist in responding to clients in the absence of a manager or director and forwarding relevant information to the hotels as appropriate Communicate with customers, on-property hotels managers, staff, and corporate office on a regular basis or as requested by directors Maintain an accurate and updated sales resource database – to include contacts, accounts, opportunities, and lists Prepare, assist, develop and provide all sales & marketing related reports as requested – or facilitate requests to appropriate individual as necessary Coordinate sales trip itineraries for directors to include organization and follow-up as needed Provide coordination support to the appropriate director of global sales for tradeshows, roadshow and sales events as assigned Conduct budget and expense management including review of all incoming bills, submitting to directors for timely approval, and processing bills with corporate finance Support client events, sales missions, and tradeshows through planning and coordination Manage group inquiries in the sales resource database including status follow-up with respective hotels Process Travel Agent requests including reservations, commission issues, special VIP requests, etc Manage Corporate RFP tools and related process and issues  Support collateral procurement and fulfillment: process requests and maintain database of requests. Coordinate in-house direct mail and/or email campaigns with Corporate Director of Marketing Communications and/or Corporate Director of Global Sales Represent Rosewood Hotels and Resorts, KHOS and New World Hotels & Resorts in the highest standards with colleagues, customers, at customer events and tradeshows  Skills & Qualifications: Experience: Diploma/College/Bachelor’s Degree or a relevant field of work, or an equivalent combination of education and work-related experience Education: 2+ years progressive work-related experience in the hotel industry is required. Experience with multi-brand entity preferred References: Strong personal and business references upon request Must be able to perform job functions with attention to detail, speed and accuracy Ability to prioritize, organize, multi-task, and follow-up; attentive and responsive to client needs; obsessively service-oriented; be a clear thinker, remaining calm and resolving problems using good judgment; follow directions thoroughly; understand a guest’s service needs; work cohesively with co-workers as part of a team; meet deadlines; maintain confidentiality of guest information and pertinent hotel data Reading, writing, and oral proficiency in English Demonstrate an affinity with technology; proficient in computer skills (including Windows, Microsoft suite of tools, internet) necessary to complete correspondence with internal and external customers via proposals, letters, emails, and inter-office communications. Salesforce, Cendyne, Delphi, RevIntel experience a plus  While this job description is intended to be an accurate reflection of the duties involved in this position, the company reserves the right to add, remove or alter duties when business need dictates.

Company Overview  Company Description  Third Bridge was founded on the belief that human insights drive intelligent investment decisions.  To make the right investment decisions, our clients require access to the most relevant experts and their insights – we enable this through private consultations and exclusive content drawn from expert interviews.  Our clients consist of some of the largest private equity funds, hedge funds, mutual funds and management consulting firms, who are serviced by a team of over 900 employees located across eight global offices.  Third Bridge operates in a global, multi-billion-dollar market with double digit annual growth and has consistently received accolades for Great Places to Work and the top 100 fastest growing companies.  Job Description  As an Account Associate, you will play a vital role in driving engagement with clients across Third Bridge’s Connections and Forum offerings. You will proactively contact investment professionals and/or consultants within our client base on a day-to-day basis, building rapport and credibility to drive end-users towards our services. Your work will be pivotal in guaranteeing the retention and growth of our account base.  In This Role You Will  Responsibilities Support Account Managers on renewals and cross-sell opportunities by working closely with them to execute on territory and account plans to achieve strategic goals Identify and engage inactive or potentially new users across priority accounts and to increase utilization of Third Bridge offerings Reiterate the value proposition of Third Bridge’s services to drive usage and help embed our products in the daily workflows of end users Maintain constant dialogue with clients to understand their research processes and gather feedback on Third Bridge’s services. Support clients by offering training and demo sessions on how to use Third Bridge’s services. Maintain and update team structures, client user preferences, client investment coverage sectors and geographies, and pertinent account and contact data in our systems, ensuring tailored content and service delivery to exceed client expectations. Develop an awareness of client buying processes and Third Bridge sales and renewal processes to support revenue generation Collaborate with internal stakeholders - legal, marketing, research, sales and product teams, to ensure client requests are executed quickly and effectively. Attend internal and external meetings punctually and well-prepared Address and/or triage inbound client questions and requests; assess solutions and next steps alongside the Account Manager and execute the agreed approach Skills A client service-focused mindset Proven experience in building and maintaining relationships by phone and face-to-face would be beneficial Excellent organization, written and oral/presentation skills Collaborative approach in solving problems Qualifications A client service-focused mindset Proven experience in building and maintaining relationships by phone and face-to-face would be beneficial Excellent organization, written and oral/presentation skills Collaborative approach in solving problems Bachelor’s degree 1-2 years of account management experience and/or client support experience, preferably in a similar industry Highly motivated with a track record of consistent achievement of quota(s) for at least 1 year Effectively leverages internal resources, tools and systems daily Experience applying industry and product knowledge in written and verbal client communications Successful past adoption and effective use of internal workflows, processes and technologies to accomplish work objectives Strong communication, active listening, interpersonal and presentation skills Intellectual curiosity and a passion for learning Easy adaptable to changing, ambiguous and fast-paced environments Strong time management skills with the ability to multi-task and prioritize work Familiarity with Salesforce.com as well as Microsoft Office and G-Suite tools Additional Information  We know that to be truly innovative, we need to have a diverse team around us. That is why Third Bridge is committed to creating an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. If you are not 100% sure if you are right for the role, please apply anyway and we will be happy to consider your application.

description: 工作职责:  Job Description Summary  Customer facing staff responsible for winning business Executes standard sales tasks and typically subject to instructions and work routines. There is latitude to rearrange the sequence to complete task/duties based on changing work situations. May be responsible for targeted clients, stable regions, and/or small/medium sales territories.  GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  角色与职责 向指定客户销售时，新增客户通常很少，并且通常需要经过审查。包括单个业务组/P&L 中的关键客户。 扩大自己对销售区域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群体的认识，以执行政策/策略。不断培养更高水平的知识和技能。 理解关键业务驱动力的基础知识；用这种理解来完成自己的工作。了解自己团队的工作如何与其他团队融合并为该领域做出贡献。 可能具有一定的自主权，从而在定义的框架内进行决策。以良好的商业知识和判断力解决在规定程序中遇到的问题。就定义的说明/参数之外的问题咨询更多的高级团队成员。 此级别的职位需要良好的人际交往能力。向直接相关的同事和业务部门传达所提供的设计和协调服务。对于面对客户的角色，建立牢固的客户关系并充当客户与 GE 之间的接口。向他人介绍技术信息。 任职条件:  基本资格  该岗位要求在领域具有初步的工作经验。学历水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历）  所需特性  优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够独立工作。较强的解决问题能力。  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

We strive to be the most innovative, respected and responsible leader in our markets — delivering performance that makes a difference. Purpose of the Job  The Key Account Manager maintains and expands relationships with strategically important large customers. Assigned to three to five named customers, the Key Account Manager is responsible for achieving sales quota and assigned strategic account objectives. The Key Account Manager represents the entire range of company products and services to assigned customers, while leading the customer account planning cycle and ensuring assigned customers' needs and expectations are met by the company.  Job Context  Internal  Marketing, Technical Support, RnA, Customer Service, Sales team, Legal  External  Key Accounts, distributors  Job Content Customer first Establish productive, professional relationships with key personnel at all hierarchical levels in assigned customer accounts through in person/digital interactions. Proactively assesses, clarifies, and validates customer strategy (incl brands and go-to-market) on an ongoing basis to identify solutions for collaboration, sales opportunities. Leads a joint company-strategic account planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones for a one and three-year period. Lead the KA management process with the key account team, from co-creation to execution of a Customer strategy, including building and delivering unique value propositions. Strategic Planning and Business Value Selling Design the Key Account growth strategy and ensure its achievement. Lead the value proposition process to develop specific and unique selling proposition(s) to meet the Account's global needs. Build and manage opportunity pipeline, focusing on high-value project/brief delivery. Set the pricing strategy for the Key Account in alignment with company(to avoid value destruction), align (when advantageous) all terms and conditions, be the first point of contact for RFQ. Develop a CSR program relevant to both company and Key Account. Sales Management Lead the global sales budget/forecast program within business planning cycle. Meets assigned targets for profitable sales volume and strategic objectives in assigned accounts. Monitor and report monthly sales and act in timely manner with corrective actions. Manage and monitor the gross profitability and profit contribution according to set target values. Monitor payment terms enforcement/overdues chasing. Monitor forecast accuracy and inventory management as per BU requirement. Communication Management Facilitate top level Customer Communication and sponsorship. Develop and sponsor an active Key Account communication strategy including success and best practice sharing. Be the key point of contact for the Key Account and within the company value chain (e.g., price requests, key projects). Ensures high visibility towards the Key Account and involve senior company management when appropriate. Customer Service Customer centric Communication for customer KPI failures. Monitor customer complaints to establish root cause, corrective and preventive actions and resolve Key Account complaints through action and follow up. Monitor scorecard performance and set improvement goals to meet the Key Account expectation and competitors' performance. People and team management In a matrix organization (no direct report), build maintain and facilitate a dedicated Account Team that operates with clear accountability and is fully involved in the co-creation, review and delivery of the Key Account strategy.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

THE BUSINESS Olam International Ltd. is a leading global integrated trade house of agricultural commodities headquartered in Singapore and operating from seed to shelf in 70 countries with global market leadership positions in many of its businesses. The RMS (Risk Management Solutions) business provides bespoke structured solutions to address our clients’ hedging requirements across the agricultural commodities complex. The Central Trading team is responsible for structuring, pricing and trading exotic OTC structured products across our product portfolio.  Key Responsibilities / Tasks ·        Be responsible for the marketing and sales of risk management solutions by conducting visits, client seminars, calls and follow-ups. ·        Stay up to date on markets dynamics by reading market reports. Maintaining industry relationships and liaising with RMS colleagues in other geographies and with internal physical business units ·        Provide complex structured, exotic and vanilla risk management hedging solutions to both internal and external clients. ·        Be responsible for daily sales execution of agricultural derivatives and post-trade follow up;   PROFILE Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics or Business Management Strong attention to detail Solid problem-solving ability and creative thinking Collaborative and team oriented Fluency in Mandarin and English Based in Shanghai  Preferred Experience and qualifications: Master degree in Finance, Economics or Business Management Experience in the agricultural derivatives / brokerage market in China Experience interacting with Chinese agricultural industry companies Salesmanship acumen and sales track record As our clients in China have trading teams which work until the US close of markets we also need the person who will join us to work until the close of US ags markets.”

About the Position:  Siemens Account Development Representatives work directly with selling teams, in an assigned region, to identify, penetrate, and cultivate new business opportunities. Execution of new business strategies will include research, cold calling, and advanced qualification. Team members will set meetings, schedule technical resources, track activity and proactively update selling teams on next steps for new and developing opportunities.  Team members will also be responsible for opening new accounts or new departments in existing customer base. Works on assignments that are routine in nature, requiring limited judgment. Works under moderate supervision and usually receives detailed instructions on all work. Works on assignments that are moderately difficult, requiring judgment in resolving issues or in making recommendations. Works under minimal supervision, receiving little instruction on daily work and general instructions on newly introduced assignments.  This position must be highly proficient in communication and coordination with internal organizations. Stakeholders must understand the overall value proposition of the solutions they are selling and be able to quickly communicate the message. Success in the position depends heavily on building a trusted partnership with the local sales team to define a dynamic list of target accounts and agreement on upfront pursuit strategies.  Responsibility  Target account development and management:  Prepare and setup for outbound daily calls and other pursuit strategies Conduct initial phone qualification and research on assigned target accounts to gather intelligence Build prospect interest in the products and services offered by Siemens PLM Software through web, social media, e-mail and primarily phone interaction Enrich and profile our databases (Eloqua and SalesForce) to identify new interest Systematically follow-up all target account activities to develop total qualified opportunities that produce an above average close rate  Requirement  This position requires an individual who is able to interact with a large variety of people: sales and marketing teams, customers, prospects and specialists from various industrial sectors and at different levels of responsibility including the executive level. Building relationships over the phone to develop business is essential. The individual must be articulate and have story-telling ability Fearless and Persistence in cold calling new account targets Growing existing accounts in new divisions and qualifying new business prospects Proven ability to open doors, and build relationships at all levels in an organization Able to think creatively and apply new ideas to overcome objections and barriers Works well on a team and has strong communication skills Highly organized and can manage a large volume of opportunities Proficient in using CRM systems (Salesforce) Ability to research and quickly simulate information into action Self-motivated and target driven Inside sales and/or direct selling experience Engineering and or technical background is preferred Minimum 5 year related working experience is required  Organization: Digital Industries  Company: Siemens Industry Software (Beijing) Co., Ltd.  Experience Level: Early Professional  Job Type: Full-time

About Unlimint  Founded in 2009, Unlimint (formerly Cardpay) provides fast-growing innovative tech businesses with a convenient and simple business interface that enables payments to flow freely and invisibly. From London to Singapore and from San Francisco to Sao Paulo, we help local clients enter new markets, and global businesses to explore new industries and reach new milestones.  Following the highest banking industry standards, we are dissolving the borders that have previously limited international expansion. Our constantly evolving business interface – made by innovators for innovators – is designed to make the financial world of tomorrow closer to businesses here and now.  About The Job  Great opportunity to join an international team and to be working with fast-growing companies, looking for new customers (b2b) anywhere you can, to approach, pitch and continue to follow up and close deals. Merchant acquisition in various sectors is the key driver in this position.  Responsibilities Adhere to and follow Unlimint’s clients policy, targeted types of merchants and industries, Unlimint ’s requirements for potential and existing merchants; Promote and sell services of Unlimint and its affiliated and related parties (as the case may be); Forward potential merchants to Unlimint ’s onboarding team and other units of Unlimint as the case may be; Assist potential merchants with their onboarding with Unlimint ; Propose potential business deals with potential partners, and if approved by Unlimint , work on conclusion of such deals; Arrange and hold business meetings with potential and existing merchants and partners; Participate in conferences, exhibitions and other events as instructed by Unlimint ; Provide and relay to Unlimint duly, timely and accurately feedback, comments and information. from merchants and partners; Advise and provide information to Unlimint and its affiliates and related parties on business development, including opportunities, strategies, risks etc. Experience and mindset Min. 2 years of B2B sales experience Min. 2 years of direct experience in Payments is a must Excellent command of English and one Asian language Ability to negotiate on C- and Director-Level Competitive, aggressive sales nature with a desire to win Desire to be part of a rapidly expanding business Ability to work in a fast paced environment Willingness to undertake business trips We offer Attractive monthly salary paid in line with experience Vacation, sick, and paid holidays Full-time: 5/2 (Saturday and Sunday days off) Modern workplace A team of top international professionals to learn from Multicultural working environment Join Unlimint Team now!  Unlimint is an equal opportunity employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

Sales Representative  Smith is currently looking for experienced sales professional to join their Asia-Pacific Sales Team. As one of the world’s leading independent electronics distributor, the successful applicants will play a significant role in Smith’s market leading expertise on global electronics sourcing, logistics and distribution.     At Smith, we encourage our sales team to take an entrepreneurial approach to their work, believing that every impact can make a difference. We are looking for talented individuals who are driven, self-motivated and hungry for success. If you are not afraid of a challenge and looking for a rewarding environment, we would like to speak with you.  More senior candidates with more than 4 or 8 years of experience may be considered for a Senior Sales Representative or Sales Manager position.   Key Responsibilities Develop and maintain a portfolio of prospective OEM customers within the region and internationally Become an expert in the customers’ industry and act as the main point of contact for any client related inquiries Identify potential customers and develop sales strategies Provide effective cost-saving solutions (PPV) to customers based on accurate marketplace insight Assist customers to remove excess stock proactively  Requirements Bachelor degree in any disciplines At least 2 years of sales experience in electronics or any relevant industries is highly preferred Passionate, proactive, self-motivated and result-driven Ability to handle work independently, systematically in a fast pace environment Excellent communication skills and passionate in cold calling Good command of both written and oral English and Chinese, Japanese is a plus  About Smith Founded in 1984, Smith is a global distributor of semiconductors and electronic components and a trusted provider of efficiency-enhancing supply chain services to electronics and high-tech manufacturers. Smith’s investment in advanced in-house labs, a highly trained professional team, and strategically located global support centers offers our partners complete sourcing, inventory management solutions, cost-saving program, and more.  A privately held company, Smith employs more than 600 people worldwide, with over $1.39 billion in sales annually. Smith's regional hubs in Houston, Hong Kong, and Amsterdam are ISO-certified. In addition, sales and purchasing offices are located in Austin, Beijing, Silicon Valley, Guadalajara, New York, Beijing, Shanghai, Shenzhen, Seoul, Taipei, Penang, Cluj-Napoca, Munich, and Bangalore.

The primary responsibility of the role will be to develop and manage relationships with the key stakeholders in order drive sales across the assigned accounts and territory. Develop annual business plan, determining sales and activity goals required for attainment of assigned quota. Prepare sales forecasts; establish targets in areas such as product mix, sales volume, market share, or business development and monitor the performance of the sales against these goals; adjust sales strategies and plans to meet changing markets and competitive conditions. Pursue large prospects and leads and negotiate terms of sales that will maximize the organization's business interests. Liaise with other departments across the organization (particularly in implementation and client services) to ensure that sales activities are integrated with other parts of the business and aligned with the overall corporate objectives. Propose and implement opportunity and account plans to ensure client satisfaction, profitability, and retention through building ongoing business relationships. Establish and maintain effective and constructive relationships with internal/external clients, earning trust and respect through demonstrating a consistent commitment to exceed expectations. Maintain a high state of integrity and professionalism in carrying out the duties and responsibilities of this position. Solid proven sales record in continually achieving or exceeding assigned business revenue targets. Proven proficiency in account plan development and implementation of related sales strategies to secure large clients. Strong command of English with both oral and written; second north Asia language preferred. Excellent presentation and written communication skills. We are Covestro. We are curious. We are courageous. We are colorful. We refined Chemical material solutions with game-changing products. Let us empower you to push boundaries. Join us and our 18.150 colleagues now and together we will make the world a brighter place.  What We Offer  Position Description (Major tasks, Value added, Contribution context, Work relations, Qualifications)  Major Tasks Be aware of full global picture and determine account strategy in alignment with strategy in EE China. Understand responsible for strategic customer needs and wants and develop value creation plan for the account; be full responsible for the account’s volume, turnover and profitability according to target. Develop, coordinate, monitor and update specific tactical measures to implement account strategy with account team by giving strategic price direction for the account value chain and co-ordinate global pricing discussions, and monitoring account performance and recommend improvement actions. Identifies and maps key decision makers in customers’ value; builds, maintains, and develops relationships with the key decision makers on different working levels . Develop 3-5 years key accounts plans in line with industry, application and product strategies; communicates the strategy and account plans with internal supportive functions. X-function collaborating work such as commercializing new business with efficient teamwork together with sales to launch new applications, cooperating with BD/ PRDC to build-up solutions and transferring new technical requests from market to internal. This role is in fact to lead a virtual team to work with 1 core biz (mobile phone + TV) and 100+ eco system companies including China #1 luggage Runmi, #1 ARVC (automatic robotic vacuum cleaner) Rockbro, #1 outdoor scooter Ninebot… The role also needs to work with BJ Mi HQ, different eco companies HQ (both R&D and supply chain) and down to earth to molder level. The position needs to combine both strategic thinking, virtual team leadership, business tactic expert and detail operation. To further grow the business in MI which is the fastest growing company in China, the KAM also needs to develop new business out of existing big 5 eco to penetrate into more new companies and applications. Moreover, as Mi is moving overseas very quickly (mobile phone already global #2 and target to be #1 in 3 years as per Lei Jun’s vision) together with several plants set up from India to , we also need this key account manager to have strong global thinking and internal resource alignment and adjustment. The BE to cover will not only limited to EP resin business but also includes TPU (quite often bonded with PC or PC/ABS) and composite (both on notebook and high end luggage). Value Added Makes Covestro the leading innovation partner and material supplier (in line with our marketing strategy, technology-, innovation-, and product-portfolio) for the nominated strategic account. Build up value proposition for new applications with feasible toolkit for sales to ensure the efficient business development. Work Relations  External: external customer (all levels and functions; including general management, R&D, and Marketing departments ), customer’s industry value chain partners .  Internal: All required functions within EP , Mar keting, Innovation, and PM; the Covestro Industrial Marketing groups and the other industrial marketing functions of other BUs; the Supply Chain Centers; senior management.  What You Offer  Qualifications: Bachelor degree in chemical or economics , and MBA is the plus. At least 5 years' working experience in related industries with positions in sales or marketing relative functions. Skill in project management with experience in coordinating multi-tasks, collaborating with multi-teams to drive out project objectives within timeline. Leadership capabilities and good communication skill. 5 . Able to travel frequently.  6 . Well-developed technical and sales skills are necessary in order to maintain credibility and respect at these large, multi-national companies. A thorough knowledge and understanding of Covestro’s internal structure, personnel and capabilities are also of great importance. The ability to clearly express thoughts and ideas, both orally and written, in Chinese and English, is an important ingredient in discussions with the accounts and Covestro personnel. In addition, excellent listening skills are required in order to fully grasp account viewpoints and needs from Covestro. Must be able to motivate, coach and direct a broad spectrum of people without having direct authority over them; effectively work across matrices and command respect of his/her peer group and the marketplace. Demonstrated proficiency in sales10.Full knowledge of the product line and its applications YOUR APPLICATION Are you as curious, courageous and colorful as we are? If so, we can offer you an exciting career opportunity. We look forward to receiving your application including a cover letter, resume/CV, and relevant certificates. Become part of our Team - apply now! Contact Us  www.covestro.com  Covestro welcomes applications from all individuals, regardless of racial or ethnic origin, skin color, nationality, religion, philosophy, gender, age, disability, appearance or sexual identity. We are committed to treating all applicants fairly and avoiding discrimination.

Company Description  At Infobip we dream big. Last year, over half of the world’s population interacted with businesses through the Infobip platform. It didn’t happen by chance: through 50+ offices on 6 continents, we are truly committed to helping our 200 000 enterprise clients reach and engage mobile users. Join us in driving the continuous success of Infobip by creating products that our customers love.  Job Description  Why is this role important at Infobip?  As Sales Development Representative you will have the opportunity to be our first impression on all prospective clients in the APAC market. Our vision of greatness in a Sales Development Representative is a brand ambassador that opens doors to all of our target clients, meaningfully filling the top of the Sales funnel, with a competitive drive to succeed.  You know you are doing a good job when you are:  Reach out leads and follow up as required Managing Outbound leads, setting up meetings with Account Executives (A and B). Work closely with Enterprise Sales team, defining the best strategy to approach new leads and focus on target verticals. Provide ongoing feedback to the sales and marketing department for continuous process optimization. Use and maintain the Salesforce for data quality. Achieve defined KPI goals. Accept feedback and training to keep continuous development with Inside Sales Team Leader and peers. Identify customer segment and vertical and/or need early in discussion in order to route properly to the Sales Enterprise Team in the region. Support Sales Team with outbound prospect accounts into the A/B segment.  Qualifications  More about you:  Experience with lead development from first contact of target customers. Minimum 1 year of experience in sales roles. Good sales-oriented communication skills. Robust negotiation skills. Passionate about creating meaningful connections. Creative problem solver with a proven ability to think strategically. Strong administrative and organizational skills, with a focus on metrics supported results.  Additional Information  Why our employees choose us (and stay)?  Awesome clients – We serve and partner with the majority of the leading mobile operators, OTTs, brands, banks, social networks, aggregators and many more. You can look forward to working with the likes of Viber, Zendesk, O2 and… Seriously, our clients are really cool. Work with the world’s leading companies and impact how they communicate with their users! Opportunity knocks. Often. – Being a part of a growing company in a growing industry – we challenge you not to grow! Whether it’s horizontal, vertical, or angular, we want to support the path that you want to carve. Learn as you grow – Starting from the Orientation Week as an onboarding program, to internal education, education resources, e-learning to external educations, we invest heavily in employee learning and development. Connect globally – Work with people from different countries, participate in the biggest IT and Telecom events, join us in our Summer Connect conference in Croatia. We put the “global” in globalisation. Pay & Perks – Competitive salary, travel allowances, expatriate compensation packages for your business trips, rewards and holiday bonuses, a team taking care of all the equipment you need, team buildings and other organised activities, company library, organised sports, kitchen stocked with the usual suspects… Talk about a balanced lifestyle!

Job Description  Purpose  Responsible for managing and growing existing business to achieve BillerudKorsnäs organizational objectives. Requires the ability to lead and work with a team on projects with a high degree of complexity. Success or failure in the role will impact company profitability.  The position’s main tasks and areas of responsibility  Work with the Global Account Manager/Global Account team to develop and prepare strategic account plans  Develop value proposition for existing business to increase sales and profitability as part of the Global Account team  Build outstanding relationships and perform leading role in communication and coordination with key regional Brand and OEM contacts, cultivate relationships and document as part of the Global relationship and influence mapping process  Analyze customer requirements and develop solutions matched to customer needs to expand services and products in region  Help finalize business terms with customer and internal contact points as part of Global Account team  Schedule and report on key performance indicators in combination with regional and Global quarterly business reviews with key customer contacts  Understand the supply / demand balance, market pricing, competitive activity, cost to serve and expand all sales channels  Work closely with internal managers to insure a coordinated process from order to delivery  Facilitate and develop improvement projects within the region to ensure optimal customer delivery as part of the Global account team and assist in implementing projects effectively to ensure customer satisfaction  Assist finance department for collections in exception cases. Work to ensure prompt payment or collections when needed  Assist the packaging development team to interface with customers where appropriate. Double-check with customer on graphics, structure, dimension, and function  Ensure compliance to all management reporting requirements and monitor work according to company policies  Maintain and update knowledge on relevant new technology and participate in various professional meetings  Customer and internal travel as required including field tours and audits  Qualifications  Education/level of education  Bachelor’s degree with 10 years equivalent work experience  Experience (professional experience/industry experience) Minimum 2 years of solution-based sales/account management experience Minimum of 2 years of professional experience in one or more of the following areas: Printing processes and/or converting plant operations Packaging line operations and cost drivers Global supply chains including inventory management, fulfillment, and distribution Good understanding of markets and customers of packaging solutions and intermediate understanding in packaging products and sourcing/trading processes Skills (languages, computer, etc.) Good command of both spoken and written English and local language(Chinese) Strong negotiation and interpersonal skills Personal qualities  Important personal qualities Proven ability to sell packaging solutions Innate desire to sell value-added service Natural affinity for and curiosity about retail and transport packaging design Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a multi-cultural environment Proven negotiation and assertive communication skills Ability to remain calm and professional during times of stress Proven resilience (i.e. ability to be told “no” multiple times and to recover quickly) Ability to manage multiple competing deadlines Intermediate math skills (algebra/medium level statistics) Professional experience with CRM Proven ethical business practices Contact  temmy.yuan@billerudkorsnas.com  Application information  WHAT IF you could go to work and help create a sustainable future? As a leading supplier of renewable packaging materials and solutions it is our way of challenging ourselves, our customers and all kinds of conventional packaging to promote a sustainable future. Safety is our first priority and we have an informal and improvement-focused corporate culture that encourages every employee to think outside the box, work as a team player, take responsibility and create value. BillerudKorsnäs is an international company with local roots, and with strong focus on growth and development. Do you want to grow together with us and challenge conventional packaging for a sustainable future?
industries: Paper & Forest Products and Packaging and Containers

description: Responsibilities Manage sales territories to sell product in vascular area. Provide technical support at every point of sales & marketing activities. Become knowledgeable of major product lines. Understand and communicate customer requirements and interact with customers, grow new clients as well as manage and retain the current customer base. Serve also as the point of contact for pre-sales support issues, and post-sales support issues, including status of complaints/problems, special deals, follow-up with customers’ orders, etc. Requirements Bachelor or above. Major in Medicine, Pharmaceutical, biological science or related fields Medical Device industry and Pharmaceutical, experience on MNC is proffered. 3 years or above sales experience. Familiar with HCP selling module and good connection with major hospital in Vascular area. Good experience on dealer management in the area. Ability to work under pressure, positive attitude, multi-task, prioritize and goal-focused. Partners with sales force & marketing team. Interpersonal communication skills. Good in Mandarin and English. Microsoft is needed. Mobility: 30% or above.

Key Responsibility 主要职责： Manage sales territories to sell product in vascular area. Provide technical support at every point of sales & marketing activities. Become knowledgeable of major product lines. Understand and communicate customer requirements and interact with customers, grow new clients as well as manage and retain the current customer base. Serve also as the point of contact for pre-sales support issues, and post-sales support issues, including status of complaints/problems, special deals, follow-up with customers’ orders, etc. Qualifications & Skills职位要求： Bachelor or above. Major in Medicine, Pharmaceutical, biological science or related fields Medical Device industry and Pharmaceutical, experience an MNC is preferred. 3 years or above sales experience. Familiar with HCP selling module and good connection with major hospital in Vascular area. Good experience on dealer management in the area. Ability to work under pressure, positive attitude, multi-task, prioritize and goal-focused. Partners with sales force & marketing team. Interpersonal communication skills. Good in Mandarin and English. Microsoft is needed. Mobility: 30% or above.

Job Profile Summary Grade IResponsible for delivering the indirect sales strategy and financial performance targets including Sales Volume, Gross Margin and Overdue, managing local distributor partners and intermediaries/resellers in the sales territory or geography, finding prospect partners, coaching distributors and monitoring their financial position to ensure long term sustainable value for the company. The scope of the role will influence the grade – this can include financial accountability, geographical scope, leadership responsibilities and overall level of responsibility.  Job Advert Purpose of role： The Workshop Sales Specialist role exists to manage local top workshop partners in the sales territory. The role is accountable for delivery of the PCO IWS indirect workshop sales strategy and execution of market offer strategy. The role is also responsible of finding and developing prospect partners, and finally contribute to territory distributor’s sales performance. Accountabilities Implement country PCO IWS indirect business strategy within territory by translating it into clear business plans. Deliver IWS channel strategy by developing new customer and continuously improving existing customer in store share in top workshops. Work closely with IWS Territory Manager and Distributor Sales team to secure and improve Castrol market share in workshop level, and finally contribute significant financial performance to distributors. Leverage cross function resources and joint approach for the best outcome. Develop, agree (both internally and externally) and implement the market offer strategy with the Channel partner, providing permanent support in all areas of its contents, and in particular regarding: sales capability (skills and knowledge) b. customer offer deployment, coverage and satisfaction  c. financial Return on Investment and cash flow performance  d. brand representation and compliance  e. HSSE and Ethical compliance Collect the information about the key customer database and manage the pipeline of key customer development. Develop and manage the business relationship with the key customers in the area by using the tools and resources smartly to deliver the desired business results. Share field findings and experience at team level, extracting comparable information. Improve and deliver customer experience in targeted sectors and customer groups. Ensure delivery of our promises by seeking continuous improvement and efficiency in all operations making sure the voice of the customer is represented in every decision we make. Drive standardization of our sales offers in line with our basic customer offer. Ensure that all activities conducted through 3rd parties or intermediaries in country comply fully with our own CoC and local competition legalisation. Ensure compliance with country regulations, bp Group, Segment and regional policies and standards. Experience & Expertise Minimum 3 years working experience in distributor sales and management Track record of delivery of sales targets and performance Experience/track record/confidence representing the company externally and dealing professionally with distributors and workshops. Experience of managing negotiations at senior level. Capability to work independently but also skillful on teamwork. Ability to develop and implement strategic and tactical business plans. Ability to be hands on and drive the business with direct responsibility Flexibility of thought and action to be able to respond to changing market environments and dynamic business situations Adapted for frequent business travel Entity Customers & Products  Job Family Group Sales Group  Relocation available No  Travel Required Yes - up to 75%  Time Type Full time  Country China  About BP CUSTOMER AND PRODUCTS We’re gearing up for the future. At bp our goal for C&P is to deliver the future of mobility, energy and services for our customers by innovating with new business models and service platforms.  C&P will become a hub, housing our midstream, lubricants, aviation, sale of chemicals, mobility and convenience, marketing and our next-generation businesses, making it a highly integrated and interconnected organisation. And with safety being our core value, our commitment to safe and reliable operations will never change.  Want to join the team? This means: being customer-centric, agile and responsive to changing customer needs and dynamic markets focusing on growth and development of customer offers optimising the chemicals and fuels value chains to maximise integrated value contributing to the reduction of carbon intensity of the products we create, and sell, by 50% by 2050 or sooner creating strategic partnerships that drive long-term value for C&P being digitally enabled and empowered by customer insights and data to deliver solutions. Experience Level Intermediate

该职位旨在推动公司业务发展，开拓生意新的发展渠道，管理所辖区域内的销售工作（包括：销量指标达成、销售活动执行及检查、费用监督及管理、应收账款管理等）华北大批发客户管理和经销商管理，确保价盘稳定，控制北京及廊坊的批发渠道。所辖区域: 负责北京地区GT渠道的销售管理。  主要工作职责： 完成销售指标、执行指标并完成各项计划目标 制定所负责客户的生意发展计划;开拓直接客户，包括经销商、批发商和二分客户 预算执行、控制及监督管理，确保费用使用的有效性及真实性 监督管理经销商和门店的OSI（进销存）及DMS系统，确保足量按时送货 华北大批发客户，确保价盘稳定，控制北京及廊坊的批发渠道 协助经销管理库存和应收账款，确保库存合理和应收账款可控 费用及时核销和市场费用分配，确保市场费用使用合理性 及时准确地向公司反馈市场动态，包括竞争状况、问题、阻碍和机会等 基本技能/经验/能力要求： 大专或以上学历 有5年以上相关销售经验 优先技能/经验/能力： 能熟练应用电脑及办公软件；有一定的语言处理能力 对于所属地区的业务具有敏感度；对数据要有敏锐性，善于分析生意的机会点 有效的进行客户管理 工作要求： 全职 根据业务需要进行出差 SC Johnson Asia has been recognized as the Best Multinational Workplace by Great Place to Work®!  Not ready to apply? Sign up for Job Alerts.

description: Company Info  Teva is a global pharmaceutical leader and the world's largest generic medicines producer, committed to improving health and increasing access to quality health solutions worldwide. Our employees are at the core of our success, with colleagues in over 80 countries delivering the world's largest medicine cabinet to 200 million people every day. We offer a uniquely diverse portfolio of products and solutions for patients and we've built a promising pipeline centered around our core therapeutic areas. We are continually developing patient-centric solutions and significantly growing both our generic and specialty medicines business through investment in research and development, marketing, business development and innovation. This is how we improve health and enable people to live better, healthier lives. Join us on our journey of growth!  Job Description Manages a medium domestic territory -- Develops expertise in an aspect of business, financials, products/services, the market and the needs of assigned accounts -- Leads a small sales team on an ad hoc basis to meet specific client needs -- Provides informal guidance to junior staff -- Has a solid understanding of business, financials, products/services, the market and the needs of assigned accounts; may help develop colleagues understanding; may be recognized as an expert in one area -- Complexity is high (territory/account, products/services, sales or account management process); may serve as team lead -- Has high level of authority/opportunity to set and negotiate product/service terms -- Plans own territory or account approach and manages own resources Qualifications  Function  Sales  Sub Function  Medical Representation  Reports To  In process of validation  Already Working @TEVA?  If you are a current Teva employee, please apply using the internal career site available on "Employee Central". By doing so, your application will be treated with priority. You will also be able to see opportunities that are open exclusively to Teva employees. Use the following link to search and apply: Internal Career Site  The internal career site is available from your home network as well. If you have trouble accessing your EC account, please contact your local HR/IT partner.  Teva’s Equal Employment Opportunity Commitment  Teva Pharmaceuticals is committed to equal opportunity in employment. It is Teva's global policy that equal employment opportunity be provided without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, ancestry, veteran status, national or ethnic origin or any other legally recognized status entitled to protection under applicable laws. Be the front line seller who drives sales, identifying and generating opportunities for different kinds of customers. You will foster client satisfaction by maintaining regular customer contact and managing customer expectations. You will develop customer relationships through coordinating and/or attending trade shows, seminar, and similar events. You will provide education of Honeywell product through technical presentations. You will maintain, and provide reports and opportunity status using our customer relationship management system. You will provide competitive intelligence and market trends. You will provide forecast/demand input to Sales Inventory Operations Planning (SIOP).  Key Responsibilities Attend (trade shows, seminars, events) Visit Customers Search for New Customers Campaign Management Customer Reporting Learn the Products Customer Account Management YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree, or equivalent. Some experience in the field. WE VALUE A proficient understanding of key sales principles and best practices Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization An ability to influence customers, while maintaining healthy relationships Significant experience in selling (industrial) products Deep technical expertise Understanding of the Honeywell value proposition as well as the competitive landscape Additional Information JOB ID: req309376 Category: Sales Location: #1 Building, No.14 Jiu Xian Qiao Road,ChaoYang District,Beijing,BEIJING,100016,China Exempt

description: About the Position:  Siemens Account Development Representatives work directly with selling teams, in an assigned region, to identify, penetrate, and cultivate new business opportunities. Execution of new business strategies will include research, cold calling, and advanced qualification. Team members will set meetings, schedule technical resources, track activity and proactively update selling teams on next steps for new and developing opportunities.  Team members will also be responsible for opening new accounts or new departments in existing customer base. Works on assignments that are routine in nature, requiring limited judgment. Works under moderate supervision and usually receives detailed instructions on all work. Works on assignments that are moderately difficult, requiring judgment in resolving issues or in making recommendations. Works under minimal supervision, receiving little instruction on daily work and general instructions on newly introduced assignments.  This position must be highly proficient in communication and coordination with internal organizations. Stakeholders must understand the overall value proposition of the solutions they are selling and be able to quickly communicate the message. Success in the position depends heavily on building a trusted partnership with the local sales team to define a dynamic list of target accounts and agreement on upfront pursuit strategies.  Responsibility  Target account development and management:  Prepare and setup for outbound daily calls and other pursuit strategies Conduct initial phone qualification and research on assigned target accounts to gather intelligence Build prospect interest in the products and services offered by Siemens PLM Software through web, social media, e-mail and primarily phone interaction Enrich and profile our databases (Eloqua and SalesForce) to identify new interest Systematically follow-up all target account activities to develop total qualified opportunities that produce an above average close rate  Requirement  This position requires an individual who is able to interact with a large variety of people: sales and marketing teams, customers, prospects and specialists from various industrial sectors and at different levels of responsibility including the executive level. Building relationships over the phone to develop business is essential. The individual must be articulate and have story-telling ability Fearless and Persistence in cold calling new account targets Growing existing accounts in new divisions and qualifying new business prospects Proven ability to open doors, and build relationships at all levels in an organization Able to think creatively and apply new ideas to overcome objections and barriers Works well on a team and has strong communication skills Highly organized and can manage a large volume of opportunities Proficient in using CRM systems (Salesforce) Ability to research and quickly simulate information into action Self-motivated and target driven Inside sales and/or direct selling experience Engineering and or technical background is preferred Minimum 5 year related working experience is required  Organization: Digital Industries  Company: Siemens Industry Software (Shanghai) Co., Ltd.  Experience Level: Early Professional  Job Type: Full-time
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Product Management

description: About Kentik  Kentik is the network observability company. Our platform is a must-have for the network front line, whether digital business, corporate IT, or service provider. Network professionals turn to the Kentik Network Observability Cloud to plan, run, and fix any network, relying on our infinite granularity, AI-driven insights, and insanely fast search. Kentik makes sense of network, cloud, host, and container flow, Internet routing, performance tests, and network metrics. We show network pros what they need to know about their network performance, health, and security to make their business-critical services shine. Networks power the world’s most valuable companies, and those companies trust Kentik. Market leaders like IBM, Box, and Zoom rely on Kentik for network observability. Visit us at kentik.com and follow us at @kentikinc.  The true meaning of Kentik is visibility. We are committed to making sure everyone feels empowered to use their voice, has a sense of belonging and is represented at Kentik. We don’t look for individuals who fit the culture, but those who will continue to add to the culture. We encourage everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in the industry: people of color, LGBTQI+ community, women, individuals with disabilities (both seen and unseen), veterans, people of any age or family status.  About The Role  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is the crucial first touchpoint into prospective customers in our Asia-Pacific Market. SDRs at Kentik drive targeting and outreach to prospective customers in partnership with the field sales team. Once trained, this role provides an opportunity for creative thinking and approach to meet the business objectives laid out by leadership. SDRs will enjoy working with and learning from the mentoring of great sellers, strong leadership, and an environment of support, learning, and career advancement. You have multiple options as an SDR in terms of your future career path, including joining the Sales ranks, Customer Success, Marketing, and other departments within Kentik, as well as potentially stepping into management.  Responsibilities Work with RSMs to build territory plans for outreach Qualifying Inbound and Outbound leads thru personalized email communications Schedule meetings with the Sales team for new opportunities Generate interest and create opportunities with new prospects through outbound cold calls and emails Decide which accounts to target and whom to reach out to Meet your monthly and quarterly targets Perform the research on targeted accounts Meet your daily and weekly activity goals Qualify prospective customers and understand an organization’s business Drive interest in and schedule meetings at industry events throughout the calendar year Create strategic activities leading up to industry events to allow entire sales team to efficiently execute during event meetings  Requirements Location: Singapore At least 1 years experience as an SDR/BDR/Inside Sales in the enterprise software space Familiarity working with the following tools: Salesforce, Salesloft/Outreach, LinkedIn Navigator, MSOffice, ZoomInfo Multilingual with English and second language of: Mandarin, Japanese, Korean, Hindi, and others Understanding of Sales, Sales Development, Business Development, and Lead Generation processes and needs Excellent verbal and written communications skills Strong listening and presentation skills Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively Strong time, project management skills and ability to work autonomously, while being proactive in working with cross-functional teams to learn and grow Ability to work effectively within and across multiple timezones in the APAC region Have a proactive work style that ensures you stay in touch with remote teams, managers and RSMs to stay aligned and productive  Bonus points Understanding of basic networking terminology  Benefits* Medical, Dental, and Vision that is 100% covered for employees & dependents Health Reimbursement Account Wellness Benefits Maternity/Paternity leave Stock Options Flexible time off Vanguard 401(k) Benefits are as listed for US employees. Local health insurance coverage and similar benefits are provided for employees outside of the US.  Why work at Kentik?  We offer a competitive salary, first-rate benefits and the chance to work at a fast-growing, well-funded startup that builds something special: the industry's most powerful observability platform for the network professional. You will have the opportunity to work alongside world-class engineers, network experts, and technology thought leaders to build the future of digital operations. Kentik is headquartered in San Francisco with team members around the world.

Job Description  1. POSITION: (Asso.) Training Manager  2. DIVISION: Core Diagnostics  3. FUNCTION: Commercial Excellence  4. REPORTS TO: Associate National Commercial Training Director  5. NO. OF DIRECT REPORTS: N/A  6. EDUCATION REQUIREMENT: Bachelor’s degree  Major Responsibilities Training needs analysis to obtain the requirements of the organization in Core Diagnostics China. Work with business leaders to develop, deliver and search training programs based on job functions to support business strategies. Evaluate and report the training effectives by post course consulting and coaching solutions to maximize transfer of learning to the business. Commercial training to sales team on sales process and CRM management. Support Core Diagnostics Area & Global Training in the designing and customizing appropriate curriculum and learning solutions that meet business needs in local country. Requirements Five years or more of training, marketing and /or sales management in healthcare industry. Be willing to provide direction and coach to others. Be accomplished in observing behaviors. jobTitle: Vice President, Specialist Sales - Test & Learn
description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Vice President, Specialist Sales - Test & Learn  Who is Mastercard  What role do we play in the modern world? Are we an enabler of purchases or a facilitator for transactions? We play a much larger role in the world by enabling those that have no access to financial systems – every employee has the opportunity to be a part of something bigger and to change lives. We have the technology, people and Brand to serve modern society. Today, we are a global tech company that connects everyone to endless possibilities, priceless possibilities.  Overview  The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include payments-focused consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, business Test & Learn experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services. Client verticals include Financial Institutions, Retail & Commerce and Digital Partners, Governments and many others.  Role  Vice President role supporting Test & Learn platform sales in China and/or Japan, leveraged by 300+ clients globally and growing revenue with new clients in key segments (Digital, Tech, Retail, Restaurants, Travel). Responsible for developing and executing the sales strategy for a key set of prospect accounts within China and/or Japan to secure multimillion-dollar, multi-year deals Build and develop a cold pipeline into an active one, ultimately progressing to signed platform deals Ability to message the benefits of bundling Test & Learn with other Data & Services products (SessionM, Managed Services, SpendingPulse, Customer Data Enhancement, etc.) Advocate for funding incentives the Market Development team and with Mastercard Core for CBA penetration Strong communication and influencing skills, should be a compelling presenter to senior client audiences and able to influence large deals Ability to seamlessly partner across our Data & Services Sales CBL population Proficiency in Mandarin and/or Japanese Excellent problem solving and analytics skills and should be able to go head to head with internal stakeholders and customers alike with fact-based thinking Will serve as the face of Mastercard D&S to senior level client stakeholders, including c-suite  All About You Deep understanding of the suite of Mastercard Data & Services value propositions with a thoughtful approach to executing within and across markets Deep understanding of the Mastercard merchant business and account management function Strong commercial drive with ability to build and monetize senior client relationships based on empathy, thought leadership and subject matter expertise Strong software or data driven solution selling background with success with 12-18+ month sales cycles; never give up attitude, excellent at ‘pounding the pavement’ through email/phone cold outreach 15+ years of progressively complex hunting sales within Financial Services, Digital / Retail / Restaurants / Tech / sectors; rolodex of C-Level / EVP / SVP contacts preferred Ability to thrive and build robust pipeline with limited lead generation support Strong networker across relevant stakeholder base with the ability to listen, build common ground and influence in order to effectively advance business opportunities and generate revenues Revenue management and P&L experience Revenue goal-setting abilities Top-level sales skills (internally and externally) combined with strong negotiation capabilities required for large deals  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

Business Development Manager - Remote (China)  App Annie is always looking for extraordinary candidates with Mobile, SaaS, analytics background and we'd love to get to know you! We do not have any current openings for a Business Development Manger in this location, however, in the event that a position opens up, we'd love for you to be the first person to know! Below is what we traditionally look for:  Something About Us...  App Annie is the industry’s most trusted mobile data and analytics platform. Our mission is to help customers create winning mobile experiences and achieve excellence. We created the mobile app data market and are committed to delivering the industry’s most complete mobile performance offering. More than 1,200 enterprise clients and 1 million registered users across the globe and spanning all industries rely on App Annie as the standard to revolutionize their mobile business. We are headquartered in San Francisco with 12 offices worldwide.  Along with a market defining product, we take great pride in our culture and values and strive to embody them daily! We set a high bar for our success and have made Excellence as our standard, hold each other Accountable, continuously push Innovation and Win with Style.  What can you tell your friends when they ask you what you do?  As an App Annie Business Development Manager, you are a high-energy, driven individual with knowledge of technology and solid business-to-business sales and account management experience. AA offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be empowered to sell advertising analytics to the world's most innovative brands and publishers. Our goal is to build an organization of smart, ambitious team members committed to our mission and focused on winning, but always doing it right. Bias to action, bias to learning everyday, self-starter, great collaborator, and focused on learning and growing daily.  At AA, integrity and reliability are as important as talent and effort.  You will be responsible for and take pride in…. Drive adoption, engagement, and usage across the Connect product set for all market segment Showcase the value of our App Annie Connect offering to new and existing customers Forecast sales activity and critical achievements in salesforce.com, while creating satisfied and reference-able customers Ability to decipher key product gaps within the current product offering and regularly provide feedback to the product team. Ability to work effectively Cross-functionally as well as globally Exceptional customer relationship skills, and time management Bias towards high activity, (calls, emails, webinars, content, etc) Strong analytical ability to spot data trends, and uncover key customer insights desired. You should recognize yourself in the following… Experience managing complex sales-cycles Previous Sales Methodology training 3-4 years sales experience w/at least 24 months in closing role Strong, demonstrated written and verbal communication skills Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment Track record of over-achieving quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions Strong customer references What We Offer… We provide a WFH allowance to set you up for remote work success. Internet allowance for stable internet connection, so your video does not freeze on Zoom. Flexible working days. We love to meet, but if you need to get your kids behind school-zoom, need to leave early to get to your band repetition or gym classes, do your thing. Paid leave, so long as you promise to come back! Health and dental benefits. An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations. Wellbeing allowance for any activity that matters to your wellbeing; (online) gym classes, fitness equipment, mindfulness apps or even childcare support! Unlimited access to online learning platform Udemy to help you develop your skills. Virtual initiatives and events to keep you connected with your colleagues. Yes, I want this job!
