Job Description  This is a commissioned sales position to influencing and advocating Intel based products and solutions for all of Intel's Business units through a vertical oriented, solutions led approach to Business and IT. Responsible for working with a leading internet customer where deep engagements is required with thorough long term account strategy to achieve revenue and deal win target. Impact should result in both executive level and working level as trusted advisor which should drive our relevance, KPI, demands, preference and pull for our strategic focus areas to maximize Intel portfolio selling. At the same time, candidates need to have good product, technical knowledge and marketing insight, and drive customers to transit to products and explore new cooperation opportunities as soon as possible. Candidates need to have strong English writing, summary and presentation in PPT, and If candidates have market analysis ability, it is better. Candidates need to be able to work under pressure and take initiative in team work  Qualifications BS or MS degree with minimum 5 years of IT selling experience, at least 2 years of working experience in internet industry Able to build and maintain strong, long-lasting executive level customer relationships Thrives in an ambiguous environment and able to lead changes and develop creative solutions Ability to work under pressure, with multiple projects would be a great advantage Knowledge of Intel architecture, platform and general datacenter platform will be a plus Strong communication skill with internal stakeholders and external clients/partners Inside this Business Group  Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customers voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. Our teams work across the entire sales cycle, pushing ingredient products to our "billings" customers while also pulling end solutions through to "consumption". We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

jobTitle: Sr Sales Representative, Shanghai, ADM, PMT
description: Be the front line seller who drives sales, identifying and generating opportunities for different kinds of customers. You will foster client satisfaction by maintaining regular customer contact and managing customer expectations. You will develop customer relationships through coordinating and/or attending trade shows, seminar, and similar events. You will provide education of Honeywell product through technical presentations. You will maintain, and provide reports and opportunity status using our customer relationship management system. You will provide competitive intelligence and market trends. You will provide forecast/demand input to Sales Inventory Operations Planning (SIOP).  Key Responsibilities Attend (trade shows, seminars, events) Visit Customers Search for New Customers Campaign Management Customer Reporting Learn the Products Customer Account Management YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree, or equivalent. Some experience in the field. WE VALUE A proficient understanding of key sales principles and best practices Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization An ability to influence customers, while maintaining healthy relationships Significant experience in selling (industrial) products Deep technical expertise Understanding of the Honeywell value proposition as well as the competitive landscape Additional Information JOB ID: HRD134558 Category: Sales Location: Building 1, Lane 555, Huan Ke Road, Zhangjiang,Shanghai,SHANGHAI,201203,China Exempt
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Key Responsibilities主要职责： 管理客户关系并提供相关服务，根据既定的市场开发原则在指定区域开拓新的客户，并保持从现有客户获得持续的销售业绩。 提供销售，活动及成本预算方面的信息，以利于销售经理做出有效的判断。 在既定的客户中，根据系统的调研和沟通，最大可能的发现影响客户现在及未来的商业机会及购买决定。 制定客户开发计划，并达到销售目标。 随时给医疗专家提供产品技术支持。 在负责的相关销售区域，了解当地的医疗市场及影响客户选择的竞争对手策略。 学习以保持对公司产品、临床应用、管理法规要求的质量标准和业务政策的及时理解。 Professional Knowledge, Skills & Qualifications任职要求： 2年及以上稳定的医药产品销售经验 (药品，耗材，设备均可） 本科及以上学历 (医学/药学/生物学等专业背景优先） 良好的沟通能力 良好的人际交往能力 良好的团队意识 良好的英文基础（CET-6，书写及口语） 可适应长短期出差

Donaldson is committed to solving the world’ s most complex filtration challenges. Employing innovation and breakthrough solutions, we are advancing filtration for a cleaner world. We look for the best people to help us succeed, offering opportunities to learn, effect change, and make meaningful contributions at work and in our communities. This is a place where you can make a world of difference.  Follow Us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/donaldson/  Job Purpose  New segment business development manager, responsible for IAF business development in Li-battery, Polysilicon and Pharmaceutical segments , need to define business strategy, win the breakthrough, accumulate application expertise and set up scalability in target segments .  Key Accountability Be responsible for IAF business development in Li-battery, Polysilicon and Pharmaceutical segments. Study and work out the whole process maps, application opportunities, customer requirements and key pain points in filtration. Drive new product development, build up solution offering and value story to meet customer expectation. Win the key breakthroughs in target application and ensure successfully commissioning, drive the team to accumulate industrial expertise and segment know-how. Work out segment story(PPT), be responsible for the segment branding, participate promotion events and exhibitions, as well as industry conferences; Build up cooperation and relationship with key players in target segments: key End Users, key OEMs, key Design Institutes, General Contractors and key Dealers; Work out the selling tools in focused segments, including segment PPT, brochures, success stories, application PPT, playbook… Conduct internal segment training to EQT and AFM sales to ensure the opportunities can be followed up effectively. Build up business scalability in targeted segments. Define segment business strategy and plan, drive and monitor business progress as segment business leader. Key Qualifications & Requirements Bachelor’s degree or above, majored in Engineering and Science Great communication and presentation skills, expert level interpersonal skills; Strong business sense, Systematic thinking, outstanding planning and execution skills; Proven success working in a fast-paced, high-growth environment Good time-management skills Detail oriented, result oriented, customer oriented, ambitious and aggressive Open-minded and continuous learning Keen to business opportunities, eager to win >5 years’ technical experience in Li-battery, Polysilicon or Pharmaceutical industries. Or >5 years on-hand sales experience in filtration industry. A plus for good relationships with potential customer; Able to read and write English and Chinese ~30% domestic travel Come make a World of Difference! Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Analyst, Market Development  Overview The role of Analyst - Sales within the China Acceptance & Merchant Development team will support and contribute to the overall Acceptance & Merchant priorities in China. These include: (1) Supporting relationships with key acquirers and developing tangible value and assets – elevating and deepening the overall Mastercard engagement with acquirers and acceptance stakeholders as a key customer segments (2) Expanding acceptance and development key merchants to realize the vision of a “World Beyond Cash” – growing acceptance into new and untapped categories. (3) Supporting the diversification and transformation of the CHINA acquiring landscape – addressing and building acceptance opportunities and solutions with new enablers and partners (e.g. CGIs, PSPs, Hardware providers, etc.). By developing and supporting the above priorities, the individual will need to create tangible value for the key acceptance stakeholders and key merchants, address key challenges and opportunities, as well as driving incremental business, product innovation, best practices, strategic thinking and leadership. The role holder will oversee the key acceptance & merchant initiatives as part of focused segment/channel/vertical approach. The individual will need to look at the acceptance system holistically, deal with issues and questions on the acquiring landscape, and business models and proactively identify business opportunities and solutions. The individual will work in China with Acceptance Development teams in division and globally, country managers, account managers and product teams.  Role Facilitate and accelerate introduction of new acceptance players, business models and technologies into the CHINA acquiring landscape Support the management of key acquiring relationships both from a business development (e.g. acceptance growth, close domestic gap, co-brand card and value add products) and operational perspective (e.g. rules, franchise, product delivery) Identify product synergies/sales opportunities that support relationship development and Mastercard revenue growth (i.e. value add capabilities such as marketing, product, processing, Advisors, co-branded card, digital solution, etc.) Proactively identify and address acceptance barriers and pain points – develop models and frameworks in order to create new solutions (e.g. Pricing, Franchise, non-compliance, Legal, Treasury) that can help to overcome acceptance friction Lead ad-hoc research projects, special projects, customer resolutions  All About You Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced degree or equivalent work experience applying sales leadership preferred Experience and knowledge in the payments business with exposure to acceptance, acquirer & merchant issues is preferred Sales strategy development, execution, and account management Proven track record of sales success and ability to meet sales targets Strong leadership, presentation, and sales skills Solid interpersonal skills and the ability to work well in team environment and ability to effectively coordinate with peers, and ability to work in a matrix organization  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.
industries: Financial Services, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: Media.Monks is a digital-first marketing and advertising services company connecting the dots across content, data & digital media and technology services. Inspired by the connectivity and flexibility of technology APIs, Media.Monks’ single-P&L model offers brands seamless access to a nearly 6,000-strong team of digital talent organized across 57 talent hubs in 33 countries.  With us, you'll find a diverse group of colleagues with different backgrounds and perspectives. We believe everyone has something of value to offer, and that sustaining a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace begins with fostering an environment where people can be themselves, authentically, every day. We want to build something with the potential to change the heart of our industry, and we’d love to include your unique perspective.  We are currently looking for a Business Development Manager in China to bring cutting edge online marketing solutions to advertisers and agencies around the globe.  The Role  Becoming an expert in online marketing who can suggest solutions to prospective clients based on their unique needs. Assisting in sales operations efforts to maintain the high quality and scalability of our efforts. Provide feedback to product and marketing so we can adapt quickly in the market.  Responsibilities Will Include  Taking sales from prospecting to close, both for outbound sales efforts and inbound referrals. Unearth new sales opportunities through networking and turn them into long term partnerships Manage the entire sales cycle from finding a client to securing a deal Providing consultative expertise for programmatic marketing to Advertisers Building solutions for prospective clients based on their unique needs Participating in key customer/partner presentations and maintaining excellent customer relationships throughout the company's targeted major accounts Developing access to the senior leadership of target accounts and partners Furthering relationships with strategic partners Providing feedback to operations and marketing so we can adapt quickly in the market Being an active and vocal member of the sales team internally, ensuring that the region has a major voice in the ongoing development of the company and its offerings  Qualifications/Background Sought  3-5 years of adtech/enterprise sales experience required, whether at a publisher, agency, trading desk, technology company, or other is strongly preferred. Experience selling into enterprise marketing organizations preferred Deep knowledge of and experience working with major ad-tech / mar-tech stacks (e.g. Google, Adobe, Amazon, Facebook, Baidu, Tencent, Bytedance), inclusive of DSPs, ad servers, web analytics platforms, DMPs, DCO and CRM Strong verbal, visual and written communication skills in both English and Mandarin, particularly in blending analysis and narrative to create compelling slide presentations and business proposals Knowledge of market research, sales and negotiating principles Consistent record of exceeding sales targets Ability to deliver engaging presentations High level of attention to detail and organizational skills Exceptional ability to learn, adapt, discover and test new ideas Desire to work in a fast-paced, high-pressure, and fun startup environment Desire to build a company up from an early stage Ambitious self-starter who can ramp up quickly Preferred to be based in Shanghai or Shenzhen  About Media.Monks  At Media.Monks, you’ll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to win the decade by changing the industry for good. Partner to 8 of the 10 most innovative companies in the world, Media.Monks works with established as well as up-and-coming global, regional, DTC and B2B brands, helping them own their data and build out customer ecosystems to elicit smart, efficient, high-impact engines for growth. We deliver table stakes quickly, creating cost efficiencies from day one to push up the creative effectiveness of our work with every cycle.  We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.

Some experience in the field. WE VALUE A proficient understanding of key sales principles and best practices Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization An ability to influence customers, while maintaining healthy relationships Significant experience in selling (industrial) products Deep technical expertise Understanding of the Honeywell value proposition as well as the competitive landscape Additional Information JOB ID: HRD138093 Category: Sales Location: #1 Building, No.14 Jiu Xian Qiao Road,ChaoYang District,Beijing,BEIJING,100016,China Exempt

description: Company Description  The Supply Chain Operations organisation with its about 800 co-workers connects our customers with IKEA products in a simple, affordable and sustainable way. We deliver excellent transport and logistic solutions today, tomorrow and over time by optimising replenishment solutions, defining physical goods flow capacity needs, managing the goods flow, sourcing & developing transport & logistics capacities and leading & securing Supply Quality.  We contribute to customer satisfaction through securing customer perceived availability, delivering lowest cost over time, leading towards sustainability and ensuring the right quality for all services.  Job Description  As a Business Developer Category Ocean & Air you are a part of the global team and report to the Business Development Manager. You are responsible for establishing strong business relationships with current and new service providers. You ensure that the development work and the daily performance secures a partnership that benefits IKEA in the long term. This includes setting clear goals and development plans, supporting both carrier and category development. You work together with other functions in and outside of the Ocean Category, such as the category analysts, trade lane teams, business, operations, and sustainability developers. You should continuously look for opportunities to improve the IKEA transport network set-up, matching the service provider’s offer with IKEA’s needs today and tomorrow in regard to capacity and sales growth, sustainability development and operational efficiency. Additionally, you contribute to the development of global sourcing procedures and methods. During tender projects you are responsible for all stages from invitation to contract implementation.  Qualifications  As a person you are business and commercially minded in addition being cost conscious as well as experienced in negotiating with business partners. You have a strong drive, desire and motivation to improve and look for better solutions. You are self-motivated and have the ability to organise, structure, and prioritise numerous tasks. We believe that you have experience in project management and change processes. We place emphasis on your personal skills; to be successful in the role it is very important that your communication and social skills are excellent, and that you are solution-oriented. Most importantly, you also have the ability to create and develop business relations. You are inspired by the IKEA culture and values. The role will require up to 20% travel throughout the year, so you must be willing to travel.  Experience Sought 5 years + shipping industry experience, preferably from a global assignment Excellent communication skills and demonstrated understanding of translating business requirements into procurement specifications in a customer centric way. With ability to maintain strong information flows back to internal stakeholders. Management experience of contract documentation, templates and processing tools experience with proven capability in negotiation, conflict resolution and stakeholder management. Experience in leading cost reduction and value improvement programs. Fact driven, strong analytical skills with ability to understand cost models, sourcing results and financial and operational impact. Ability to ensure that Direct Procurement Operations targets and metrics on supply and quality are delivered. Monitor these metrics where required, with a mind set for constant improvement. Ocean expert with broad global overview from benchmarking and analyzing best practice with proven ability to lead strategic and tactical sourcing projects and to share relevant knowledge. Awareness and understanding where Company risks and opportunities exist. Curious mind set for constant improvement. Eager to drive our ambitious sustainability and Category agenda ideally with proven project management experience.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Education Management, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: About  About Us 作为销售主任，您需要能够完成以下工作内容： 工作概述﹣(职位概述) 参与销售工作和活动来协助销售经理成功的完成客房收入和其它创收方面的预算。 主要职责﹣(职务的主要工作) 与销售经理一起计划并执行销售策略，完成预算。 销售酒店的所有设施，并跨酒店销售其它洲际酒店。 通过制定和执行工作方案来开发新业务客戶，维护现有业务客戶。 转化销售线索。 与高职位员工一起处理客户或可能成为客户的业务。 根据建立起来的监测数据接收和拒绝业务。 执行使客人熟悉环境的现场考察活动。 保持定期的电话销售模式。 监测同档次酒店并与经理就策略的更改进行交流。 参加例会。 招待潜在客户和现有重要客户以获得业务和创造更多销售额。 按要求汇报销售工作和战绩。 参加客户拜访。 与所在区域内的洲际酒店集团成员和区域预订办公室保持定期联系。 监测竞争对手的工作。 在市场上创造声誉。 协助销售经理分发宣传品和直邮广告。 与业务供应方，会展策划人，游客或会展旅行代理，旅行社，航空公司，公司，政府部门及其它与酒店业务密切相关方建立和保持联系。 依照业务需求开展工作。  Your day to day 除了以上职位描述中我们阐述的岗位要求外，您还要符合以下条件： 技能要求 具有代表酒店，品牌和公司与顾客，员工和第三方交往的能力。 具有解决问题和组织能力。 精通微软办公软件 良好的写作技能 学历 最好具有市场营销，酒店管理，商业管理或相关领域的大专学历或职业证书。 经验 1年相关工作经验，或与此相当的教育与工作经验结合的背景。  Apply

description: Position Title: Business Development Manager  Manager: Senior Director, Corporate & Society Partnership Development  Working Location: Beijing, China  Permanent Headcount  At Wiley, we welcome you for who you are, the background you bring, and embrace people who get excited about learning whether online or by book. Learning is for everyone, and so is our workplace. Bring your experiences, your perspectives, and your passion. It’s in our differences that we empower the way the world learns. Wiley is a diverse, global organization and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.  The Business Development Manager is responsible for wining new society and publisher contracts for partner services, primarily focused on corporate advertising and projects services. Also need to keep up to date with developments and regulations in the corporate and publishing markets in China, create and to be accountable for the corporate services strategy in China, in partnership with the Senior Director of Business Development.  How will you make an impact: Understands and presents current and future market trends and associated regulations in publishing and corporates (primarily healthcare and life sciences) in China Support the Society Business Development team in networking with prospective society acquisition targets Be the face of Corporate Sales at selected society pitch meetings (acquisitions and renewals) Creates and implements, in partnership with the Senior Director of Business Development, the global corporate advertising and projects services strategy Wins deals with partner societies and publishers in China around Wiley’s corporate advertising and projects services Works with the Product team to drive a program of product development and lifecycle management around corporate advertising and projects services Works with key Wiley Editorial, Marketing and Sales groups to ensure best practice in driving revenues around corporate sales Influences and motivates people, both within and outside Wiley, to take action toward achieving higher revenues around corporate sales We are looking for people who: Experience of publishing and corporate sales, ideally within health sciences related Understand the clinician/patient/drug development interface/workflow, and how content services can be applied across this spectrum Understand how content is applied and used in healthcare organizations, and of regulatory or other limiting factors, specifically as it applies to China Have influence and collaboration skill set to work extensively with colleagues in cross-functional teams, and across units within Wiley to achieve business goals About Wiley:  We are in one of the most dynamic periods in our history as technology, globalism and economic diversity create far-reaching changes in the world. As a learning business, Wiley makes meaningful contributions to research discovery and lifelong learning by helping organizations achieve their goals and people achieve success from education through their career. We may have been founded over two centuries ago, but our secret to success remains the same: change with the times and adapt to meet the ever-evolving needs of our customers. The company’s headquarters are in Hoboken, New Jersey, with operations in the U.S., Europe, Asia, Australia, and Canada.  Location/Division:  Beijing, China  Job Requisition:  47927  Time Type:  Full Time
industries: Publishing, Information Technology and Services, and E-Learning

description: 工作职责:  职务描述摘要  面向客户的员工负责赢得业务 在遵循说明和工作程序的条件下，执行标准的销售任务。可以根据工作情况的变化重新安排顺序以完成任务/职责。可能负责目标客户、稳定的地区和/或中小型销售地区。  Primary Responsibilities  Financial Performance Achieve sales and orders volumes at the target prices in assigned accounts/territory. Coordinate orders and sales forecasts within the applicable sales funnel tools and reports for in their assigned territory/accounts in conjunction with Product Sales Specialist/product Specialists. Account Management Maintain relationships, develop a business strategy, and maximize business opportunities for all GE Healthcare businesses, products & services within allocated accounts/territory (or within defined care area/department scope). Represent OneGEHC in the account or care area/department and acts as a primary customer point of contact in the allocated accounts/territory. Provide on-going feedback to management, product teams, services and marketing. Maintain Go-to-Market plans in conjunction with Zone cross functional and multi-product teams to achieve targets and grow GE’s share of customer investments in capital, diagnostics and operational expenditures. Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction through consistent high quality interactions with customer management. Build long term strategic alliance with portfolio of accounts to continue to add value, and promote Service offerings to identify and escalate commercial service needs to drive customer NPS. In cooperation with Product teams and Marketing, drive One GE Healthcare promotional events in assigned territory. Be aware of customer segmentation and promote offerings relevant to each client’s segment. Opportunity Management Prospecting for new customers and business opportunities in addition to growing and maintaining the existing customer portfolio. Prioritize new leads to create a balanced sales funnel for future sales. Lead and leverage Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialists, Care Area or Category Leaders, Service Operations and other Company resources to provide the necessary technical, clinical and business content to create a competitive differentiation. Coordinate One GE Healthcare team on assigned accounts in order to deliver solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations. Lead & coordinate multi-P&L proposals, preparing sales quotations, planning customer meetings and demonstrating equipment capabilities across diagnostic product portfolio with relevant Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialist and other sales support staff. Ensure order and configuration quality at the point of entry to ensure accuracy, configuration integrity and that all requirements are tied to documented customer inputs. Lead successful negotiation and closure of multi P&L opportunities, interfacing with all key buyer influencers. Assist Product Sales Specialists in negotiation and deal closure of single product deals as required. Promote point of sale service contracts and financing solutions and drive margin through selling value and achieving price targets. GE Product & Market awareness Develop a solid knowledge of GE product and service portfolio and competitors’ products. Develop and maintain expertise of market and technology trends in order to understand customer issues and challenges as well as educating customer on their unmet clinical and business needs. Develop and maintain deep understanding of CxO level business and clinical needs and how GE provide solutions/offerings to meet these needs differently from the competition. Compliance Adhere to and uphold highest standards of compliance to relevant international and local Regulatory and GE Healthcare Promotional Codes Adhere to all applicable GE and GE Healthcare compliance policies, codes and training requirements Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required. 任职条件:  Qualifications / Requirements Education to Bachelor Degree level or the equivalent of four years of sales experience. 2 years of strategic sales experience. 2 years experience in healthcare. Proven key account management and project planning skills. Strong customer focus and desire to continuously improve expertise Well developed listening, influencing, interpersonal and networking skills to drive collaborative culture at all levels; High level presentation skills; able to present ideas to customers in a way that produces understanding and impact. Quality Specific Goals Aware of and comply with the GEHC Quality Manual, Quality Management System, Quality Management Policy, Quality Goals, and applicable laws and regulations as they apply to this job type/position Complete all planned Quality & Compliance training within the defined deadlines Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required Knowledge and understanding of all Global Privacy and Anti-Competition Policies Knowledge and understanding of all Environmental Health Policies (including but not limited to GE Healthcare EHS Policies, GE Healthcare Fleet Rules, etc.) and operate within them to ensure that no company policy or Country / Int’l Law is broken Drive continuous improvement on all related processes, work instructions, and procedures to ensure ongoing standardization and simplification of the Quality Management System. Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

description: Our Higher Education team delivers powerful platforms, highly personalized course materials, and effective learning supplements to help students achieve their goals at every stage of their academic and professional careers.  From ALEKS to Connect to LearnSmart, the products you'll work on are used around the globe.  We have a passion for learning and believe that every student should have access to affordable, high-quality learning solutions designed to help them succeed.  With the fast-changing landscape in education and the rapid evolution to digital, McGraw Hill has an exciting opportunity as a Sales Executive to join our Beijing Higher Education team.  What is this about?  The Sales Executive will be responsible to grow our key product portfolio in China. In this role, you will own the marketing initiatives and design value proposition and compelling product messaging for key products, initiating effective go-to-market strategy, planning and executing effective marketing events/activities, integrating various market resources, and managing the key titles throughout the product life cycle to achieve annual sales target for key products.  Your Contribution To The Team Includes Develop go-to-market strategies for key products Initiate and design effective marketing activity(online/offline) for key products to raise awareness of McGraw Hill’s product Design and produce unique go-to-market strategies for key titles based on the value points to contribute to the sales growth of the key titles Provides information for management by preparing product sales forecasts and special reports and analyses Manage key products’ by analyzing product life cycle stages and formulating short- medium-, and long-term plans for the key products What can you bring to the role? Proactive sales person with effective oral and written communication skills Ability to understand the content of book and values proposition to form effective strategy and develop compelling product messaging Proven ability to manage and analyze data to derive meaningful insights and quickly diagnose and correct any problems Demonstrated passion for technology–enabled educational solutions Effective negotiation and problem resolution skills Microsoft Office Applications Proficiency (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Spirit to Win  If you can bring your dedicated passion, we can help students attain their goals and achieve their dreams. We foster a culture of helping those that want to learn, and we offer open and collaborative working environments that will enable you to succeed. Every day your individual efforts contribute to the lives of millions.  As an education innovation company, we're proud to play our part by inspiring learners around the world. If you bring your curiosity, we'll help you grow in a collaborative environment where everyone shares a passion for success.  Are you ready for a new challenge? Apply for a career at McGraw Hill and together, we'll impact the world.

Job Description  You will be part of USMNC APJ Team supporting customer Dell. Sales Operations Analyst will manage end-to-end customer supply line, act as the communication conduit between Customer, Sales, US host team and the Factory to collaborate revenue through alignment and supply commitments, to optimize supply/ demand management. You will collaborate with account team and host influencing rev forecast through data analysis, market intelligence and insightful information, trace and track business health through delivering relevant and effective business indicators and proactive liaison with stake holders. You will be responsible to drive and execute supply chain programs, to support continuous improvements of business processes and tools for effective supply chain model, to deal with various scenarios of challenges under different business models and identify issue resolutions followed by tactical executions in professional and quality manners. This position requires to build strong relationships with multiple groups cross Geos, such as internally logistics, US host teams, program teams, product supply, credit and finance and externally the customer and freight carriers which makes the role very dynamic and interactive.  Qualifications  Bachelor degree 3+ years/Master's Degree 2+ years. Experience in customer service, business operations or supply line management  Excellent communication and collaboration skills  Ability to quickly digest problems and drive solutions across a dynamic stakeholder base Proficient in SAP and Office Applications esp. Excel and Powerpoint as well as PowerBI.  Ability to synthesize complex data into a clear actionable conclusions  Flexible and ability to embrace change in a fast paced environment  Excellent analytical, organizational, influential skills, innovative, self-directed and proactive  Attentive to details, multi-tasking ability  Fluent oral and written English  Inside this Business Group  Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.

description: Ecolab is seeking a Corporate Account Manager to join its industry leading Food Retail Services team. In this position, you will provide specialized solutions and expertise to grocery stores and supermarkets, big-box stores and convenience stores to help improve food safety compliance and deliver profitable growth. You will achieve the sales and profit targets for the assigned accounts and new accounts.  What’s In It For You The opportunity to take on some of the world’s most meaningful challenges, helping customers achieve clean water, safe food, abundant energy and healthy environments The ability to make an impact and shape your career with a company that is passionate about growth The support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives and ideas to achieve our best What You Will Do Retain existing key accounts, and look for business opportunities from potential accounts, strengthening Ecolab’s penetration to achieve annual sales and profit budget. Creatively sell Ecolab’s products and services to the accounts. Identify additional needs which can be met by Ecolab. Understand the key accounts’ needs and transmit these needs to the appropriate Ecolab personnel. Resolve problems between the corporate accounts and Ecolab. Stay informed of key accounts’ personnel and policy changes and its influence on the products and services we provide and take corresponding actions. Effectively coordinate product application, blueprint trial, on-site survey, new branch launch, contract sign and implementation, equipment installation, urge payment for goods, etc. Provide the highest standard of service to key accounts. Conduct quarterly and monthly service reviews to ensure requirements are effectively met. Actively assist other business teams within Ecolab to help introduce additional product and service to current accounts. Establish, implement and develop sales strategy for key accounts. Negotiate profitable cooperation agreement with corporate accounts, ensuring new agreements have no damage to the former price. Provide trainings on how to give the key accounts more effective service to sales staff. Understand all available Ecolab resources which can support key accounts. Minimum Qualifications Bachelor Degree 5 years sales and/or account management experience in B to B industry Fluency in English Preferred Qualifications Bachelor Degree with major in food science, marketing, business administration MBA Fluent written English, and excellent oral English communication, expression and negotiation skills. Determined to pursue for a successful and rewarding sales career. Good team player, good at project management and interpersonal communication. Demonstrated ability to develop and implement corporate account sales programs. Ability in making price and understanding the importance of price items in contract, basic ability in risk management and cost control. About Ecolab Food Retail Services  Join a team of experts that provides 23.2 million food safety and compliance observations annually through audits and training. Ecolab’s Food Retail Services division specializes in solutions and expertise that help improve food safety compliance and deliver profitable growth to grocery stores, convenience stores and supermarkets. We serve as an extension of our customers’ food safety teams throughout the world, protecting their brand reputation.  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.  In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

Job Objective  The Sales Operations Analyst provides support to sales management by preparing statistical analysis and reports to sales leadership team to drive revenue growth and margin expansion, handling information requests, automation of tasks, and managing customer correspondence on an as-needed basis.  The Sales Operations Analyst will proficiently work under pressure at times to handle a wide variety of activities, effectively communicate across different functions, and consistently maintain confidentiality and discretion in all areas of performance.     Responsibilities:  * Gathering sales data from sales team & internal system to generate sell out report for sales management & bonus calculation. * Create standard operating procedures to make sure data accuracy. * Give training to educate business owners on navigation and interpretation of reports * Develop advanced multidimensional reporting to identify opportunities to drive sales growth * Assist in the preparation of internal and external correspondence for report preparation. Supporting sales management and the commercial sales team with data analysis and data requests * Build, Automate and design innovative tools that makes the sales team more effective and efficient. * Handle with capital contract and capital orders * Calculate capital rebate for distributors.    Requirements:  · Bachelor’s degree or above.  · With minimum 3-year work experiences in Operations and/or Sales Support role.  * Experience with a business intelligence tool and data visualization. * Experience with Power BI or Tableau or another BI tool is preferred. · Mastery of using Microsoft Office software, like Excel, Word, Outlook, PPT. Good at using Excel for data analysis.  · Good communication skills (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills  · Self-motivated. A good team player. Ability to work on own initiative and work under pressures. Have problem solving sense.

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

description: ASEA Consulting supports foreign invested companies selecting talents for their business in China. We are a niche market Executive Search Firm for international manufacturing and technology companies. Since 2009 we serve European and North American clients with staffing and recruiting services form our headquarters in China. For our European client we are searching now the Electronics Manager to join the EDU R&D team.  Responsibilities and Duties: Gain access to, and establish relationship to OEM’s and Tier 1s in China. Responsible for identifying short, medium and long-term projects with OEMs and Tier 1s, establish a rapport with key project owners and ensure Bodycote is recognized as a partner for such projects Develop profitable business with new customers. Responsible for the direct sales process, aiming at meeting and/or exceeding sales targets. Ensure that customers recognize the brand as their preferred option for Heat Treatment outsource Be confident and able to explain new HT technologies and how they can help on new projects In accordance with the company's development goal and market development plan, focus on developing a direct channel of sales with automotive customers in China. As project leader, advise or manage the progress of new projects, business negotiations / investments. Together with the technical engineers, conduct cost and profit analysis, organize effective quotation of the product / service. Together with the technical team, use IATF16949 tools to develop and manage new projects. According to the annual budget plan, designate advertising, planning and various exhibitions and conference activities to improve the company's reputation and attract more valuable potential customers.  Requirements: Bachelor degree or above, major in materials or engineering related major. At least more than 10 years in the automotive industry – preferably Tier 1 or OEM Prefer the candidate who is familiar with metal surface treatment process, like heat treatment, coating. Understand auto parts market, familiar with OEM manufacturers / Tier 1 and 2 Proficiency in English, good writing skills and PPT ability. Excellent sales communication ability, expression ability and customer communication ability. Familiar with IATF16949. Good team spirit, self-learning ability, hardworking and positive. Can travel frequently, with a driver's license.

工作职责:  Description  This position acts as a sales incentive analyst, to serve as a sales compensation expert for designated BU or product line:  Provide appropriate support to stakeholders to drive sales incentive process  Calculate quarterly and annual incentive for payment  Analytic report on sales incentive  GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. A minimum of 2-3 years of experience in sales operation or sales compensation for healthcare industry Familiar with sales incentive management process, strong data processing and analytical skills Team player with the ability to work cross-functionally, good communication skills with a proven record to build trusting business relationships Self-motivate, detail-oriented, reliable and respect deadlines with sense of urgency Strong sense of integrity and confidentiality Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

description: 工作职责:  Position Summary  To manage the business relationship between Visa and China clients through business development and sales efforts aimed at ensuring profitability and development of Visa’s brand, reputation and business presence and impact. This includes development and execution of business strategies, business plans, sales and projects which propagate profitable business for Visa and for the clients.  This role encompasses the first point of contact between Visa and Clients and is central to our ongoing operation and long term success. This role incorporates financial result accountability and requires financial acumen, strong business orientation and accountability. This is a multi-disciplined role which requires a broad understanding of Visa products and services, whilst at the same time strong communication and account management skills.  Responsibilities Develop and achieve country plan objectives through clients account management and business development efforts. Identify potential clients with business needs and areas for cooperation with Visa and win clients by acquiring Visa membership and launching Visa card Responsible for the engagement with the client’s relevant functions and oversee the day to day relationship with the clients. Establish and maintain positive, beneficial and constructive relationships with key stakeholders and influence clients preference for Visa through provision of valuable business solutions through Visa capabilities Deliver financial objectives including net revenue, payment volume and other targets through Visa assets, products, marketing promotion and project implementations. Co-ordinate and bond internal stakeholders to deliver cohesively compiled value added services, and support to the clients. Unite internal functions, including Product, Marketing, Risk, Operations, Finance, Client Support, and etc., to set and deliver the strategic agenda for Visa's business with the client to increase penetration of Visa's payment products and programs via the introduction of new initiatives or the expansion of existing ones. Ensure accurate financial management of the clients via the development of logical forecasting and reporting. Manage and monitor the process of the contracts with the clients. Achieve Clients Engagement Survey targets. 任职条件:  Professional Bachelor’s degree preferably in Business/Economics/Marketing Minimum 4-6 years of proven sales experience, with strong account management experience and project management experience. Technical Good project management skills Business structuring, negotiation, documentation and execution Good analytical skill to understand the profitability of new opportunities and existing business. Outstanding communication and presentation skills Excellent command of Mandarin and English MS Office and PC knowledge Business Ability to identify, develop and implement opportunities that will drive business growth for Visa and the Clients. Deep understanding of payments industry and ecosystem. Strong relationship management skills. Ability to establish and manage relationship at multi-level with internal and external clients. Confidence and ability to influence and negotiate. Target oriented, self-driven, team player.

岗位描述： 执行并完成公司的年度销售计划，完成公司下达的销售指标 根据公司市场营销战略，针对目标客户制定并实施相应的销售策略 识别现有客户的潜在需求，整合公司资源，提供多样化的服务方案 针对公司新开发的业务，对潜在客户群体执行销售策略 独立完成对新客户的前端开发工作，如陌生拜访，陌生电话等 与目标客户保持高频互动，包括但不限于电话，邮件，拜访等 与客户保持良好的沟通，实时把握客户的需求，协调内外部资源提升客户满意度 了解公司产品，价格和市场策略，独立处理询价，报价制作，合同条款协商和合同签订等事宜 在销售过程中，协调公司运营部门和技术部门，为客户提供合适的方案 根据公司要求，定期向公司提交个人工作内容汇报 岗位要求： 全日制本科毕业 3年以上的外勤销售工作经历和可追溯的销售业绩或有3年以上制造行业的工作经历 有第三方检验检测行业工作经历者为佳 良好的沟通能力和情商 良好的执行力和自我驱动力，以结果为导向 良好的英文读写能力，有听说能力者为佳 有独立思考能力及良好的学习能力 能够适应全国地区频繁的出差工作

description: Job Description Strong focus on new customer development (hunter sales) Identify suitable customers in various industries by searching the market and applying Nefab’s sales funnel Approach customers by using various channels (e.g. cold calling, social selling) to schedule meetings Approach multiple stakeholders of the same account to increase chance of success Present Nefab’s capabilities and convince potential customer to work with us Success measured by amount of new business won Work with local and global colleges from all functions to lead projects into business This position is in Chengdu, China. Our ways of working are characterized by Customer First, Cooperation and Communication. At Nefab you are expected to respect the environment, while putting customers first. In our global organization we cooperate and communicate, and you are empowered to innovate and simplify.  Application  To apply for the position, please impress us with your CV/resume written both in Chinese and English.  Following steps are common for all positions related to the Program.  Please note that steps may be added depending on the location and position. Online application First Phone/Video interview Nefab Online Assessment Personal interviews Reference checks For further information, please contact shirley.wu@nefab.com.

See why Selling Power magazine has consistently ranked Ecolab as a top company to sell for! Ecolab is seeking driven B2B sales professionals to join the commercial Pest Elimination Solutions Sales team in the United States. As a Sales Development Manager you will build & grow profitable client relationships with commercial businesses to protect their brand, their facilities, and the health and safety of their employees and customers. You will drive sales and attain budget goals by leveraging prospecting, cold calling, and networking skills to target restaurants, hospitals, hotels, retailers, food and beverage plants, schools, and nursing homes to offer the most effective B2B pest elimination programs in the United States. The new accounts you acquire will be aligned to our service team which is responsible for delivering the solutions you sell.  What’s in it For You? 开拓全新业务、全面覆盖各领域包括餐饮、酒店、超市、工厂等客户； 在既定年度销售目标下， 做好目标客户计划、制定、实施新客户销售战略，以实现销售目标和业务增长； 具备良好的沟通能力，能够向客户精准传递艺康的价值以获取业务 ； 向客户的管理团队推介服务概述、推介艺康产品及服务地整体价值 随时了解客户信息、政策调整，理解此类调整对艺康产生的影响，并能就此类影响及其对艺康产生的影响具备一定的判断能力，及时与公司相关人员进行分享。 能够与部门和公司内外各层机构进行有效沟通 能够制定价格，了解价格指导标准下价格协议产生的结果，并与客户协商达成利润协议 遵守公司和部门规章流程，并完成经理指定的各项工作任务； Competitive salary and benefits with guaranteed commissions for 2 years while you learn from successful professionals Company vehicle for business and personal use Fantastic opportunity for long term, advanced career growth in sales or sales management Flexible, independent work environment where you will plan and manage your own schedule Access to world-class resources, tools, and technology Grow your income as you drive sales through commission and bonus programs What You Will Do 专科或以上学历 熟悉PCO服务流程，具有良好销售经验或致力于销售领域发展者优先 具有较熟练的谈判技巧 能熟练使用Excel、Word、PowerPoint等办公软件 严格遵守国家法规，公司和部门规章制度和法规； 良好职业道德和素养 Prospect and obtain customers to achieve annual new business sales goals Discover sales opportunities and implement sales strategies Partner with our service team, corporate account team, and inter-company partners to implement best practices to solve customer’s pest problems Build rapport and cultivate relationships with customers and co-workers through professional demeanor and strong interpersonal skills Provide outstanding customer service by leading and educating customers throughout the sales process Keep informed of Ecolab product / service offerings and industry conditions to enhance successful customer outcomes To start, you will have the advantage of Ecolab’s world class paid training program designed to provide you the tools and resources to be one of the best in your field. Our 7 week training program will include paid travel to Ecolab Corporate Headquarters in Saint Paul, Minnesota for portions of the training. About Ecolab Pest Elimination  Learn how scientifically proven protocols help eliminate pests through 3.6 million customer visits annually. Ecolab Pest Elimination provides solutions to prevent and eliminate all types of pests in commercial buildings, food processing plants, food retail, foodservice, and many other markets. By partnering with our customers in these markets, you will have the opportunity to help protect their facilities, employees, and brands at a time when it’s more important than ever.  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.  In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

Acting as the main contact point between the company (Advantest) and assigned customers; Building and maintaining strong and long-term relationships with assigned customers at all levels (from engineers to department managers); Communicating and presenting Advantest' products, solutions and capabilities to the customers, as well as identifying and communicating the customer's technology, commercial and production needs to the company. Obtaining market and competition intelligence, customer organisational structures, product lines and road maps, and feedback to internal departments. Developing and executing sales plans to win new businesses from the customers Preparing pricing quotations; negotiating to final price and submitting documents to book orders. Working together with other internal functions to ensure timely and successful delivery of Advantest products, solutions and services to customers and/or theirs subcontractors.
