jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Telecommunications

description: We are the global test and automation specialists, powering next-generation technologies through sophisticated solutions. Behind every electronic device you use, Teradyne's test technology ensures your device works right the first time, every time! Our portfolio of automation solutions help manufacturers to develop and deliver products quickly, efficiently and cost-effectively. Together, Teradyne companies deliver manufacturing automation across industries and applications around the world!.  Responsibilities Develop the strategic direction for the combined sales, application and service team, achieve bookings targets for product and services, win all major strategic design-ins, increase our market share and margins and improve the productivity and cost efficiency across the customer team. Establish personal relationships with key decision makers at customers and their subcontractors. Provide input to key strategic decisions concerning resource prioritization, pricing, positioning, product marketing, engineering road-maps and differentiation. Maintain and permanently improve the overall engineering process between defined customer and Teradyne. Qualifications/Skills A minimum of 5 - 8 years of working experience in sales or account management in the semiconductor related industry. Requires a bachelor’s degree or above in Electrical Engineering or related field. Engineering technical background is highly preferred. Excellent communication skills. Ability to interact with customers’ engineering and business staff at all levels. Proven track record in achieving/exceeding sales and market share targets. Solid experience in building and managing a major sales account, preferably in semiconductor capital equipment. Strong communication and presentation skills as well as interpersonal skills. Good English capability
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: About Us  Monitors competitors activities and assists in marketing intelligence  监督竞争对手的活动并协助监察市场动态。  Refers sales leads to appropriate personnel within the InterContinental Hotels Group  在洲际酒店集团的范围内将销售线索提供给适合的人员。  Sells to new, existing and prospective customers considering goals set forth in the sales strategy, negotiating optimum rate for the benefit of the business  根据在销售策略中既定目标，向新的、现有的、有可能的客户进行销售，并与其谈判商定最适合的价格以争取最大的利润。  Develop and maintain a regular pattern of sales calls, meeting with principals of target market  设立和保持定期的销售拜访模式，与目标市场的主要人物会面。  Develops and maintains contact with business generators, meeting and convention planners, visitors/convention bureau, travel agents, tour operators, airlines, corporate accounts, Government Departments and other producers closely allied to Hotel business  根据酒店的营业需要，与业务联系人、会务策划者、游客和会展局、旅行社、旅游运营商、航空公司、公司客户、政府部门和其它客人发展并保持联系。  Builds profile within local market place through attendance at various events and local market place  通过参与当地市场的各种活动在当地市场上树立良好形象。  Travel when required to promote the hotel and develop potential business  需要时出差对酒店进行推销，发展潜在的业务机会。  Analyses sales mix and likely impact on hotel goals  分析销售综合计划和可能对酒店目标产生的影响。  Implement direction from Director of Sales and Marketing and Regional Managers  按市场销售总监与地区经理们的指示执行相关工作。  Apply

At a Glance:  We are excited to offer the position of Regional Lead Central China to an entrepreneurial member of our growing China team. On is the fasted running brand globally. Our success is based on the exclusive collaboration with the best sports stores and a premium service concept. On wants to inspire runners all over the world. As a Swiss company On acts faster, is more customized, and more creative than conventional brands.  Your Team:  As you might expect from a sports brand with running at its core, the China team at On is a fast-paced place to be. You’ll be part of the China Commercial team and co-working with a group of highly motivated individuals and teams all together towards the mission of On, Ignite human spirit through movement.  This role is based in Shanghai, China.  Your Mission: Develop regional sales and retail marketing strategies with analysis of market trends, consumer insights which could best represents On’s brand mission and identity and contribute to the overall business ambitions Use holistic view to manage budget and resources across channels Provide input to the overall China marketplace plan to make the regional consumer needs and voices be heard and considered Lead and deliver the regional retail marketing plan to boom up the brand awareness and warm up cities prior to store opening Lead account/store opening in the region Constantly explore opportunities and fast experiment ideas to excellence retail store management and operations Develop and build strong partnerships with key account partners, sports communities, real estate partners and related government relationships in the region Initiate projects which could add value to brand and business Lead and coach team to perform and be excellent Your Story: A candidate with 5 - 8year-experience in the related retail /consumer goods industry Willing to challenge, to explore and to experiment to make things differently You are self-motivated meanwhile be able to motivate others through living On spirits and mission Good team player with can-do-attitude Strategic thinker who has proven records of delivering results Good communication and influence skills with both written and verbal in English and Mandarin What we offer:  We offer a dynamic, challenging and sportive environment that has been ranked as the ‘fastest growing sports company’ of its time. With offices across the globe, we are an international team who is hungry to innovate and build something incredible. We foster an active environment where each individual thrives for excellence and can achieve their full potential. This is where your work matters, you’re hands-on and your team members are amongst the very best in their respective disciplines and fields.  If you are driven to bring On to the next level, curious about the opportunity and want to be part of our growing team send us your application, and join the ONiverse!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

jobTitle: Sales and Education Assistant Manager, Travel Retail China
description: KEY ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES A. Sales-Related Responsibilities (70%)  Sales and Operations Management ●       Review retail sales targets and performance of each door (online & offline doors) on a monthly basis with ASOD ●       Analyze performance of business vs. sales objectives, sales trends and competition ●       Generate sales reports and sales commentary on a monthly basis ●       Build and work on close relationship with the Retailers and Shop Ops team ●       Identify opportunities and to strategize on how to maximize and increase sales ●       Protect brand rankings and equity ●       Ensure brand image and visual merchandising are in line with brand standards and philosophy at retail counters ●       Coordinate and execute the setup of all promotions, in-store programs and activities ●       Ensure field staff and Shop Ops team are aware of the marketing calendar, promotions etc ●       Motivate, give clear directives and instructions to field staff on how and where to focus to achieve sales objectives and targets  Marketing Initiatives ●       Coordinate and execute Newness, promotions and in-store & online programs setup in collaboration with ASOD, Store Design Visual Merchandising and Integrated Marketing team ●       Monitor product trends, performance and identify potential sales opportunities to ASOD and Marketing team ●       Ensure all go-to-market materials and promotional elements are available on time in store to support launches ●       Provide report to Sales & Marketing team on pre, during and post-campaign implementation as well as competitive intelligence on competitors’ activations ●       Active involvement and coordination of Social & Digital Activations such as Brand / Retailer’s Livestreaming events or programs  Supervision and Team Management of Beauty Advisors (under both retailer’s payroll & ELC payroll), Store Managers/Retail Managers, and Airport Coordinators ●       Responsible in recruiting, onboarding, and the management of field staff headcount and productivity to ensure sufficient coverage of the counters ●       Ensure BA uphold grooming standards of the brand they represent ●       Manage Counters Managers/Retail Managers, BAs, Promoters and Airport Coordinators (if any) on day-to-day performance, field employee’s engagement (Brand BAs and Retailers Generic Staff), and handle Performance Improvements Program and initiate conversations where necessary  B. Education (30%) - Train and develop Beauty Advisors  Counter Coaching (20%)                 ●       Connect with Field staff through Virtual Learning Tools and in-store meetings to train and coach on general selling skills (eg. how to service customers, how to upsell, cross sell & link sell and how to improve one’s productivity. ●       Coach on brand stories, hero products, and other important brand-specifics of our sister brands to help maximize sales within the ELC group ●       Utilize E-learning platforms, including brand-agnostic content, to coach BAs towards improving customer experience and sales productivity ●       Conduct BAs / Generic Staff Training of smaller doors ●       Collaborate closely with the Education team to develop all training/coaching materials based on touchpoint needed. Sales & Education Executives are more likely to focus on brand-diagnostic topics and to reinforce learnings around branded concepts first introduced by the Education Team ●       Coach and motivate BAs based on individual talents and skills to drive sales objectives and brand equity                                                                            Orientation / Basic New hires training (10%) ●       Conduct initial on-barding for new BAs and Generic Staff in lower tier doors to ensure that they are well versed on their brands(s) and the travel-retail working environment.  C. General ●       Spend minimum 70% of time in-store, working and coaching Field Staff   JOB REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS B.A degree with a minimum of 3 years relevant experience, preferably in the travel retail industry Well groomed Good organization and communication skills Good presentation skills – comfortable with virtual tools such as Zoom, Skype in addition to in-person presentations. Display empathy, agility with can-do attitude Proficient in MS Office and Excel Comfortable/Enthusiastic learning new technology platforms Willingness to travel Proven sales track record Digital savvy
industries: Cosmetics, Luxury Goods & Jewelry, and Chemicals

description: Manages sales of assigned application(s) accordance with business strategies.  Responsibilities  Essential Function 1: Lead to Opportunities-- Idea to Market(s) Compile/Update/Report Market database of responsible application(s) of market segments to line mgrs. Manage assigned accounts (Rolling Sales Forecast); propose sales plan for OD. Report market trends; new potentials; projects; and execute product launch. Essential Function 2: Opportunity to Order -- Market to Customer Manage and execute assigned customer interactions; provide interaction report/feedback; manage sales forecast. Manage technical/commercial offering; negotiate / revise offering; close deal. Manage and conduct post sales follow-up; customer satisfactory. Essential Function 3: Order to Cash -- Customer to Cash Manage and collect customer survey; propose solution of unmet needs of customers. Manage and collect payments. Manage and resolve claims (QNS). Essential Function 4: Sales Target Management Propose and manage annual sales target in line with OD. Manage and execute yearly Sales KPIs (Sales; Margin; Trade Receivable; NWC etc...). Report business status and proposals to line manager(s) in regular basis. Essential Function 5: Manage people / Self-management Manage and execute assigned annual individual targets/projects Actively participate MS/BU/ Corp. project(s). Adapt Clariant Corporate Values Requirements  Bachelor degree; Technical; Chemistry; Chemical Engineering Degree preferred. Master degree as plus.  At least 5 years of experience in sales and/or marketing. Rich commercial and negotiation skills; Strategic Skills  Balanced sense of commercial aspects, marketing and technology. Capacible in English communication.  Our Offer  Clariant is a focused, sustainable and innovative specialty chemical company based near Basel in Switzerland. Last year the company recorded CHF 4.4 billion in sales for its continuing businesses, harnessing the talents of its 14 000 employees across 50+ countries. Clariant’s portfolio is optimized for future growth, with a focus in three business areas: Care Chemicals, Catalysis and Natural Resources. We believe that our growth is all about our customers and their success. Investment in innovation capabilities and developing an inspiring environment for courageous and determined minds are therefore key to reaching our goal. Join us and help create sustainable value through chemistry for customers all over the globe.  [Not translated in selected language] Learn more about Clariant Follow us on Facebook , Twitter and LinkedIn Our commitment to people - download our Employment Standards Brochure

description: Komaspec is a high-quality contract manufacturer for Brands, OEM & ODM. Our manufacturing operation enable innovative companies to develop and market new products using Komaspec manufacturing capabilities for complex plastic and metal assemblies. We are looking for Sales Coordinator.  Main Responsibilities:     1. Communicate with existing customers to coordinate shipping, invoicing, and other sales operational issues. 2. Cooperation with engineering department on the execution of product or packaging changes, especially in how they relate to or affect ongoing or new production (ECR management). 3. Assuring overall customer satisfaction and smooth communication 4. Purchase order booking 5. Production and shipment monitoring 6. Answering various customer inquiries (technical, delivery schedule, payments) 7. Coordinating company internal sales process inside the company (production, logistics, and finance) and providing timely feedback to the relevant account or sales manager in case of issues 8. About Stryker  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. We offer innovative products and services in Orthopaedics, Medical and Surgical, and Neurotechnology and Spine that help improve patient and hospital outcomes. We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine. Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com  Position Summary  This position is responsible for achieving assigned sales quotas and increasing Stryker‘s presence in the market through leveraging resources in the assigned territory.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities: (Detailed Description) Implement sales activities to achieve budgeted sales and profitability goal. Support Business director / Sales Manager to formulate the sales plan and acitivites in accordance with local strategy, and identify market-specific needs, trends and opportunities for business growh. Maintain the network of cooperative relationship with business partners (dealers) and customers Prepare regular sales performance analysis, forecasts, and identify critical issues. Explore new accounts/business opportunities to build Strykers‘customer pool Prepare reports on market trends, consumer habits, competitor information on a monthly basis Compile customers‘feedback to drive high quality service and to expand business portfolio Education & Experience Degree holder in medicine or medical, or sales and marketing related area At least 3 years‘ relevant experience in medical devices or healthcare industry Prefer experience in, or direct exposure to, the healthcare product or medical device industry. Proven record in channel management Physical & Mental Requirements Excellent problem solving & interpersonal skills Results-oriented with good negotiation &communications skill Strong business acumen Demonstrated ability to build and maintain key business relationships internally and externally. Demonstrated ability to work both collaboratively and independently in a cross-functional and team-oriented environment Know someone at Stryker?  Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program.

description: BASF has been a committed partner to Greater China since 1885. With large production sites in Shanghai, Nanjing and Chongqing, BASF is a major foreign investor in the country’s chemical industry, and operates the Innovation Campus Shanghai, a global and regional research and development hub. BASF posted sales of more than €7.3 billion in 2019 to customers in Greater China and employed 9,230 people as of the end of the year. For further information, please visit www.basf.com/cn/en.  Objectives Be in responsible for sales breakthrough of mining solutions business development in China, especially for flotation collector & Frother in flotation plant and Organic Binder in mining plant with mining team leader; Cooperate with EV sourcing to arrange raw materials forecast for BASF internal & external suppliers and production forecast for 3rd party and update cost of coal collector and frother every month; Collect, update and consolidate the data from the team to support marketing communications programs covering advertising, promotion, seminars and workshops via close work with the regional marketing communication team and local sales team. Work closely with IT team members from different BU’s to consolidate information on the strategic relevant market for BASF related to the mining industry in China. Main Tasks Contact with main potential coal flotation & steel customers and organize business & site visiting, delivering samples and organizing plant trial with local distributor or agents; Make sales forecast for flotation and organic binder, and raw materials forecast for suppliers every month; Coordinate with 3rd parties, including famous mining universities, design and research institute and analysis centers to arrange lab tests for coal flotation and organic binder business and performance tests; Find breakthrough opportunities for flotation business and Organic binder in China; Develop market knowledge through independent research of the mining industry ie discussion with industry players, government reports, research organizations etc. Support team leader to update roadmap of mining chemical in China; Identify mega trends with in the industry and relate this to potential business opportunities for BASF. According to the agreed template, collect and prepare for the required market intelligence (e.g. price and cost developments, product competitiveness, industry segments and customers) and competitive information (competitors’ market positions, strategies, strengths and weaknesses) to support market analysis, reporting. Prepare for the presentation materials and correspondence as requested by the supervisor. Prepare for price setting, quotation, contracts according to established polices& procedures. Summarize the potential project information subscribed from external suppliers and distribute to sales team for business development. Follow up with team and timely update into project database. Administration for EVH team, organization of and supports to other team activities. Requirements Education: Master of mining & metallurgy or chemical Working Experience: Related industry experience Technical & Professional Knowledge: Has good communication skill and analytical thinking. Primary Location  CN-Shanghai-Shanghai  Job  Sales / Technical Sales  Ongoing  For BASF, diversity is one of the essential keys to business success and the well-being of our employees. jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Dalian
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, (Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

description: Headquartered in Spartanburg, South Carolina, Milliken & Company is a global, innovative, industrial diversified manufacturing company that has been exploring, discovering, and creating ways to enhance people’s lives since 1865. With expertise across a breadth of disciplines including specialty chemical, floor covering, and performance materials, the company works around the world every day to add true value to people’s lives, improve health and safety, and help make our world more sustainable. Milliken has long led the way for "knowledge-based" investment, employing over 100 PhDs, and has accumulated over 2,200 U.S. patents – and more than 5,000 patents worldwide. Milliken is widely acknowledged as an international leader in research technology, innovation, and customer service. With over 35 manufacturing facilities located in the U.S., U.K., Belgium, France, China, India, Mexico, and Australia, and other sales and service operations throughout the Americas, Europe and Asia, Milliken's more than 7,000 associates work to deliver innovations that do good for the world, create new experiences, and build for the future.  部门/Division: 地毯部/Floor Covering  职位名称/Position: 地区客户经理/Territory Account Manager  汇报对象/Report to: 南区地区经理/ Senior Territory Manager South China  工作地点/Location: 深圳Shenzhen  主要职责/ Key Duties and Responsibilities 掌握产品技术要点，熟悉销售流程，能够独立的完成项目跟踪。 Be familiar with the technical aspects of the products and selling process. Able to independently follow through and close projects. 重点开发，挖掘新客户群体，掌握项目信息，通过经常性的联系，把客户发展成美利肯长期客户。 Focus on identifying and developing new clients, dig out project information. Keep regular contacts with key clients and turn projects into repeat customers of Milliken. 带领代理商服务客户，锁定业主关键决策人，设计公司，项目管理公司，工程承保公司等各类客户群体。 Provide guide to dealers on key accounts development, identify key decision makers of end user, design firms, PM companies and contractors. 支持团队其他同事开展业务，提供项目信息，协助完成重点客户的跟进工作。 Support other team members with new project leads, help them with working on key clients. 保持在市场上的活跃程度，积极参与各类推广活动，为公司提供及时的市场动态，同业动态信息。 Stay active in the market, and involve in all types of promotional activities. Provide timely feedback to the management on markets and industry. 开拓新的市场，宣传美利肯品牌。 Develop new market and create brand awareness of Milliken. 和其他区域同事密切沟通，共同服务区域性重点客户。 Work with other regional teams and cover regional and global accounts properly. 职务要求/ Requirements 本科学历 University degree 3-4年相关工作经验 3 to 4 years related experience in 能独立工作但具有团队精神 Able to work independently while being a team player 良好的处理工作压力的能力 Able to work under pressure and tight time frame 熟练使用电脑及各种office软件 Good PC skills including a proficiency in Microsoft Office 良好的书面及口头沟通能力 Excellent written and verbal communication skills 具有主观能动性，工作上的灵活性和创新性 Possess high levels of initiative, motivation, flexibility and creativity to deliver results Milliken & Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with a disability.

jobTitle: Key Account Manager - Commercial Real Estate ( North Asia)
description: This position will be responsible to drive sales growth of building solutions at selected enterprise accounts within the Commercial Real Estate vertical market ( including Developers, Facilities Management Companies and Hospitality ) while leveraging the broad building business units (HVAC, Building Automation, Fire and Security, Energy Performance Solutions).  Key Responsibilities Develop strategic growth plans to facilitate building systems, solutions and services sales. Drive collaboration across business unit sales organizations to execute comprehensive account growth strategies and increase sales at enterprise accounts Gain access to senior customer decision-makers including VP level decision makers in Construction, Operations, Facility Management, and Procurement. Build and strengthen key customer relationships with senior decision makers Drive and support strategic marketing efforts in target vertical market: assess market opportunities, evaluate customer needs and competitor offerings, identify potential building solutions and services for customers, engage customers with a strong value proposition and help execute marketing plans Collaborate with the engineering organization to identify, develop and deliver a suite of building solutions and services to customers. Work with the engineering and development team to identify, qualify, and gain customer commitment around solution opportunities which will provide significant market differentiation in focus vertical domain Key Requirements Bachelor’s degree and above in engineering or related field with demonstrated sales and marketing experience Proven experience developing and managing Commercial developing and managing Commercial Real Estate, Integrated Facility Management, Developer, and Owners Proven experience in navigating and managing complex networks of decision-makers, stakeholders, and project team members across various construction project delivery models inclusive of programming, design, construction, and commissioning project phases Ability to gain access to and engage with senior executives and create demand for new solutions Proven experience and ability to develop and execute consultative sales strategies that drive value growth for customers About The Client  A world-known HVAC solution provider.

We provide customers with the peace of mind needed to reliably and efficiently improve their operations. Our team identifies new customers and collaborates with cross-functional teams to provide technical guidance and direction for our innovative technology solutions. Fuel your passion  To be successful in this role you will have:  Bachelor degree or above in Engineering, preferably in NDT. description: Company Summary  IHS Markit (NASDAQ: INFO) is the leading source of information and insight in pivotal areas that shape today's business landscape: Finance, energy, economics, geopolitical risk, sustainability and supply chain management. Businesses and governments around the globe rely on our comprehensive content, expert independent analysis and flexible delivery methods to make high-impact decisions and develop strategies with speed and confidence. IHS Markit is headquartered in London. Trusted by clients for more than 50 years, IHS Markit employs more than 8,000 people in 31 countries. We serve 80 percent of the Global Fortune 500 as well as businesses and governments in 165 countries.  General Job Duties Establish and maintain senior level relationships in major functional areas of the customer organization. Utilize the relationships to develop strong revenue growth initiatives for all Auto products as well as retain our existing business within the account. However, the main focus of this position will be to generate new business through the Supplier business. Follow and execute a structured solution sales process for revenue growth and prospecting. Able to uncover new revenue opportunities within an account based on the understanding of the works flows and strategies being deployed within the accounts. Develop knowledge and thorough understanding of all IHS Markit Automotive products and services and apply knowledge to provide appropriate recommendations/solutions that meets their business requirements. Achieve net new revenue growth targets and maximize retention capabilities within accounts. Introduce new IHS Markit Automotive products and services with the accounts. Generate and deliver compelling sales proposals to customers. Observation and understanding of customer workflows and processes, tailor solutions to enhance overall Insight value to customer organization. Specific Job Duties New business generation will be a must in this role. The ability to generate and identify potential customers as well as understand the customers workflow to identify a client's needs will be essential. Manage renewal sales process for existing customer base, including setting of expectations, changing needs assessments, negotiating contracts and processing of contracts via relevant internal systems. Prepare and execute strategic account plan. Review with Line manager on a weekly/monthly basis. Follow up on all inbound client inquiries, webinars, workshops, events to uncover new and expanding opportunities. Maintain consistent and ongoing contact with end-users and decision makers. Prospect, present to, and close on new sales opportunities within client base. Accurately forecast expected sales and cancellations to Line Manager on a daily/weekly/monthly basis. Provide ongoing product feedback from clients to Line Manager and Product Managers. Maintain awareness of, and participate in all relevant training for, new products and capabilities, and market them to account base/prospects. Maintain salesforce, contracting process and all related sales administration work. Required Education Bachelor's degree in science, engineering, or auto industry-related fields required. Any equivalent combination of experience and education could be considered. Required Experience 6-8 years sales experience in automotive related business is required. Required Skills Excellent communication skills with customer and internal organization verbally and written is essential. Result-oriented. Understand key sales/procurement process and account management. Connect customer values and products/services. Self-driven and motivated for learning new things. Can work under high pressure. Frequent travel is required. 3-4 days per week. Native Mandarin and fluent English. Line Manager Sales Director, North Asia, Automotive Location Shanghai, China. Requirements  Degree holder or above in Business / Finance discipline Minimum 3 years of working experience (e.g. front-line sales and customer service) in the financial industry Attained relevant SFC licenses for carrying out Type 1 & Type 2 regulated activities. Result-oriented with strong initiative and drive to succeed. Customer-focused and able to work under pressure Ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with local sales representatives experience in providing witness services for account opening Strong capabilities of client’s order handling and trading Good knowledge in financial planning and wealth products Possess strong business network in China and have good connections with clients who are interested in investing in overseas financial products Excellent communication, interpersonal and relationship skills Good command of written and spoken English and Cantonese and Mandarin  Work Locations : Hong Kong \ Beijing \ Shanghai \ Shenzhen \ Qingdao \ Hangzhou    If you are seeking a dynamic environment in which to build your career in CLSA, please send your resume to recruitment@clsa.com. Kindly specify the position title in the email subject for job application.  CLSA may collect personal data from you for purposes relating to your engagement with the Company, including human resource management and other business and internal / external compliance purposes. Any personal information and /or data collected and held by the Company may be used by the Company or transferred (whether within/ outside Hong Kong) to any other parties within the Company, subsidiaries and affiliates of the Company, internal or external service providers, or any other relevant parties including governmental or regulatory authorities, for the above purposes.

Some experience in the field. WE VALUE Significant experience in a Sales/Account Management related field Excellent communication skills Ability to influence at varying levels across the organization Ability to handle multiple priorities and navigate in a highly matrixed environment Additional Information JOB ID: HRD134331 Category: Sales Location: 15F Guang Hai Tower, 308 Bin Jiang Zhong Rd, GZ,Haizhu District,Guangzhou,GUANGDONG,510220,China Exempt

description: Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges  工作职责: 面向电子、汽车、家电、机械加工等行业客户，负责工业互联网+智能制造领域解决方案和产品的市场拓展和销售，独立负责客户开发、项目落地、内外部协调、验收回款等全栈业务工作，完成公司要求的销售目标 熟悉工业企业的生产制造、采购和供应链等业务流程，作为顾问式销售，深入挖掘客户需求和痛点，与SA及产研团队配合，制定有针对性的解决方案，并根据客户需求进行方案的讲解和演示 全程参与客户项目的招投标，与SA团队配合完成项目的前期方案规划、标的应答、现场述标，对项目招投标的结果负责 根据智能制造软件产品和解决方案、客户需求及相关行业业态，聚合上下游产业资源，打造健康、可持续发展的产业生态 收集并研究电子 汽车 家电 机械加工等行业的发展方向，以及行业趋势、价值和商业模式，为客户提供创新的业务场景、商业模式实施建议 配合公司不定期组织市场活动，扩大品牌影响力  职责要求: 统招全日制本科及以上学历，5年以上项目销售经验；具备软件产品直销经验，从事过工业控制，制造执行，生产管理软件（MES、MOM、SCADA、PCS、WMS等）SRM产品直销经验优先 熟悉大型企业及行业的业务运作模式，具备3年以上综合信息化解决方案或软件产品销售经验，有500万金额以上独立运作项目经验，在大型集团性企业或行业有客户资源 熟悉工业互联网、MES、ERP、大数据等相关领域的技术，能够根据客户的实际情况，快速构建符合乃至超越用户预期整体解决方案，并且能够在客户实践中沉淀行业打法，在行业或者区域快速复制 具备良好的市场规划、销售过程管理、内外部资源整合、协同实施推进及生态拓展能力 熟练应用各类办公软件，具备良好的逻辑分析及语言表达能力 敢于接受挑战，抗压能力强；具备较强团队合作精神，为人正直，作风严谨，具有高度的责任感及职业操守 熟悉规模以上工业企业客户，有大型项目实施成功案例者优先 具备独立运作地方工业互联网项目落地能力的优先 Additional Information JOB ID: req297668 Category: Sales Location: Building 1, Lane 555, Huan Ke Road, Zhangjiang,Shanghai,SHANGHAI,201203,China Exempt Global (ALL)
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Account Executive IV, Shanghai, HCE, Corp
description: Position Summary  Reporting to the Vice President of Sales, this senior strategic role will be accountable for developing and managing critical business relationships with Customers and partners. The strategic role will ensure a 360-degree service-experience to our partners, including engagement, enablement, conflict management/resolution and dealing with customer escalations.  This role will collaborate directly with the Consulting, Services and Support organizations, and cross-functionally with the Commercial and Marketing teams to ensure partners are aligned on consistent messaging, and operational success.  The role will also require communication to Senior Leadership Team, as well as other key and executive-level stakeholders within the Organization. He/She must be comfortable navigating large, complex, and political partner organizations.  What will you be do in this Role?  We have a work hard, play hard culture and want the best players on our team! This is a huge opportunity to join an industry leader with potential for exponential growth and great financial reward. As a Senior Sales Executive focused on the Life Sciences market, you will interact with senior management and have the opportunity to significantly contribute to the growth of our business!  You will be responsible for selling Sparta Systems, a Honeywell company’s, software, services, and training within your assigned accounts/territory and to targeted top-ranked companies. Working with a partner, sales will be generated through personal contact, prospecting, business case justification, demonstrations, phone calls and written proposals. A complete sales cycle of activities from lead identification through contract negotiation, account transition to services, ongoing support and follow on sales will be performed.  The chosen candidate will have experience working with a Global Integrator, preferably in the life sciences arena. Quality Systems, however, ERP or manufacturing background is also appreciated. This person will exhibit strong collaborative partnering skills and knowledge of software implementations and timelines and how to define success.  This individual will have the skills needed to manage relationships with multiple strategic global partner(s). This will include gaining executive alignment, and then executing for success on the planned business outcomes. In the face of obstacles, this individual will know how to manage/escalate issues and then drive for a successful resolution. This person will have a strong business acumen, with an ability to focus on the details, when needed, while never losing site of the big picture. In the end, Sparta Systems, a Honeywell company’s, implementations lead to a world with increased safety, quality and efficacy. This is a key role on the team and will require an elite talent demonstrating the below requirements.  Track record of achieving partner quotas  Managed partner referral / reseller opportunities  Managing and submit sales forecast  Sensitivity to global cultural business dynamics  Deep understanding of partner programs  Enablement programs (training, certification, etc.) for partners  Coordination of direct and partner sales resources  5+ years in an Enterprise or Channel sales role  Experience creating new channel programs  Skills Required For Success  Minimum of 15 years selling complex enterprise software solutions (Quality, ERP, MES) to large corporations, with experience selling to life science and/or consumer products companies and C-level executives.  Experience of working within an enterprise solutions ecosystem – system integrators, technology vendors, consultants, etc.  Demonstrated ability to establish relationships with partners specializing in technology implementations, and digital transformations  Demonstrated ability to work in a high growth technology company  Strong communication skills, both verbal and written to communicate effectively at all levels of an Organization- Executive, Technical, Staff level  Comfortable creating and making presentations  Prior experience working with large, multi-dimensional, complex global partners  Strong collaboration skills, yet equally comfortable working independently; strong relationship management and negotiation skills  Motivated, self-disciplined, and with a strong results orientation  Ability to work with a sense of urgency in a competitive, fast-paced, ever-changing environment  References will be requested  Additional Skills That Will Ensure Success  Managing enterprise scale clients in the life sciences industry required  Quality Management Systems (QMS) Experience Preferred But Not Required  Prior experience in the SaaS, lifescience, quality environment is an additional bonus  Demonstrated ability to develop partners  Demonstrated ability to expand existing client relationships  Prior experience with Salesforce.com is a bonus  Technical Bachelor degree plus advanced degree preferred  Ability to travel as required  Sparta Systems, a Honeywell Company Offers  Competitive salaries and benefits package  Update with Honeywell benefits in China  An opportunity to work for the world's premier provider of cloud and on-premise quality management software  About The Company  Sparta Systems, a Honeywell company, is a leading provider of TrackWise® enterprise QMS software and TrackWise Digital®, a next-generation, cloud and digital QMS SaaS platform. Sparta’s TrackWise Digital combined with Honeywell’s software solutions, batch automation, and data integration capabilities form an integrated life sciences manufacturing digital eco-system that enables greater efficiency and agility while helping achieve quality system compliance with reduced risk. The combination of Sparta Systems and Honeywell brings together Sparta Systems’ quality management leadership with over 100 years of software and industrial expertise from Honeywell. Together, Sparta and Honeywell will shape the future of digital quality and operational excellence for the life sciences industry. For more information please visit https://www.spartasystems.com.  Additional Information JOB ID: req302540 Category: Business Management Location: Building 1, Lane 555, Huan Ke Road, Zhangjiang,Shanghai,SHANGHAI,201203,China Nonexempt
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Telecommunications

description: The Opportunities  Unity Technologies is looking for a hardworking, upbeat Sales Account Executive to join our growing team. You will help drive success with our strategic customers and prospective customers in China. You will work under the Sales, Director and connect with other key internal & external partners for strategies to drive adoption of the technical Unity platform, solutions, services and build deep and lasting customer partnerships.  What You’ll Be Doing  Identify new strategic partnership opportunities within the vertical Structure, negotiate and close partnerships in order to meet or exceed objectives Responsible for driving revenue and consistently meeting quarterly sales targets Develop a proven pipeline by defining opportunities and market potential, identifying sales leads, and working with internal teams to close accounts Creatively thinking and crafting our strategy around the industries and region, including pricing, products, and market strategies Work with various divisions (including Development, Marketing, Support, Finance and Legal) to gain support for key initiatives and deals What We’re Looking For  Direct sales/business development experience with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding exciting individual revenue targets Comfortable representing a technology company and partnering with CEOs, CTOs, engineers, or other technical staff to build solutions, and at the same time able to structure, develop and execute strategic agreements on the commercial side Strong understanding of potential applications for real-time 3D technology in various industries Life at Unity  Unity (NYSE: U) is the world’s leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity’s platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.  The company’s 1,800+ person research and development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than five billion times per month in 2020. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.  Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, disability, gender, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.  Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.  #SEN
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: ClarkMorgan is a small but impactful Corporate Training company that delivers some of the best training in the world. We are extremely lucky to have access to an amazing selection of trainers that deliver a wide selection of trainings from Presentation Skills training to Strategic Change Management. We provide a fun and supportive working environment that empowers you to take initiative and to learn continuously With office in Shanghai, Beijing, Hong Kong, Bangkok and London, we work with some of the best trainers in the world to deliver truly transformational training. We are looking for energetic, dynamic individuals to add to our team.   Responsibilities  Manage and develop a selection of MNC clients to deliver trainings that have a real impact Develop new contacts and build relationships with HR managers and trainers Promote our regular free training events to our HR clients and create a buzz in the market Develop an excellent understanding of our training services and trainers to ensure the right fit between client and training Attend regular business and training networking events to develop a greater understanding of our industry Communicate across the organisation to seek the help you need to deliver the best training experiences possible  Employee requestments 3 years+ of sales experience or customer relationship management preferred Proficient spoken and written English Proactive, open-minded, positive, willing to learn and team-work oriented  Able to connect and build relationships with the team, HR clients and trainers  Salary  Basic salary: 8K-10K/month +commission   How do you apply for the position: Please send your resume to admin@clarkmorgan.com

description: Have we got a job for you?!  China Business Partner, Shanghai  Build Your Career | Have Fun | Make a Difference  About Payoneer  Payoneer’s mission is to empower businesses to go beyond – beyond borders, limits and expectations. In today’s digital world, Payoneer enables any business of any size from anywhere to access new economic opportunities by making it possible to transact as easily globally as they do locally.  Payoneer’s digital platform streamlines global commerce for millions of small businesses, marketplaces and enterprises from 200 countries and territories. Leveraging its robust technology, compliance, operations and banking infrastructure, Payoneer delivers a suite of services that includes cross-border payments, working capital, tax solutions and risk management. Powering growth for customers ranging from aspiring entrepreneurs in emerging markets to the world’s leading digital brands like Airbnb, Amazon, Google and Upwork, Payoneer makes global commerce easy and secure.  Payoneer Has Accumulated Numerous Prestigious Accolades, Including But Not Limited To  Payoneer is a leading fintech company built to disrupt today’s way of commerce.  Payoneer - one world, one platform, endless opportunities.  About Payoneer China  Ever since its inception, Payoneer China has grown at a blistering speed with 250+ employees serving hundreds of thousands of customers. Payoneer China currently is the market leader in cross border payments for ecommerce, B2B trade, and mobile applications. We are also well positioned to grow our business into other business verticals, delivering a portfolio of products and services.  This is a unique opportunity for talents to participate in a fast moving environment to provide disruptive products and solutions that solve real commercial challenges. It is also a great opportunity to super charge your career and to amplify professional growth, business acumen, and cross industry experience.  We’re looking for  An Operations Business Partner that works intensively with both business and operations teams to improve customer experience and to attain business goals. The primary responsibility of the Business Partner is to work with the various teams in China to identify business / operation gaps, align on solutions, and to manage projects to implement solutions.  What’s the job?  The Ideal Candidate Will Need The Following Competencies To Succeed  Strong knowledge of online payments is a requirement. Experience with cross-border payments and ecommerce is preferred. User Orientation - this role will have a strong focus on metrics which track user-experience dynamics and identifies / anticipates changing opportunities for improvement. They will have very strong user insight in terms of what their requirements and pain points to translate hard consumer data to identify underlying user behavior in order to put together compelling business cases / proposals to align the business and operations teams. Strategic and Analytical Skills - successful proposals should align with the company’s business strategy hence the individual must be well versed in understanding not only the vision and strategy but also key underlying drivers to get there. Fintech innovations are complex and require big picture perspective as well as logical and strong problem-solving mind-set. Ability to understand and leverage user and system data is also an important skill. Results Orientation - This is very important since outstanding candidates must have a strong drive and commitment to deliver impactful proposals. Such success metrics are not easy to define, therefore the successful candidate must be able to define appropriate KPIs which he/she and his/her team will be measured against. A strong candidate also has exceptional project management knowhow to orchestrate large development efforts and constantly provide support, feedback and push the project forward. Collaboration and Influencing - He/she has the ability to spot areas that need change and champion the case across the organization. He/she also must have the ability to work proactively across different business units teams is a must. Typical proposals require large teams from cross functional areas such as technology, marketing, sales, finance, in addition to the leadership team and colleagues in China and back in the HQ. The candidate compromises for the ‘greater good’ when necessary but can also influence decision making in a sophisticated manner to ensure necessary resources for own operations.   Have you done this kind of stuff? 8+ years of project / program management experience 3+ years as an account manager or operations expert Demonstrable knowledge of managing multiple concurrent projects through the full lifecycle Strong understanding of e-commerce, social media, retail inventory management, search engine marketing, and web analytics. Energetic self-starter, entrepreneurial spirit. Experience starting and leading new initiatives. Excellent communication skills Must enjoy working in a fast-paced, dynamic, and fluid environment, and be able to think strategically and independently. Ability to work with and indirectly lead a spectrum of teams from operations to marketing to sales. Added Plus – experience in Fintech or Financial Services Willing to be based in Shanghai and travel as needed. Fluency in English & Chinese a must (spoken & written). Unquestioned work ethics and personal and professional judgment.

Responsibilities Maintain close working relationship with insurance partners at different level within the responsible region Implementation of regional programs on promoting penetration and marketing activities to drive business growth; Maintain constant communication with stakeholders on key partner strengths, differentiating products, developments, etc.; Support commercial negotiations for responsible partners; Maintain and refine processes and tools to facilitate better engagement of partners; Setup and implement KPI to effectively measure and monitor partners’ performance; Continuous improvement of partners’ service level and efficiency through technology; Ensure continued success in driving sales for Tesla with partners as well as continued success of the partner portfolio. Conduct regular training to sales/delivery on insurance products and services to ensure it is used effectively as a sales tool; Proactively build and continuously improve sales enabling tools to effectively communicate benefits of insurance products, including but not limited to online and offline vehicle insurance package, marketing and communication materials and training material. Conduct analysis on performance and effectiveness of responsible areas; Provide regular updates to regional team on partners’ performance through quantitative and qualitative analysis. Requirements Demonstrated ability to operate effectively in a very fast moving, developing and constantly changing environment; Analytical, able to derive actions through detailed data analysis; Experience in implementing process improvement through IT automation; Experience in managing external partner relationship; Knowledge of China motor vehicle insurance market; Experience in auto market and auto dealer management is a plus; Team player, able to work and collaborate with multiple functions across the organization to achieve company goals; Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken; Possess drive, enthusiasm and a genuine interest and curiosity in the business; Language skills of region targeted, plus good English; Detail-oriented.

ClarkMorgan is a small but impactful Corporate Training company that delivers some of the best training in the world. We are extremely lucky to have access to an amazing selection of trainers that deliver a wide selection of trainings from Presentation Skills training to Strategic Change Management. We provide a fun and supportive working environment that empowers you to take initiative and to learn continuously With office in Shanghai, Beijing, Hong Kong, Bangkok and London, we work with some of the best trainers in the world to deliver truly transformational training. We are looking for energetic, dynamic individuals to add to our team. jobTitle: Assistant Manager, Sales, East & North of China, Personal Care Solution
description: BASF has been a committed partner to Greater China since 1885. With large production sites in Shanghai, Nanjing and Chongqing, as well as a global and regional research and development hub in Shanghai, BASF is a major foreign investor in the country’s chemical industry. BASF posted sales of approximately €8.5 billion in 2020 to customers in Greater China and employed 8,948 people as of the end of the year. For further information, please visit www.basf.com/cn/en.  Objectives Follow sales strategies and tactics to achieve sales target and KPI Lead, challenge and support distribution, marketing, technical and customer service to realize the sales plan together. Main Tasks Responsible for the day-to-day sales management in the respective area. Solicit new business and retain, penetrate existing business to drive growth. Meet or exceed operational requirements: analytical reporting, cost initiatives, reviews. Increase efficiency and effectiveness. Strengthen customer relationship management. Maintain knowledge of market trends, competitive actions, product needs, and customer base. Create sales plans and deliver accordingly. Manage sales within OTC framework, responsible for accurate sales forecasting. Realize the yearly budgeted results in terms of volumes and market profit. Requirements Education: Bachelor’s or above degree in Chemical related major and/or Business Administration or related discipline Working Experience: Minimum 5 years’ relevant working experience of sales, experience in technical service and/or marketing is plus. Solid selling skills with a proven track record of problem solving and decision-making ability Result and customer oriented. Professional appearance with a can-do attitude. Excellent command in English is plus

description: At Jungle Scout, we are on a mission to empower entrepreneurs and brands to grow successful e-commerce businesses, and we provide the industry-leading data, powerful tools, and resources they need.  We're growing and we are looking to add an Account Executive to our Sales Team.  Location: Shenzhen  Interested in learning more? Let's get into the details:  You will be doing: Be responsible for selling the Jungle Scout Cobalt Market Insights platform and Downstream to top consumer brands and product manufacturers; Identify and develop account opportunities Asia-Pacific region; Own the client relationship throughout the sales process and manage the transition process to the Customer Success team after close. Work closely with colleagues to develop and execute account and sales strategies; Be able to successfully connect with, and sell to, multiple levels within an organization; Focus on moving the needle with respect to the client's KPIs and showcase the value of the Jungle Scout Cobalt Market Insights platform through personalized presentations, demonstrations and business case development; Close collaboration with Jungle Scout's Content & Communications team to create data-heavy examples for key client pitches; Manage and communicate pipeline progress to Jungle Scout management; Work closely with the Product team to ensure closed-loop feedback from enterprise customers.  Who you are: 3+ years of successful quota-carrying SaaS sales experience, you're consistently the top performer on your team & exceed every revenue goal; Courageous, confident, and self-driven. You know how to persevere through challenges and remain calm but focused in a fast-paced, high pressure, dynamic environment. You run through new challenges - not around them; Proven success in managing relationships, up to C-level, within large enterprise organizations Experience developing proposals, business cases, and other content; Ability to learn complex business concepts very quickly, define problems accurately while paying attention to detail, then craft the appropriate solution; Ability to develop relationships with clients and internal teams built on trust and credibility; Exceptional written and oral communications skills, with a strong emphasis on active listening Expertise with Salesforce; Experience selling into the heads of eCommerce at consumer product manufacturers is highly desirable, but not a requirement; Experience working with a SaaS provider in the eCommerce ecosystem or within the sales or marketing organization of a consumer brand； Good communication skills in English and Mandarin.  Bonus: Deep knowledge of Amazon Seller Central and/or Amazon Vendor Central  Working at Jungle Scout The BEST team. Remote-first culture. International Meetups. Access to Jungle Scout tools & experts. Performance Bonus. Flexible Vacation. Comprehensive Health Benefits & Retirement Program.  We prioritize Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion  At Jungle Scout, we hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger.  Jungle Scout is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.  All offers of employment at Jungle Scout are contingent upon clear results of a comprehensive background check. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates prior to the start date.

Description  The Sales Manager provides leadership to explore and develop customers in the field of regional composites business particularly in the thermoset market. He/she advises and reports the business and customers’ development to Sales Team Leader. This is a key position in the Sales Team, responsible for managing and delivering Sales strategy and activities in order to grow and improve business results.   The position directly reports to the Sales Team Leader   Responsibilities  1.    Live the Safety stand, adhere to the safety responsibilities Provide leadership in safe working practices, promoting safety awareness and performance for self and others in all areas of responsibility to achieve full compliance with site and company standards and guidelines  Lead and support safety initiatives and processes in the team to drive towards zero recordable injuries.  Live the Safety Stand, adhere to the safety responsibilities Draft a personal safety action plan and deliver on all commitments  Metrics ·      Implement a personal safety action plan ·      Safety metrics –first aids, near misses  2.    Knowing Our Customers Lead by having an intimate business insight and knowledge of customers, their businesses, what is necessary for the customer to be successful, and the differential value that our current and future products, programs and deliver to the customers.  ·     Explore sales opportunities ·      Analyze market, competition and customer situation to find the opportunity ·      Make good use of company resources to provide solution to customers ·      Contribute to the development of the strategy for both near and long-term which is realistic and will deliver the stated objectives ·      Develop existing customers with new solution ·      Promote developed products to potential customers ·      Work independently and aggressively to reach the target ·      Set up regional team at a proper timing and lead team to reach more achievements.  ·    Manage key accounts ·      Develop comprehensive sales plans for key accounts ·      Generate and develop relationships with various functional people in key accounts ·      Create prospect list for sales opportunities in key accounts ·      Qualify, follow up and close opportunities for key accounts ·      Coordinate and communicate cross-regional information with global & regional sales team  Metrics ·      Recognized sales record in volume and GM ·      Quantity of new customers developed ·      Quantity of long term relationship customers ·      Execute sales plan (budgeted volumes/commercial conditions) at key accounts ·      Remain aggressive gross margin and improve customer satisfaction rate  3.    Directing Operations ·    Contracting   ·      Quotation handling ·      Ensure proper Supply Agreements are in place for businesses ·      Customer Master data gathering, ·      Enable the Perfect Order process, ·      Support Finance in solid credit management,  ·    After sales ·      Manage proper complaint handling follow up, ·      Customer satisfaction measurement, ·      Manage and assess the distributors operating in designated area ·      Steer after sales customer service activities  Metrics ·      Effective agreement/contract/order acceptable by company and customer ·      Control of over-due receivable ·      Solution to customer complaint ·      Customer satisfaction    Job Requirements  Experience: 1.    Minimum of 3 years of commercial experience in the related field such as composites, materials and chemical industry 2.    Experience in negotiating complex deals with various functional people to reach an expected sales model 3.    Bachelor’s degree in business, management, chemical or a related field 4.    Solid background in Thermosets/Thermoplastics is preferred  Knowledge and Abilities: 1.    Basic understanding of Business Administration (knowledge of marketing, finance, technical and legal aspects of a business) 2.    In knowledge of industrial marketplace e.g. economic situation, customer requirements, technological developments 3.    Good at communicating and negotiating 4.    Creative 5.    Contract management and negotiation 6.    Good at enhancing sales margin 7.    Strong capability in value selling and identifying needs on customer side 8.    Key Account Management Capability  Personal Characteristics: 1.    Having passion on the business 2.    Gets the whole customer thing – has a strong customer-focused inclination 3.    Achieves results fast, individually and through teams – can synthesize data and multiple points of view quickly and creatively to arrive at balanced solutions. Has a strong bias for action 4.    Takes business risks, grows from failures and celebrates success 5.    Intelligent and conducts himself/herself with the highest ethical   6.    Strong commercial acumen 7.    Aggressive to reach target 8.    Leading results effectively/collaboratively through others especially those who do not report directly in the business and other functions. 9.    Being part of creating and accelerating a high performance organization 10. Attracting, developing and retaining outstanding talent in the team 11. Assessing the environment and successfully identifying opportunities and closing gaps to accelerate business performance 12. Measuring and assessing performance including developing and implementing metrics and operating reporting Results Oriented - Energetic, resourceful, with strong service orientation and positive can-do attitude. Fully committed to the job and to deliver outstanding work. Never satisfied with status-quo, continually striving for excellence.
