Meanwhile, companies such as Scopely, Glu, Ludia, and many of the Top 200 grossing app publishers trust our platform to monetize their content, grow their audiences, and reward their users. Founded in 2007 and headquartered in San Francisco, Tapjoy is a global organization with offices in Santa Barbara, Boston, London, Beijing, Tokyo, and Seoul.   Tapjoy is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity and inclusion lead to stronger, more innovative teams and better business results; we want to draw from the broadest talent pool possible and encourage qualified applicants. Tapjoy does not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, color, age, sexual orientation, gender (including identity and expression), disability (mental or physical), religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification protected by applicable law; we will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities, and pursuant to applicable fair chance ordinances, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.   For more information, please visit www.tapjoy.com   Job Descriptions   • Manage relationships to hit target revenue and margin economics while ensuring high publisher satisfaction with our services   • Daily account management and support to ensure publisher happiness with products, monetization, distribution, service levels, etc. Strive to exceed client expectations and objectives   • Maximize revenue growth within existing accounts   • Contribute strategically to the growth and direction of Tapjoy’s products, strategies and services   • Represent Tapjoy at industry events and conferences   • Accurately forecast account growth; achieve and exceed revenue objectives for accounts   • Stay up-to-date on industry trends, companies, and opportunities   • Execute in a fast-paced, team environment   • Ad hoc projects depending on needs of the HQ   ______________________________________________________________________   Requirements   • More than 2 years of development relations experience at a venture-funded start-up, social media, gaming or mobile internet services company   • An undergraduate degree in Marketing, Sales or Advertising   • Creative, resourceful, detail-oriented and highly organized   • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English and Chinese, other Asian languages such as Korean and Japanese an advantage   • Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees and management   • A mature, self-motivated person with a positive, professional attitude   • High capacity to operate effectively in turbulent startup environment   • Progressive, consistent work history and excellent references

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Dalian
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, (Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Telecommunications

description: Company Description  OUR COMPANY  Abercrombie & Fitch Co. is a portfolio of lifestyle brands including Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids, Hollister, and Gilly Hicks. Reaching customers across 120+ countries, we strive to create customer-centric, omni-channel experiences for our global customer base.  OUR VALUES  How do we do it? Every day, our associates show up and empower one another to stay curious and think big. As a team of relentless innovators, we aren’t afraid to dream boldly. We are accountable and aim to the highest caliber to understand, push boundaries and embrace change. We coach, mentor, care, and bring our best selves every day because we are in this together. Whether you lead yourself, a team, or the company, everyone is a leader at A&F.  Job Description  This individual will work as part of the APAC Brands team to develop local product strategy and support for the Hollister Co. brand (Male). They will drive product strategy across all channels (local websites, Tmall marketplace and retail stores). They will work directly with the global product team to create the local version of our brand aesthetic. Success in this role will be highly dependent upon building and maintaining exceptional relationships with internal and external teams in both China and the US.  What will you be doing? Within a business division, act as owner for a full merchandise department (either Tops or Bottoms / Other) for the Hollister brand in APAC region Lead merchandise buys and distortions for relevant department, leveraging regional customer preferences and advancing regional business strategy while preserving brand identity and priorities Create the high-level architecture for an APAC-exclusive product assortment (expected to be 10-20% of total APAC assortment by SKUs) Ensure assortments are consistent with overall brand strategy and identity Item-level execution of APAC-exclusive assortment will be handled centrally by Home Office Design and Merchandise teams APAC-exclusive product assortment is expected to play a key role in sales growth Be the expert in current selling analysis and historical selling knowledge for the region Leverage financial and strategic capabilities to influence promotions, pricing, product placement, etc. as well as product development and assortments Intimately understand regional customers’ preferences and interests by observing shopping patterns, regularly shopping competitors, and monitoring media platforms Execute against key milestones / seasonal processes: Following each season, execute a detailed hindsight / strategic line review process at the department level to inform future strategy and identify line list needs for design Present weekly selling / business updates as part of a regular Monday review process, evaluating performance, proposing tactical improvements, and consolidating results into a summary to be shared with the Home Office Participate in central assortment reviews on a seasonal basis, contributing ideas, identifying top items, and preparing for seasonal buys Participate in monthly Chase / Buy / Cut reviews to provide a regional perspective on key products and fine-tune assortments Participate in monthly MPC meetings, working with team to identify upsides and risks to the plan Connect remotely and in-person with Home Office Visual Merchandising teams to coordinate floorsets Partner with Home Office teams to ensure APAC-exclusive assortment is on track throughout the product development process, carrying out consistent updates and communicating effectively both remotely and in-person Travel regularly to Columbus, Ohio to participate in key milestone meetings What will you need to bring? Bachelor’s or undergraduate University degree equivalent 3-4 years of Merchandising or Buying experience, preferably in apparel Proven leadership experience and ability to thrive in team-based settings Passion for the merchant role, fashion retail, customer research, and the Hollister Co. brand Desire to take ownership for a portion of a multi-billion-dollar business An acute eye for product and trend A deep understanding of sales analysis and financial metrics that relate to your business Strong presentation skills and the ability to communicate confidently to leadership Willingness to travel domestically and internationally as needed by the department A high comfort-level with analytical sales tools and proficiency in Microsoft Office applications A collaborative approach to working with cross-functional partners to achieve the vision of the brand Additional Information  ABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

description: Frameo is a Danish producer of photo software minded for WiFi photo frames. Our company is developing and changing at a rapid pace. Therefore, we are looking for an Overseas Sales Manager based in Shenzhen to further develop our sales of the Frameo product to brands in the consumer electronic industry. You will be working closely with the team based in our head office in Denmark and our current China Sales Managers also based in Shenzhen. It is imperative that you are proactive and flexible as a person, and capable of working in a structured way. In Frameo, we have a team-based culture with employee participation on all levels. We believe close cooperation across business units results in better outcomes and better products for our customers.  Areas of Responsibility: Growing Frameo’s business towards brands in the consumer electronics industry Collaborating with Danish HQ on the execution of the sales strategy for the global market Maintaining business relationships with current customers, which includes promoting further sales Collaborating with the China Sales Managers to teach the manufacturers salespeople how to sell the concept to the manufacturers overseas customers Tracking sales opportunities and providing after-sales support in collaboration with Danish HQ Participate in yearly trade shows and fairs like CES, IFA and HKTDC Weekly feedback on the global market and knowledge sharing to align sales processes Insure business transparency for the Danish HQ  Qualifications: Minimum 5 years sales experience within consumer electronics or IT/software Has a broad knowledge and experience with brands within the consumer electronics industry globally (e.g. the European, American or other markets) Bachelor’s degree or above within the commercial/technical field A fast-learner, who is quickly able to familiarize with Frameo’s technology and convey the advantages to the customer Strong sales skills Excellent oral and written communication skills in English  Personal characteristics: Extrovert with a strong commercial and entrepreneurial mindset Strong communicative abilities with both internal and external stakeholders A team player, but self-driven and enterprising in your daily work Deeply engaged and professional in cooperation with colleagues and manufacturers/partners Structured and good at creating an overview of activities Willingness to travel  DI-Asia Base Business Services Ltd. has been entrusted to assist with the recruitment on behalf of Frameo and applications are now being accepted. If you fit the profile, please send us: your motivational essay and CV (in English), expected salary level and availability by e-mail to Andy.Kang@Frameo.net ﻿(quoting reference: “Overseas Sales Manager + "your name" ”) as soon as possible. All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.  About the Frameo Frameo is a license-based software platform used for OEM WiFi photo frames as well as a free app for your smartphone. With the Frameo App you can easily capture and share your best moments with your loved ones. Take a photo, select who you want to send it to, add a fitting caption and send. It's that simple! With a Frameo social photo frame you are ready to receive photos from your friends and family. Simply add the people you wish to receive photos from and sit back and enjoy their moments! Read more at: www.frameo.net
industries: Computer Software, Consumer Electronics, and Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing

description: 工作职责:  Job Description Summary  As a Senior Account Sales, you will develop & implement One GE Healthcare sales strategy by maintaining commercial relationships/alliances with Accounts at zone level, e.g. hospitals, hospital groups, government bodies or Group Purchasing Organizations. It's a role that will be responsible for maintaining a detailed understanding of assigned accounts’ business and keeping GE Healthcare Zone, Region & Product management informed and appropriately involved. You will be expected to lead & close multimodality and single product deals in their assigned accounts.  GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Primary Responsibilities  Financial Performance Achieve sales and orders volumes at the target prices in assigned accounts/territory. Coordinate orders and sales forecasts within the applicable sales funnel tools and reports for in their assigned territory/accounts in conjunction with Product Sales Specialist/product Specialists. Account Management Maintain relationships, develop a business strategy, and maximize business opportunities for all GE Healthcare businesses, products & services within allocated accounts/territory (or within defined care area/department scope). Represent OneGEHC in the account or care area/department and acts as a primary customer point of contact in the allocated accounts/territory. Provide on-going feedback to management, product teams, services and marketing. Maintain Go-to-Market plans in conjunction with Zone cross functional and multi-product teams to achieve targets and grow GE’s share of customer investments in capital, diagnostics and operational expenditures. Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction through consistent high quality interactions with customer management. Build long term strategic alliance with portfolio of accounts to continue to add value, and promote Service offerings to identify and escalate commercial service needs to drive customer NPS. In cooperation with Product teams and Marketing, drive One GE Healthcare promotional events in assigned territory. Be aware of customer segmentation and promote offerings relevant to each client’s segment. Opportunity Management Prospecting for new customers and business opportunities in addition to growing and maintaining the existing customer portfolio. Prioritize new leads to create a balanced sales funnel for future sales. Lead and leverage Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialists, Care Area or Category Leaders, Service Operations and other Company resources to provide the necessary technical, clinical and business content to create a competitive differentiation. Coordinate One GE Healthcare team on assigned accounts in order to deliver solutions that meet or exceed customer expectations. Lead & coordinate multi-P&L proposals, preparing sales quotations, planning customer meetings and demonstrating equipment capabilities across diagnostic product portfolio with relevant Product Sales Specialists, Product Specialist and other sales support staff. Ensure order and configuration quality at the point of entry to ensure accuracy, configuration integrity and that all requirements are tied to documented customer inputs. Lead successful negotiation and closure of multi P&L opportunities, interfacing with all key buyer influencers. Assist Product Sales Specialists in negotiation and deal closure of single product deals as required. Promote point of sale service contracts and financing solutions and drive margin through selling value and achieving price targets. GE Product & Market awareness Develop a solid knowledge of GE product and service portfolio and competitors’ products. Develop and maintain expertise of market and technology trends in order to understand customer issues and challenges as well as educating customer on their unmet clinical and business needs. Develop and maintain deep understanding of CxO level business and clinical needs and how GE provide solutions/offerings to meet these needs differently from the competition. Compliance Adhere to and uphold highest standards of compliance to relevant international and local Regulatory and GE Healthcare Promotional Codes Adhere to all applicable GE and GE Healthcare compliance policies, codes and training requirements Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required. 任职条件:  Qualifications / Requirements Education to Bachelor Degree level or the equivalent of four years of sales experience. 2 years of strategic sales experience. 2 years experience in healthcare. Proven key account management and project planning skills. Strong customer focus and desire to continuously improve expertise Well developed listening, influencing, interpersonal and networking skills to drive collaborative culture at all levels; High level presentation skills; able to present ideas to customers in a way that produces understanding and impact. Quality Specific Goals Aware of and comply with the GEHC Quality Manual, Quality Management System, Quality Management Policy, Quality Goals, and applicable laws and regulations as they apply to this job type/position Complete all planned Quality & Compliance training within the defined deadlines Identify and report any quality or compliance concerns and take immediate corrective action as required Knowledge and understanding of all Global Privacy and Anti-Competition Policies Knowledge and understanding of all Environmental Health Policies (including but not limited to GE Healthcare EHS Policies, GE Healthcare Fleet Rules, etc.) and operate within them to ensure that no company policy or Country / Int’l Law is broken Drive continuous improvement on all related processes, work instructions, and procedures to ensure ongoing standardization and simplification of the Quality Management System. Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership – always with unyielding integrity.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

description: Bayer is a global enterprise with core competencies in the Life Science fields of health care and agriculture. Its products and services are designed to benefit people and improve their quality of life. At Bayer you have the opportunity to be part of a culture where we value the passion of our employees to innovate and give them the power to change  Channel Commercial Manager  Your Tasks And Responsibilities Design develop and implement objectives, tactics and action plans that maximizes RAD Device operating income consistent with overall distributor management strategy. Evaluate & optimize overall distributor networkto ensure a solid and stable channel platform to support sustainable business growth. Monitor evaluate & score the business activities of Tier 1 distributors and ensure them understand our demands of distributor business behavior and have beentrained accordingly. Work closely with internal relevant team to screen and evaluate the End User distributor for aligning with Bayer Radiology Device Business strategy. Regular call-on communication Tier 1 and End User distributors to ensure business policy and guidelines are understood, monitor business issues such as workflow management, product mix, promotion, shipping, inventory management, etc. Ensure all of our business, sales and marketing activities with the distributors are legally and ethically compliant, any potential code of conduct issues with the distributors are immediately reported through the appropriate channels. Negotiate key contract terms with distributor, while sustaining strong distributor relationships. Continuously look for new ways to improve product and service offerings to reflect changing business needs and identify additional applications for existing products. Provide accurate sales forecasts and proactively identify forecast risks and mitigation strategies. Communicate with the CM & marketing team on the development and execution of new product launches, old product retirement or any other product strategies to ensure the distributor's sales team is properly prepared upon completion. Drive and support execution of company's channel related projects. Who You Are 6 years and above experience in MNC of Medical Instrument or Pharmaceutical industry, at least 4 years in Channel Management practice. Being self-driven and objective oriented. Strong strategic thinking, reliable mindset and rational analysis skill. In-depth business acumen and healthcare industry insights. Good computer skills in normal software such as PPT, Word, Excel. Ability to analyze both quantitative data and qualitative information. Fluent written and spoken English and Mandarin. YOUR APPLICATION  If your background and personal experience fit this profile, please send us your complete application at www.career.bayer.cn If you have any recommendations, please kindly send mail to cnreferral@bayer.com  L ocation:  China : Si Chuan : ChengDu  Division:  Pharmaceuticals  Reference Code:  444926

Implement and coordinate the operational aspects of ongoing Channel Sales projects and activities. You will serve as liaison between Channel Sales Leadership, Marketing and Distributors. You will review status of projects and budgets. You will coordinate schedules and deliver status reports. You will assess project issues and develop resolutions to meet productivity, quality, and customers satisfaction goals and objectives. You will develop mechanisms for monitoring Channel Sales progress and for problem solving with project managers and customers  Key Responsibilities Channel Sales Activities Manage Projects Provide Customer Support Facilitate Team Alignment Deliver Status Reports Manage Teams YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree, or equivalent. Some experience in the field. description: 该职位来源于猎聘  The Sales Account Manager is distinguished by their deep knowledge of the IT industry and Veritas’ Information Management Portfolio. This industry expert will be assigned to large, complex, high visibility, strategic, named accounts, sells Veritas’ entire information management portfolio (backup/recovery, high availability, clustering, archiving, eDiscovery, etc.) and maintains relationships with existing named accounts that are of substantial strategic importance to the organization.  Develops strategies and orchestrates company resources to maximize sales volume and profit goals within assigned accounts.  The territory is comprised of accounts that are strategic to the long-term success of the organization. The candidate is expected to cultivate and maintain executive level relationships in IT and various Lines of Business (LOB), focusing on the strategic nature of the relationship.  Represents Veritas to the customer and the customer to Veritas. Responsible for expanding Veritas’ footprint in the assigned territory and ensuring ongoing customer satisfaction.  Primary point-of-contact sales manager for account regardless of account’s geographic location.  Meeting and/or exceeding sales quota and customer satisfaction metrics.  Assigned to large, complex, high visibility, strategic, or tactically important accounts.  Ability to collaborate with extended Veritas and partner teams but also to work independently to accomplish required tasks.  Interface with all levels of management. Negotiating and influencing to build consensus. Present programs internally and externally. Work is focused on operational plans in support of strategic goals.

该职位来源于猎聘  International Sales & Business Development Manager  About ForwardX  ForwardX Robotics is a developer of AI-empowered mobile robotics for the manufacturing, logistics, and retail industries. Offering a wide range of vision-first Autonomous Mobile Robots (AMRs) and intelligent fleet management software, ForwardX’s solutions help supply chain operations automate material handling tasks in their facilities, from warehouses to production floors. Developer of the most intelligent AMRs on the market, ForwardX’s core competencies include computer vision, machine learning, and advanced robotics. With a huge need in the market for our solutions and massive market potential, ForwardX is looking for a go-getter to join our team as International Sales & Business Development Manager.  About The Job  Responsibilities: Perform competitive and SWOT analyses to gain a deeper understanding of the market and target industries Define, execute and effectively communicate ForwardX’s sales and business development strategy and operational plans. Initiate and develop relationships with key sales & business development prospects to identify and meet their business needs Draft and review contracts for prospective customers and partners Analyze and evaluate potential partnership deals and opportunities Manage sales and business development pipelines and set targets Manage key partner accounts and serve as their main point of contact to deliver project success Create and deliver tailored business proposals and presentations Identify new commercial opportunities to increase revenues on a global market Provide outstanding customer service through prompt and accurate support and advice Track, trace, and communicate regular updates on key performance indicators to business-wide stakeholders Cultivate an in-depth knowledge of our business products and value propositions within the context of the European & North American markets About You  Qualifications required: Bachelor’s degree required; MBA preferred Fluent written & spoken English & Chinese 5+ years of sales or business development experience within industrial robotics, logistics, or manufacturing industries in Japan Demonstrated track record overseeing sales & business development as evidenced by contributions to organization revenue and growth Values Required Entrepreneurial You are always looking for ways to solve problems and appreciate that it is up to us to go out and make things happen. Analytical You are adept at conducting research to better understand and evaluate the business, its position in the market, and the viability of potential opportunities. Adaptable You are able to adapt your communication style and express your thoughts in a way that is easily understood by those around you. Organized & Accountable You take responsibility for your work and identify and manage stakeholders internally and externally Positive You understand that a deal can always be made and that it is up to you to find a way to make that happen. Strategic You have experience developing and implementing successful expansion strategies and understand the various areas of business development Relationship-focused You understand how to build, manage, and leverage relationships inside and outside of your immediate network. Motivated You are able to self-motivate and motivate those around you to meet the high expectations you set for yourself and others. Composed You are experienced in and excel when working to time-bound targets and actively seek to meet and exceed the targets set.

概述  Bruker Corporation businesses are leading worldwide manufacturers of analytical measurement systems for the life sciences. For more than 50 years Bruker has followed a single idea: to deliver the best technological solution for every analytical task. Today, more than 6000 employees at over 90 locations worldwide are working toward this challenge.  We are looking for a motivated Technical Sales Representative with a strong science background and bilingual (English and Chinese) language skills for Bruker Daltonics’ Life Science Mass Spectrometry (LSMS) in Shanghai.  职责   Achieve the assigned sales target for Bruker Life Science Mass Spectrometry products in the assigned region.   Set up strategic sales plan in his/her assigned territory, actively manage the sales pipeline and forecast through both direct channels and distributors.   Work closely with the application, marketing and service functional departments to meet the need of existing customers in the assigned territory.  资质   BSc (minimum), preferably MSc or PhD in Chemistry, Biology, Medicine or Pharmacy or relevant Science fields.   Strong sales and marketing experience with 1 – 5 years of experience in the field of scientific instrument or laboratory products, knowledge of mass spectrometry is preferred.   Must have excellent communication skills in both English and Chinese. Must be able to read scientific literatures. Communication in English verbally and written essential.   Must have good learning attitude and ability to learn mass spectrometry applications and give clear presentation to academic customers on mass spectrometry products, solutions and applications.   Good time and territory management skills and must be able to work independently; goal oriented with good organization skills, able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Chemicals

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

description: Cialfo is a leading platform connecting students, higher education institutions and counselors through technology driven solutions. Launched in 2017 with a mission to make education accessible to 100 million students, Cialfo provides a range of mobile and web solutions to students, K-12 institutions and higher education institutions. We’re one of the fastest-growing edtech startups in the region, consistently charting new heights!  With our fingers always on the pulse on the latest developments and technologies in education, the Growth team works to develop strong partnerships with K-12 schools and personalise solutions to support them. We’re an international team specialising in our own regions but united by our common goal of making education accessible to students worldwide. If you are passionate about making a positive impact in the education sector and are a driven self-starter with a knack for networking, join our K-12 partnerships team to be an advocate for Cialfo!  Responsibilities Sell consultatively to understand the customer's goals and challenges before offering solutions. Conduct outbound phone activities to build your sales pipeline. Meet agreed KPI targets. Effective qualification of prospective schools. Become knowledgeable of our software products and target market. Understands and applies the lead management policy (including CRM usage) as the guideline to contact and communicate with our customers. Manage schools related inquiries aligned with service level agreements. Manage and maintain data integrity of student management system. Works closely together with the Cialfo sales teams to ensure optimal coverage of the market.  Requirements 1-2 years of experience in sales outbound roles, preferable in IT/Services and Education industry. Proven track record of cold calling and prospecting to create new leads, achieving personal and team goals. Experience selling B2B preferred. Strong phone skills. Comfortable in working with KPIs. Interested in joining a fast-growing education technology startup. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Result orientated, disciplined, methodological, resilient. Coachable and value feedback. Proficiency with Excel and Salesforce is highly preferred. Bachelor’s degree. Business mandarin proficiency is a must.  Benefits  Exact benefits vary depending on your location. That said, all full-time Cialfo employees receive the following benefits: Paid Annual and Medical leaves Flexible working environment Medical Health Insurance and more...

description: Reports to: Sales & Business Development Director Location:  Responsibilities   1.    Business Development Ø Pro-actively seek and establish relationships with target Key and VIP potential companies and manage end to end sales process from initial contact through client on-boarding and on-going relationship development. Ø Support on-boarding of new Standard/low potential accounts and facilitate transfer to Client Support team for on- going management. Ø Respond to inbound leads from website enquiries, requests for quotation and client referrals. Ø Work with colleagues within sales and marketing teams both internally and group partners to engage with high potential accounts which span geographical regions and company scope. Ø Assist colleagues to support new prospects which cover multiple regions. Ø Support for the different organizations within the corporate group   2.    Existing Account Development Ø Take ownership of relationships for Key and VIP accounts to ensure maximization of potential business with those clients. Ø Ensure clear handover of information for Standard (low potential accounts) which shall be self-managed by Online system and Client Support team. Additional support may be required to provide for Standard accounts on a case-by-case basis. Ø Liaise with colleagues internally to seek information to answer to Key and VIP account questions, feedback, or complaints in a timely and professional manner. Ø Regularly meeting and communicating with key and VIP clients face to face and by phone ensuring adherence to client follow up policies. Ø Revive dormant / unresponsive clients and work with Client Support team to reduce client churn. Ø In the event of claims and complaints from Key and VIP accounts assist in the negotiation to reduce impact to client relationship and seek to establish a reasonable solution with the client while limiting cost impact to the company.   3.    Marketing Ø Provide insights and input to overall and regional sales and marketing strategy. Ø Assist marketing department activities to develop new content for marketing campaigns.   4.    Administration Ø Maintaining CRM records for owned accounts including, but not limited to ensuring opening opportunities related to RFQ’s, logging sales activities (meetings, calls, etc) and updating contact information. Ø Follow up creditors on significantly overdue invoices in line with Accounts Receivable policy.     Requirements: Ø 4-5 year’s sales experience in Trading, logistics 3rd-party Inspection, Testing industry. Ø Bachelor’s degree or above, major in Marketing, Sales. Ø Strong communication and interpersonal skill, a good sense of teamwork. Ø Solid proven sales track record & achievement. Ø Proficient in MS Office software such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, outlook. Ø Fluency in English, Spanish is a must for this role. Portuguese desirable. Ø Strong sense of responsibility, team spirit, integrity, able to work under pressure and customer and result oriented. Ø Occasional travel is needed.   Career Developing Path: Ø Start from: Sales & Business Development Executive Ø 8 to 12 months: Senior Executive Ø 12 to 24 months: Business Development Manager for good performance Ø 24 to 36 months: Sr. Business Development Manager for higher performance

jobTitle: Regional Sales Team Lead - TOP MNC Publishing Company
description: TOP brand in publishing industry, steady growth in China market Oversee national market, good opportunity to expand business scope and leadershi  About Our Client  Our client is an TOP brand in publishing industry focusing on science and research development with steady business growth in China.  Job Description  The Regional Sales Team Lead is responsible for the current year and long-term growth of overall business in Corporate and Engineering fields. 1 - Achieve revenue and growth objectives * Responsible for total business in territory (country strategy, market Intel, planning, local marketing, execution), in alignment with business & strategic objectives * Key link between sales and rest of organization * Leads key consortium negotiations * Effective use of company resources 2 - Develop an effective regional sales organization * Effectively hire, coach and develop and retain sales talent * Lead by example; manage change (effectively implement and embed global initiatives in region) * Fully understand and utilize sales tools (e.g. sales compensation plan, pipeline dashboards, etc) to drive sales behavior * Ensures the right level of account management (holistic company value aligned with customer strategy) through coaching, role-modeling * Optimize different sales channels - e.g. both direct, inside sales and use of agents  The Successful Applicant  The requirements for ideal candidate are:  Must to have: 1) Minimum 10 years Corporate clients sales experiences 2) Cheerful leaders with skills of stakeholder alignment and management experience. At least 3 years proven success of people manager experience(hire, coach, develop talent) with target achievement 3) Experienced in working in an international matrix organization 4) Experienced at least one focused industry(CCEE/PBT/Engineering/Chemicals) 5) Proven success as a mature sales. Candidate need to master value-based selling, skills of account planning, driving active engagement with customers in its territory 6) Candidate should have cloud-base product selling experience(SaaS experiences) 7) CXO communication skill, presentation skills, fluency in English 8) Integrity/honesty, willing to learn/Proactive/Team Collaboration, positive, responsible, problems soling capabilities, etc.  Nice to have: 1) prefer if candidate has experience to work with/in research institution 2) growth mindset, proven success to explorer new market and cook deals； 3) equipped with mutual selling methodology 4) experience in resource allocation  What's On Offer  The company provides the followings for canidate: - National business scope - Leadership training and balanced working environment - Competitive salary  Contact: Kexin Gao  Quote job ref: 4199734
industries: Events Services, Financial Services, and Facilities Services

description: Partner Sales Manager Location: Beijing  Main duties: Delivers agreed revenue and recruitment targets into all Study Group Higher Education programmes. Develops the customer value proposition for Study Group’s Central China based agents Identifies opportunities to grow key accounts into higher value tier.  Ensures maximum levels of competitor and market awareness Effectively operates in a commercial, cost focused environment Monitors the sales pipeline and forecast accurate future sales opportunities across team. Positively engages with and contributes to the HE Brand, Agent and APD teams and to the wider Global Sales and Marketing team Supports the leadership of a best in class sales team through setting and communicating high standards of performance and behaviour  Essential Criteria: Educated to Degree standard or compensating industry experience Experience of working in account sales planning and implementation. (such experience does not have to be from the higher education sector) Experience of working in a sales matrix team, both in-office and remotely (virtually) Minimum of two years’ experience of working in the higher education sector Experience of developing and implementing recruitment strategies IT literate with a good working knowledge of Microsoft Office Experience of face to face sales An ability to deal professionally with all staff, clients, partners and students A quick learner able to understand and action effectively new tasks Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail Ability to work flexibly and independently with limited supervision and remote management. Ability to set own targets and strategies Ability to present to large groups in a confident and persuasive manner Ability to research and analyse market trends and produce reports Excellent bi-lingual skills in Chinese and English both written and verbal Excellent interpersonal skills Self-motivated, enthusiastic and a positive attitude  Desirable Criteria: Bachelor’s degree and above /or overseas study experience Experience of International student recruitment within a Higher Education sector Experience of writing/designing promotional campaigns Experience of channel sales (i.e. through agent network or similar)  About Study Group We are a global pathway provider in International Education, working collaboratively with a number of Top Tier Universities. Voted as the 2017, 2018 and 2020 Global Pathway Provider of the year, our people are united with the shared ambition of providing a world-class UK education to talented students from across the globe.   Organisational Compliance Study Group is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of its students, and expects all staff and volunteers to share the same dedication. Applicants will be required to undergo child protection screening appropriate to the role, including checks with past employers, an Enhanced Check from the Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) and overseas criminal records if appropriate. Study Group processes your information in line with data protection regulations. Please see our Privacy Policy
industries: Higher Education, E-Learning, and Education Management

description: WHY DUPONT ELECTRONICS & INDUSTRIAL (E&I)?  There’s never been a more exciting time to join us. It's a time of incredible progress at DuPont — a time of momentum. It's the time for change makers, for the doers and pioneers, to create essential innovations the world needs. We pursue new technologies and performance materials that enable your designs to be smaller, more complex and more powerful than you could ever imagine.  DuPont is a technology leader, serving the semiconductor, circuit board, display, digital and flexographic printing, healthcare, aerospace, industrial and transportation industries. Why wait for a better future? Invent a better n ow. Build the next thing that changes everything!  Job Description Responsible for overall demand forecast accuracy, customer needs, problems and troubleshooting, interests, competitor activities, and positive/negative potential for existing or new products and services. Achieve agreed upon sales targets and key project milestones within schedule. Present, promote and sell products/services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers. Responsible for developing and maintaining relationships through all management levels with key customers Manage the balance between price, customer value, and cost to achieve the company’s profitability objectives. Proactively alert potential supply risk and co-work with supply chain for issue resolution. Effectively work with functional teams within DuPont to drive satisfaction both within DuPont and at customers. Teams include Quality, Demand/Supply chain, R&D, manufacture and marketing, etc. Responsible for making deals, negotiating contracts, managing conflicts, and tackling problems. Resolve customer complaints by investigating problems; developing solutions; preparing reports; making recommendations to management. Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, competitor’s activities, sample delivery schedule and result. Introducing the product offering and customer value proposition to customers Distributor management JOB QUALIFICATION More than 5 year of successful experience in display industry for Sales and Field Service. Experience in OLED is plus. Knowledge in OLED material, panel manufacture, processes and value chain or general consumer electronics. Experience working directly with China OLED panel makers is highly desirable. Proven work experience as a sales representative or field/customer service role. Experience on distributor management is preferred. Excellent selling, communication, time management and negotiation skills. Good interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to quickly and effectively build relationships, interact, and communicate information with internal and external stakeholders. Good strategic thinking, an influencer, communicator, problem-solver with strong customer-orientation, and execution. Highly self-motivated and target driven. Good team player. Degree in Business/Marketing/Engineering/Material science or related fields Demonstrated ability to build relationships and communicate across the organization Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to travel up to 50% of the time Location Beijing, Chengdu, Wuhan, Shanghai Fluent English skills. Korean is plus DuPont is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability or any other protected class. If you need a reasonable accommodation to search or apply for a position, please visit our Accessibility Page for Contact Information.  For US Applicants See the “Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law” poster at http //www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf  For our U.S. Affirmative Action Policy, click here.

description: Role purpose:  Our Business Assurance business is a recognised, world-leading professional assurance services organisation. We specialise in management systems compliance & expert advice across a broad spectrum of standards, schemes & business improvement services to include customised training & assurance.  This role will be accountable for delivering profitable sales that meet or exceed agreed targets, supporting the Area sales team’s success and the overall growth plans for the BA business.  Key Responsibilities:  As an Outbound Sales Development Representative, your main responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):  Follow up all company generated leads in a timely manner, ensuring the correct level of customer discovery, to maximize the sales opportunities  Enthusiastically working on outbound activities, representing the company in a highly professional manner.  Proactively work on prospecting and networking to develop self-generated leads to enable the correct level of sales pipeline and sales to achieve monthly, quarterly, and annual targets  Maintain comprehensive, up to date records on the company’s CRM system, including records of all calls, emails, meetings, proposals, etc. and the use of task management to set appropriate follow up actions and next steps  Work closely with marketing colleagues to ensure the correct level of sales activity to follow up on local campaigns and other marketing initiatives  Maintain competence to produce accurate proposals based on certification requirements for each product you are authorised to sell  Stay abreast of business activity in your sector(s) of sales operation, to ensure you can support customer requirements and develop new sales opportunities through this knowledge.  Develop and enhance LR’s profile within the target markets through the strategic relationships and alliances with the relevant regulatory, industry and technical organisations.  Provide accurate and timely sales and business report forecasts and action plans as required  Work closely with SD and SDS colleagues to ensure that your account KPI’s are met in full, raising issues or risks in the appropriate way that enables resolution.  Key Health & Safety Responsibilities:  Eliminate or minimise employee's exposure to risks by reviewing, regularly, the health and safety risk register, applying appropriate controls, communicating results of risk assessment, and ensuring health and safety is considered in the planning and execution of all LR activities.  Manage your own and your team's compliance with health and safety rules, instructions, systems and legal requirements, ensuring employees are suitably trained and adequate resources are available to work safely.  Manage your own and your team's compliance with health and safety rules, instructions, systems and legal requirements, ensuring employees are suitably trained and adequate resources are available to work safely.  Role Dimensions:  Number of direct reports:  N/A  Geographic area of impact:  China  Size of budget responsible for:  N/A  Key stakeholders:  Area Sales Manager  Marketing Team  Service Delivery and Service Delivery Support colleagues  Technical / Professional Qualifications / Requirements:  Essential - Demonstrable of selling products and/or services in a comparable role in a B2B environment  Essential - Proven track record in achieving sales targets and pipeline development to ensure coverage  Essential - Demonstrable experience in managing quotations, bids, and proposals, including working to set pricing models to achieve required margin  Essential - Good oral and written communication skills, active listener and able to work under own initiative to prioritise and deliver work on time  Essential - Knowledge of standard IT programmes, Salesforce and comfortable in using proprietary software for business processes  Essential - experience in preparing and delivering proposal presentations to senior managers in a customer environment  Desirable - knowledge of the business assurance sector

description: 工作职责: Responsible for AOP for all products and projects of one customer line. Monitors budget, capacity, investment, tooling and initiate countermeasures in case of deviations Establishes / builds up an effective local organization to fulfill the customer’s requirements Responsible for the regional customer strategy in alignment with global CBU and Region, and provides input for the regional footprint strategy, as well as provides input for the respective customer strategies and ensures their implementation Identifies business opportunities and supports the business development and growth in alignment with the global CBU Organization Responsibility for profitability, timing, quality and cost of project portfolio with the other team members of the respective CBU 任职条件: Supervisory role with specific leadership experience more than 3 years and/or responsibility for medium to large size customers. Minimum 8 years working experience, with more than 5 years of proven success in Automobile Parts company. Above 3 years sales experience in OE accounts and a track record of working with a wide range of business partners Fluent English both in oral and written An understanding of Auto industry and products would be a distinct advantage

工作职责： 提供快速、有效率地日常销售支持，解决并协调销售在业务过程中遇到的各种问题，保证业务正常运行； 客户主数据、价格维护的申请与管理； 参与日常订单的审核处理及发货事宜的协调工作； 异常情况的跟进与处理（例如信用锁单、加单、坏账等）； 退货/冲红管理； 资产/免费设备/样品的管理； 分析、汇总各类数据并制作相关报表； 销售及客户需求信息动向的信息掌握和分享传递； 新项目系统相关支持及管理。 任职要求：  1， 大学本科及以上学历，具备5年或以上销售支持相关工作经验；  2， 逻辑思维清晰严密，能快速发现问题并具备独立解决问题的能力；  2， 具备良好的中英文书面能力；  3， 熟练使用office办公软件。具备数据分析能力，按销售要求提供各类汇总数据以及销售趋势分析；  4， 高度的责任心，优秀的团队合作精神及沟通技巧；  5， 良好的适应能力与灵活性，积极主动的工作态度，优秀的执行力与学习能力；  6， 优秀的组织、分析、问题解决能力。  post code: 001,  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.  In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Dalian
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, (Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Telecommunications

description: Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.  What you’ll do:  Drive Snap’s strategic growth in export retail industries by developing effective performance and brand marketing strategies. Act as a trusted advisor for China export retail customers to grow their businesses. Create compelling sales presentations to demonstrate the value of Snap’s advertising products Where appropriate, develop C-level relationships with strategic ecommerce clients  Coach the Sales Partners’ to effectively deliver Snap’s narrative and product positioning, the ad offerings for best market and customer fit Work closely with a cross functional team including sales operation, business support, product marketing , business marketing and product teams to achieve customer objectives and discover business opportunities. Mentoring new team members as our team grows. Deliver on quarterly revenue and goals for your portfolios.  Minimum Qualifications:   BA/BS degree or equivalent 5 to 8 years in media sales, media buying, partner management, management consulting, digital advertising and/or equivalent digital marketing roles Experience with E-commerce/Retail and/or online advertising technology and digital media. Established relationships with marketing decision makers at companies and agencies. A track record demonstrating an ability to develop and grow a book of business Excellent communication and presentation skills. Deep understanding of Snap and the social media landscape, and opportunities for marketers.  Preferred Qualifications:  Strong analytical skills with a “feel” for numbers  Ability to engage and partner with C-Level/VP level executives Ability to manage multiple projects at once  Passionate about Snapchat and up for the challenge of building something from the ground up

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Responsibilities： New Store Development Creating Business Market Plan and Initiating the City Development Strategy Identify location opportunities to pipeline the developments Commercial Terms Negotiation FR Store Development Board Approval Leasing Contract negotiation & Execution Partner with Finance Planning & Analysis for new store budgeting and planning Continuously monitor the newly acquired stores performance, identify areas of further improvement Existing Store Management Existing Store Network Optimization Lease Renewal Store Relocation/Expansion Stockroom Lease Renewal On-going Coordination with Landlords Other Function Coordination Market Analysis & Intelligence Pre-opening Coordination with All Department Sales Performance Monitoring Collect the key competitor’s new doors location and sales trend Qualifications： Bachelors degree or above Minimum 5+ years of BD experience in similar capacity with multi-national organization and / or luxury retail industry Strong analytival skills and expert in Excel Advanced English skills, both spoken and written

COMPANY BACKGROUND  DATALOGIC得利捷是唯一一家专注在自动数据采集及工业自动化领域的全球领先供应商。作为世界级整体解决方案供应商，DATALOGIC得利捷的领先技术涵盖条码阅读器、数据采集移动终端、传感、测量与安全、视觉系统及激光标记系统等领域。 积极了解和及时响应所有客户需求，以及持续创新和高品质的产品供应，是Datalogic得利捷40多年来取得成功的基础。DATALOGIC得利捷为零售业、运输与物流业、制造业及医疗卫生业等各行业的全方位应用提供创新高效的整体解决方案。 得利捷（深圳）工业自动化有限公司（隶属于Datalogic S.p.A) 的产品被大多数超市和POS、主要机场、顶级运输和邮政服务以及全球最大的医院所采用，DATALOGIC为客户提供涵盖所有市场需求的全系列产品，其技术是数十年专业技术积累的最终成果。 DATALOGIC得利捷有45年的发展历史，在全球拥有超过1200项专利及专利申请，11个研发中心（意大利，美国，中国和越南）和遍布五大洲的成千上万的知名合作伙伴与客户。多年来，DATALOGIC得利捷始终以满足客户需求作为产品质量的核心，凭借此奉献精神，和在研究开发方面付出的大量投资，以及高瞻远瞩的管理层的大力支持，公司业务和规模得以飞速发展和壮大。 DATALOGIC得利捷于1972年成立，总部位于意大利博洛尼亚市，于2001年在意大利证券交易所上市（代码DAL.MI）。目前，DATALOGIC得利捷集团在全球30多个国家拥有约2900名员工，在美国、巴西、意大利、斯洛伐克、匈牙利和越南设有制造工厂。   职位：市场部实习生 •协助支持大中华区（中国、香港、台湾）的市场推广，以产生更多销售线索以及提高品牌知名度。包括： •协助本地化公司官方网站、电子邮件、视频、宣传册和其他市场部资料。 •协助本地化公司内部和外部的新产品相关文件。 •协助支持区域需求内的渠道营销计划，执行并确保符合公司品牌和视觉标准。 •协助CRM系统中的销售线索跟踪，评估和提高每个市场活动的有效性。 •协助支持市场活动，如路演、研讨会、展会、合作伙伴会议等。 •与整体市场营销策略保持一致，协助支持其他市场相关活动 •接听销售热线电话并按要求把客户的信息记录下来并分配给对应的销售同事（入职后会有培训）； •将客户询价信息录入CRM系统 •其他相关市场部相关事务 任职要求： •本科在读，每周至少3-4天 •乐观开朗，愿意往市场营销方向发展 •良好的沟通能力，包括口头和书面技能

Organized with methodical approach for prospecting Excellent oral and written communication skills Skills Strong phone presence and experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills Strong attention to detail, organizational and time management skills Good communication skills Attentive listening skills endpoint is an equal opportunities employer AA/M/F/Veteran/Disability.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  About The Role  This role is responsible for licensing ARM China technology to ARM China semiconductor partners and growing ARM China business in both short term and long-term view.  Developing sound, professional, long-term relationships with management/technical/marketing personnel at the partner is a key role as well as creating, reporting and executing on account strategies.  Working with the segment marketing managers, strategic alliance managers, FAEs, ARM China executives and business units, the Regional Account Manager will address partner requirements, drive sales revenue, close license contracts and be responsible for the partner account strategy moving forward which will position ARM China to maximize revenue as well as position the partner for success with ARM China in the marketplace. The Regional Account Manager is responsible for all business and account management aspects of the partner relationship and is expected to maintain a high level of knowledge of ARM China and its products, services and competitors.  What will I be accountable for? Define and maintain detailed account development plan for nominated regional partners which covers financial sales goals, strategic target goals and plans to grow partner’s commitment to ARM China over time; report weekly on account progress. Map out formal partner business organization and reporting structure, including semiconductor and product development divisions. Develop and own strategic and tactical relationships at management, engineering and marketing levels; gain understanding of informal decision making organization. Negotiate and close contracts for ARM China technologies and services. Represent partner to ARM China and provide feedback to ARM China business units, engineering, marketing and management regarding partner technical and business requirements. Identify and capture competitive landscape, trends, unit and ASP projections, acquisition activities and other relevant partner information. What skills, experience and qualifications do I need?  Critical Success Factors Achievement of financial sales goals and licensing objectives. Development of strong relationships with key personnel at partner accounts. Successful relationship mapping between customer personnel and identified ARM China personnel. Solid knowledge of ARM products, services, schedules and key personnel. Technical Skills Over 5 years experiences in semiconductor sales, FAE, marketing. Working knowledge of partner target markets and applications. BS/BA required. Knowledge of microprocessors (RISC) and systems, SoC designs helpful. Knowledge of AI/Server/Auto market helpful. Good presentation skills; able to present to different levels – management, engineering and executive. Dynamic, self-starting individual who is driven to maintain regular contact with partners. Team player with good interpersonal skills: communication (written and verbal), organized, personable, entrepreneurial, customer focused and customer sensitive, able to motivate team members and co-workers, able to influence, flexible and hard-working. Able to credibly represent partner requirements to ARM China and to motivate ARM China to meet these requirements. Willing to travel up to 50% of work.

Location: SHANGHAI, CHINA  Who We Are  Brinc is a venture capital firm on a mission to discover and back the world’s most talented entrepreneurs, help them create successful companies at scale, and build thriving global ecosystems. We are one of the most active venture capital firms in the world.  Since its inception in Hong Kong, Brinc has invested in over 200+ companies via its 12 accelerator programs and offices in 6 countries. Its 65+ team members are located in 9 countries around the world in order to support the Brinc global portfolio of investments which spans more than 36 countries.  Brinc also works with the world’s largest and most innovative corporations. We help multinationals source startups, engage with growth-stage businesses and invest in promising companies. Some of our past engagements include partnerships with Manulife, Schneider Electric, Puma, Huawei and many others.  Who You Are  You are the most well-organized person you know! When you see a problem you roll-up your sleeves and fix it. You are a team player and a self-starter who is able to adapt to change and work independently. You are passionate about corporate innovation, consulting and change management.  You are also self-driven, smart, humble, and are excited at the prospect of joining our Brinc family of #GameChangers and helping us execute our vision to build thriving tech ecosystems around the world.  What You Will Do  You are the most organised project manager you know! You should be a naturally curious and cool-tempered professional who is able to handle stress. We expect you to have an organised and analytical mind, and you believe in First Principles. You have strong analytical and communication skills. If you are also confident in your client interfacing skills and project management abilities, we’d like to meet you.  Your goal will be to deliver successful corporate engagements and grow the business.  When you see a problem you roll up your sleeves and fix it. Setting up and implementing processes is second nature to you. You are a self-starter who is able to adapt to change and work independently. You are passionate about the Startup Ecosystem globally and clearly understand how to solve problems.  You are also self-driven, smart, humble, and are excited at the prospect of joining our Brinc family of #GameChangers and helping us execute our vision to build thriving tech ecosystems around the world.  You will spend time meeting new potential partners and clients. Most importantly, you will be responsible for delivering and executing any existing corporate innovation engagement.  Example Projects Research exciting and growing startups in a number of verticals Manage sourcing engagements with corporate partners Support engagement between corporates and startups Design and lead innovation workshops  Roles & Responsibilities: Support with end-to-end execution and delivery of corporate innovation projects across Shanghai and support Hong Kong projects. This will involve working closely with our corporate partners to understand their innovation objectives, scouting for relevant startups and making recommendations on the best models for engagement. Support our Shanghai and Hong Kong business development team as we strive to establish ourselves as market leaders in corporate innovation. This entails identifying new partnership opportunities, cultivating strong client relationships, driving business expansion and developing proposals tailored to the needs of prospective customers. Maintain an understanding of key industry, technology and regional trends that are relevant for our corporate customers. Work with experts from across the organization to develop hypotheses, conduct primary research, perform targeted data analysis, synthesize market insights and publish thought leadership pieces. Provide support on a range of ad hoc projects that may include targeted market research, investment thesis definition for new markets, new product creation, accelerator program and marketing analytics, and operational improvement initiatives. This role is highly dynamic and collaborative. To execute your responsibilities, you will be working with cross-functional teams with members from different divisions and geographies  Requirements  Ideal Experience 4-6 years of client-facing experience in a relevant field (startup, consulting, finance, technology, corporate strategy, etc.) Passionate about technology, startups, innovation or a particular industry First-principles thinker and creative problem solver that is able to adapt to unexpected situations Detail-oriented, highly organized, and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment Self-motivated and the ability to flourish with minimal guidance or supervision Proven track record in managing and delivering projects from concept to execution Comfortable building relationships with corporate clients and startup founders Proficient in data analysis and presentation development Native English verbal and written communication skills. Native Mandarin verbal and written communication skills.  Nice To Have MSc/MA in Strategy, Business Administration or a related discipline Management Consulting experience (e.g. Deloitte, PwC, EY, etc) Sales experience and P&L responsibility  Interview Process  At Brinc we believe in getting the right talent on board. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Our process is objective and we have all candidates go through the same experience by completing the Bryq assessment which is a 20-minute online bias-free assessment, enabling us to screen candidates only on the job and company requirements. Once completed our team will reach out to inform you about the potential next steps of the process.  Benefits  A full-time position based at Brinc in Shanghai. A competitive salary, plus carried interest in your portfolio (when applicable) The opportunity to join a growing venture investor at an early stage and to make a significant impact in its development Work in an inspiring environment and receive ongoing training to develop your technical, leadership, and interpersonal skills Option to travel within the Brinc office ecosystem for work stints (Hong Kong, China, Barcelona, Dubai, Bahrain, Singapore, Sydney, India, Poland, and more...) Work for a purpose-driven organization that uses an ESG investment framework in order to help solve the world's most pressing issues by backing and supporting game-changing entrepreneurs
industries: Internet, Venture Capital & Private Equity, and Financial Services
