jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Telecommunications

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Scope of Responsibilities： Responsible for assisting PM in formulating overseas sales plans for C-TOUCH, Film & Tape Expo, NEPCON Responsible for the maintenance of overseas key accounts of all shows Responsible for managing overseas sales partners including ISG, overseas associations to make revenue contributions to all shows Responsible for developing potential sales partners and associations in emerging markets to help recruit overseas exhibitors and visitors Responsible for designing and making tailor-made packages for overseas sales partners and key accounts Responsible for assisting PM in show closing of overseas businesses Responsible for assisting PM in communication with other show teams in overseas countries and regions of RX Responsible for providing reports and insights of overseas business for show PM/VP to make strategic decisions Qualifications Bachelor degree or above At least 5 years sales experience in project management, exhibition industry experience is preferable Excellent Spoken and Written English, Japanese or Korean is a plus Creative and strategically thinking Mature, excellent inter-personal communications and presentation skill Well- organized, Hardworking and self-motivated Good understanding and relevant knowledge in international business culture with successful global key trade show experience preferable Extensive Travel experience Able to work under pressure and multi-tasked.

该职位来源于猎聘  Responsibilities Pre-sales activity will include delivery of technical expertise during the sales process including presentations, seminars, individual consultation, and hands-on demo experiments if needed. Executes technical and application based presentations on illumina’s sequencing and microarray platforms, applications and/or workflows. Post-sales activity includes working with post-installation customers providing additional workflow or applications training in strategically important labs. Supporting/assisting customers with sequencing assay design to accelerate adoption of targeted sequencing on illumina’s platforms. Attendance at tradeshows/conferences in relevant fields. Be the point person for dedicated illumina User Group Meetings in collaboration with field marketing and support team to provide sample to data workflow training Assists sales and field marketing on new strategic initiatives requiring both technical and market knowledge Works collaboratively with territory account managers, marketing, service and support teams to ensure effective account/customer management and communication through pre-sales, during and- post-sales cycle, including review and meeting account pull through targets and goals Escalates technical issues to Technical Support for possible resolution for strategically important labs. Develops and maintain positive relationships with customers in assigned territory Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.  Preferred Requirements Life science industry experience preferred Applied Market Knowledge is a plus Extensive experience and understanding of leading genetics technologies and how they can be applied. Detailed knowledge of technological developments and trends in the sequencing markets Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills in Mandarin and English. Strong negotiation skills and ability to persuade Ability to travel within region to carry out primary responsibilities. All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.  Preferred Experience/Education Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 0-2 years of related experience; or equivalent work experience. 岗位概述  Responsibilities 售前活动将包括销售过程中的技术知识演讲，如介绍演讲、研讨会、个别咨询等，在必要时，进行演示实验。 对因美纳测序和微阵列平台的应用或工作流程进行技术层面和应用层面的介绍。 售后活动包括与安装产品后的客户的协调，提供在具有重要战略意义的实验室中所需的工作流程或应用培训 支持/辅助客户的相关测序阵列设计，加快在客户因美纳平台上目标测序进程。 参加相关领域的展览会/大会。 作为与现场营销和支持团队合作的专项人员参加因美纳用户组会议，提供样品数据工作流程培训。 提供销售或现场营销新战略项目时所需有关技术和市场知识。 与区域客户经理、营销、服务和支持团队合作工作，保证有效的大客户/客户管理以及负责售前、售中和售后过程的沟通，包括回访和会面已经取得成果或达成目标的客户。 作为技术支持提供技术升级，为具有重要战略意义的实验室提供可能的解决方案。 提升和维护责任区域内客户的良好关系。 以上所列的任务和职责是本岗位的基本功能。然而，各种商务条件下可能需要完成额外的任务和职责。  Preferred Requirements 有生命科学行业经验者优先 有应用市场知识者加分 具有领先的遗传学技术及其应用方面的丰富经验和充分理解 具有技术发展和测序市场趋势的详细知识 优秀的中文普通话和英文口头和书面交流和介绍演讲技能 良好的谈判技巧和说服能力 能在负责区域内出差并完成主要职责 Preferred Experience/Education 科学学科的硕士以上学历（分子生物学、遗传学、或基因组学和/或生物信息学优先）

Job Summary  Reporting to the VP of Sales, the Sales Leader China is directly responsible for managing and developing the team in China in order to grow the TSI business in China. This position is responsible for channel development, cultivating key account relationships with customers, and identifying and developing new opportunities in the region. In addition to sales management and coaching, this position is to oversee business development, implement global go to market plans, and the development/implementation of regional sales and marketing initiatives. This position will also have dotted line responsibility to the administrative functions of our China operation.Reporting to the VP of Sales, the Regional Managing Director is directly responsible for managing and developing the team in China in order to grow the TSI business in China. This position is responsible for channel development, cultivating key account relationships with customers, and identifying and developing new opportunities in the region. In addition to sales management and coaching, this position is to oversee business development, implement global go to market plans, and the development/implementation of regional sales and marketing initiatives. This position will also have dotted line responsibility to the administrative functions of our China operation.  Job Responsibilities Directly responsible for transforming the China operation to sustainable business growth with strong commercial infrastructure and professional business management. Has overall control of planning, staffing, budgeting, managing expense priorities, and recommending and implementing changes to methods. Responsible for developing the overall China business strategy including sales, vertical segment targets, go to market, business development and business operation. Articulate the timeline of this development and the necessary resources requirements with qualified justification. Builds a world-class commercial organization through recruiting, developing, managing and coaching the team. Provides leadership for the China organization that aligns with TSI’s corporate vision, mission and behaviors to inspire exceptional performance. Directs resources of China operation to maximize return for TSI and provide high quality experience for China customers. Makes decisions on administrative or operational matters and ensures operations’ effective achievement of objectives. At all times, represents the company in a professional and ethical manner. Directly addresses performance shortfalls in China organization – including assessment of non-performance, action plan for resolution, clarification of goals and consequences for continued non-performance. Directly assists high value customer accounts to facilitate stable ongoing business partnerships. Provides input on new market opportunities to TSI corporate personnel. Ensures that customers are fully satisfied with their interaction with TSI and are eager to enter into future transactions with TSI. Maintains strong relationship with positive references and ensure that any references given are supportive of company and product. Controls and resolves issues arising from non-optimal performance of TSI products and supports the development of corrective action processes Completes other assignments and special projects as requested. Supervisory Responsibilities  Manage the sales, application support and administrative functions in China.  Job Requirements Education Required Relevant Technical or Business Degree Desired M.B.A Experience Minimum of 15 years of progressive working experience and at least 8 years with people management Have direct and indirect and sub-distribution sales channel management experience in China. description: About The Role Key account (AbGenius) team focus on deep service and support KOLs to drive key accounts revenue that deliver Abcam’s strategic goals and objectives. These efforts will utilize our broad capabilities to position Abcam as the partner of cutting-edge scientists in Academic/bio-industry/hospital market. Working across the multi-channels, we aim to position the full scope of Abcam’s innovative technology platforms and expertise to serve scientists and capture downstream revenue opportunities. Most importantly, we are working hand-in-hand with these scientists to achieve their research better, to get their discoveries beyond research faster. Roles & Responsibilities Establish account plans, objectives and forecasts for each key account and update plans monthly. Serves as a consultant to the target accounts, tracking the shopping list of Accounts and identification of key influencer, decision maker and end user Work with channel manager and distributor sales team to drive the technical aspects of pre-sales and post-sales activities Leverage available resources to meet customer needs and work effectively with cross-functional team of supplier and internal resources Introduce Abcam’s cutting-edge product portfolio based on PI’s latest research/next step Develop strong relationships at the Key accounts to build a strong partnership for expanding the business opportunities. Keep abreast on market and customer research to provide knowledge about market and industry to internal and external customers Inform on product tactics, providing customer insights to the marketing/portfolio team. About You Master’s above Degree, Ph.D preferred, majors in molecular biology or biotechnology, Proven experience (1-3 years) in sales skills and key account management in life science industry. Solid knowledge of the cutting-edge in life science research/bioindustry is preferred. Has very strong convincing and influencing skills. Dynamic personality, team player with open communication style. Great customer facing skills. If this sounds like you and you’d like to be a part of a fast-paced, growing business with the vision to become the most influential company and best-loved brand in life sciences, please apply now!  Pay & Benefits  In addition to competitive salaries, we offer an attractive and flexible benefits package, a culture focused on well-being and opportunities for growth and development, and a highly flexible working environment.  About Us  An idea conceived in a University of Cambridge laboratory in 1998, Abcam plc (www.abcamplc.com) began life as an innovative and entrepreneurial start-up, spearheaded by like-minded individuals who shared a common purpose of providing the scientific community with quality antibody reagents, as well as trustworthy and up-to-date information about their uses and limitations. Abcam has now grown to become a leading supplier of protein research tools to life scientists, whilst always maintaining the core collaborative values assumed at its inception.  Abcam now supports life science researchers in their quest to understand the cause of disease and ultimately offer improvements to diagnoses and treatments. To achieve this outcome, the company both develops and manufactures its own products in specialist facilities across the globe, and sources from over 400 partners, offering scientists the newest, most innovative and highest quality research tools available globally, regardless of source. With a customer base of research scientists who require high performance products with detailed technical specifications, 64% of global researchers use Abcam products.  Inclusion & Diversity  Abcam is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes all employment decisions without regard to age, national origin, race, ethnicity, religion, creed, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

Who We Are  Organon delivers ingenious health solutions that enable people to live their best lives. We are a $6.5 billion global healthcare company focused on making a world of difference for women, their families and the communities they care for. We have an important portfolio and are growing it by investing in the unmet needs of Women’s Health, expanding access to leading biosimilars and touching lives with a diverse and trusted portfolio of health solutions. Company Description  Third Bridge was founded on the belief that human insights drive intelligent investment decisions.  To make the right investment decisions, our clients require access to the most relevant experts and their insights – we enable this through private consultations and exclusive content drawn from expert interviews.  Our clients consist of some of the largest private equity funds, hedge funds, mutual funds and management consulting firms, who are serviced by a team of over 900 employees located across eight global offices.  Third Bridge operates in a global, multi-billion-dollar market with double digit annual growth and has consistently received accolades for Great Places to Work and the top 100 fastest growing companies.  Job Description  The Sales Executive is responsible for prospecting, lead qualification, building relationships with prospective clients and delivering on the sales process. The position will have new business quota responsibilities.  Responsibilities Demonstrate Third Bridge’s value proposition across the entire suite of primary research services Execute end to end sales cycle for potential clients; from lead generation, managing trial accounts to the closing of new business deals Prospect potential clients who fit on-boarding criteria, develop relationships to better understand their broader research needs and explore cross-selling opportunities Nurture and track accounts to identify additional opportunities such as up-selling and cross-selling Successfully transition new accounts to account management team including onboarding handoff, introduction to key client stakeholders, etc. Collaborate with the entire global sales team (US, Europe, Asia) to help achieve firm revenue / sales targets Skills Experience or knowledge in selling directly in a B2B company. Experience with private equity, public equity and/or credit firms preferred Customer-centric attitude, and excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Proven experience in communicating effectively and building relationships quickly over the phone Demonstrable ability to create leads effectively with excellent networking skills A self-starter, who can establish and organize daily sales activities with minimal supervision Ability to manage pipeline and forecast accuracy on a monthly/quarterly/annual basis Qualifications 2-4yrs of sales experience Bachelor's Degree Proven track record of quota attainment Additional Information  What you can expect Private Medical Insurance Study support 15 days annual leave (increasing with tenure) 2 days’ off per year for community/corporate responsibility activity The successful candidate must, by the start of the employment, have permission to work in the country they are applying.  We know that to be truly innovative, we need to have a diverse team around us. That is why Third Bridge is committed to creating an inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. If you are not 100% sure if you are right for the role, please apply anyway and we will be happy to consider your application.

description: About Us:  Epicor Software Corporation is a global technology leader dedicated to helping businesses drive growth for more than 45 years. Our modern, industry-specific software helps customers boost efficiency and productivity by simplifying and automating everyday processes. We have a stellar team of nearly 4,000 worldwide employees who are passionate about building exceptional products and solutions through teamwork, constant innovation, and integrity. We strive to hire and reward star players who inspire one another and drive results for the business and our customers.  About the Role:  Your job will be to generate interest in our suite of visionary ERP software solutions. As a Business Development Representative at Epicor, you’ll begin to learn the ropes immediately. In your first weeks and months, you’ll focus on training and gaining as much knowledge as possible around Epicor and our products. As you learn, you’ll begin reaching out to prospects and building relationships with key stakeholders in your industry.  You’ll want to have the spirit, positivity and personality to enjoy the challenge of a new career in business development. Persistence and resourcefulness are also important if you’re to reach and engage busy people. If you’re looking for a role with a ton of opportunity to gain new skills, win new customers and become part of an outstanding global team, it’s time to talk to Epicor.  What You’ll Do: Create inroads with key decision makers in businesses across NA to generate interest in Epicor products Hit the pipeline hard to grow and nurture opportunities for the sales organization Keep on top of market research to share with your field territory manager so we can stay on top of the game Call, e-mail, DM, smoke signal the top and middle-size discrete manufacturers in your territory and build trust-based relationships Always. Be. Learning. From Epicor products, focused industry to our value proposition, to the many applications for our software, make sure you know the latest What You Need to Succeed: You are goal oriented and highly self-motivated for success, with a proven track record of achieving set goals You are adaptable and thrive in situations where you can think quick on your feet. Previous experience in IT industry: Business Development, B2B Sales, Call Center/Telemarketing, Customer Service. Bachelor’s degree preferred Additional Skills That Could Set You Apart: Sales or tele sales experience in ERP or MES vendor from local or foreigner (such as Kingdee, Yonyou or Digiwin software) Experience with discrete manufacturing Experience with CRM Software (e.g. Salesforce) Understanding of China Market especially in discrete manufacturing Evidence of hitting/smashing targets Self driven Self motivated Working under pressure Both language of Mandarin and Cantonese jobs.epicor.com

description: Job Description The Account Executive will have Overlay Quota Responsibility for assigned Software products selling in the assigned territory. There will also be Primary Quota for some selected products. Drive transactional-based revenue along with larger enterprise-wide solution selling and IT engagements. Responsible for sales process and decision-making strategy in an effort to further revenue production and Quota attainment. Heavy interaction with technical associates to drive the deal. Will work collaboratively with field Sales and authorized Partners for some products to drive revenue. Responsibilities To achieve assigned revenue target by selling PTC ’s software, training, and consulting to product development companies Work with Certified Software Partners to drive Revenue Prospect and develop new accounts while maintaining sales within existing accounts Coordinate with Regional Sales Directors and Field Reps Ensure Quality Control of finished projects and document these Projects monthly Working with Cross Functional Groups such as MKT, Enablement, GBO Working with Scheduling of training classes Drive Designated channel account revenue to specified Reseller Develop revenue forecast in coordination with Sales RD Quarterly Commits Track Sales Process with Internal CRM system Answer incoming calls and e-mails in relation to sales questions Help process immediate orders in for delivery of software Answer questions on software, Training, and Consulting Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Minimum 3 years of Inside Sales Experience Sales experience in IT industry, software company is a plus Proven team player attitude Desired Skills & Experience Major in Information Technology 5 years in Software company is a plus Good understanding of software subscription (SAAS) model is a strong plus Software License Compliance experience is a strong plus Competitive Drive and Strong Desire for Success Fluent English in written and reading PTC Company Description About PTC (NASDAQ: PTC) PTC unleashes industrial innovation with award-winning, market-proven solutions that enable companies to differentiate their products and services, improve operational excellence, and increase workforce productivity. With PTC, and its partner ecosystem, manufacturers can capitalize on the promise of today’s new technology to drive digital transformation. Why Join Us And Benefits Summary When looking for a new job, we know you are looking for something that aligns with your values, passions, dreams, and lifestyle. Our team is passionate and committed. We are driven by innovation and value our work-life balance. Check out what it’s like to work at PTC at #lifeatPTC. We believe that diversity of experience and background leads to better ideas and a stronger company. We encourage everyone to bring their unique perspectives to our team. We take a holistic view of the employee experience and provide you with what you need to take care of your health, your wealth, your well-being, and your career. PTC benefits are among the most competitive in the industry. While your salary is the major component of your compensation, you also receive a competitive benefits package including: Retirement Savings Plan with Company Match Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) Healthcare and Dental insurance Paid Time Off and Sick Time Birthday Day-off Tuition Reimbursement (Canada, India, Israel, US) Holiday Pay Employee Referral Program Management and Employee Training Development Other Regional-specific Benefits All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. description: Job Description  THIS IS AN 18 MONTH FIXED TERM CONTRACT.  The Programmable Solutions Group is proud to serve more than thousands of customers with our leading technology in FPGAs, Power and structured ASIC products. In order to make sure that our Field Sales team and FAEs can spend as much time as possible with the customers, the Sales Operations Specialist team is here to make sure that the machinery in the background is working smoothly. We are the first point of contact and we know the ins and outs for almost any question, and if we don't know it, we find it out or get hold of the right person. We are working closely with teams across the globe who support us in our daily endeavours. Manages the sales operation process, performs forecasting, budgeting, planning, quoting, and analysis activities for sales operations. Acts as the communication conduit between the Customer, Sales, Business Unit, and the Factory to optimize revenue and achieve mutual objectives. Manages the customer's supply chain requirements, product demand and the company's supply strategies. Evaluates pricing structures to ensure fit with company objectives. Approves and executes pricing exceptions. Develops, implements and manages the underlying business processes running the sales operations functions. Determines CRM, other sales enablement, and sales operations system requirements to support the business processes, working with IT. Manages sales data operations and view of performance to critical business indicators. Strong ability on systematizing reports and business analysis, he/she is able to manage the data with multiple criteria, provide a clear picture of business trend and its impact. Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint Ability to regularly perform independent analysis, development, and implementation of solution to complex problems in business management and operations. Ability to Work both regionally and globally, flexibility in working hours to support other time zone This Job Might Be For You If  You enjoy solving problems. Taking on a challenge is something you like and finding a creative solution is your speciality. Finding the answer and not giving up is a strength of yours.  You like helping people. You go above and beyond and you not only do what you're asked to do, you look one step ahead and do that little extra - with a smile.  You pay attention to details. When you do something you do it thoroughly and well. You're organized and well prepared. Being able to prioritize and re-prioritize during the day is not a problem.  You communicate clearly. English is the corporate language and you can both speak and write it fluently. Listening to understand is also a given, and you ask clarifying questions to make sure.  You are motivated and driven. Working independently and taking a task and work on it from start to finish, involving the people who can help you when needed. If you see something that can be improved, you raise your voice and present your proposal.  You like working in a team and you are comfortable sharing both success and mistakes, as you learn from both. You support your team during holidays and leaves and you can also rely on your peers when you need their help.  Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or other relevant third level qualification Supply chain, program management, order management, planning or related experience in a semiconductor or high-tech company. Hands on experience with order management systems like SAP, Salesforce Experience with MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, MS Office A typical day as a Sales Operations Specialist might look like this: Work in Salesforce with the newly submitted Design Registrations from our distributors and ensure that criteria's and guidelines are met before approval. Meet with your Sales Representative with the Distributor FAE team to review the current Design Pipeline and help move the designs forward Review the Quote requests in Siebel that our distributors have submitted and make sure that all details are in place before assigning it to our Business Management team for approval Prepare for and drive an important call with a customer to work on a critical delivery situation that has been escalated to you together with our Customer Operations team. Our distributor Asset team is also involved and you are orchestrating this on behalf of Intel. Monitor and ensure that the Opportunity Pipeline Health criteria's are met and take necessary actions, for example alert the Sales team about some opportunities that are approaching the decision date soon. Arrange a sample order for a customer who need parts urgently for a prototype build Support your Sales Representative with necessary information for forecasting purposes, you find the information easily in Power Bi or BOBJ. Track and trace a piece of business that was designed by the Sales Team in Finland and that has started to ship in Malaysia, in order to bring back the revenue to the region. Answer emails from your distributor partners related to leadtime questions, access to our portal and pricing queries. Help a customer to renew a license for software and consult our team in Penang if there are questions you cannot answer Take the advanced Excel training via the O'Reilly platform that your peer recommended. Inside this Business Group  The Programmable Solutions Group (PSG) was formed from the acquisition of Altera. As part of Intel, PSG will create market-leading programmable logic devices that deliver a wider range of capabilities than customers experience today. Combining Altera's industry-leading FPGA technology and customer support with Intel's world-class semiconductor manufacturing capabilities will enable customers to create the next generation of electronic systems with unmatched performance and power efficiency. PSG takes pride in creating an energetic and dynamic work environment that is driven by ingenuity and innovation. We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why PSG is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential.

description: Siradel, an Engie group company, is providing over the world 3D digital twins of cities, collaborative and 3D visualization platforms with simulation smart city solutions to make cities more sustainable, connected, and resilient.  In strong growth for the development of 5G network design solutions and smart city projects, SIRADEL is strengthening its sales teams and opening several positions.  Why join us?  SIRADEL's smart cities solutions (data, software, expertise) contribute to the zero-carbon energy transition of cities and industries, the raison d'être of the ENGIE group.  Joining a team of experts in an agile, human-size company (160 people based in Rennes, Paris, Nice Lyon, Toronto, Dallas, Hong-Kong, Shanghai), you will be given the opportunity to work on innovative projects with the ambition to support Engie Group in its zero-carbon energy transition strategy.    JOB DESCRIPTION  Reporting to VP Sales Europe & APAC, the candidate will be responsible for developing and growing sales activities along with specific key accounts within territory of China (including Hong Kong, Macao and Tai Wan).  As Sales Manager you will be responsible to meet or exceed the assigned sales targets. You will have a track record of successful sales of telecom products, services and solutions similar to the Siradel portfolio and will have sold these successfully into the designated Chinese territory. You will have trusted C-level and Director-Level relationships with mobile operators, telcos vendors, telco regulators and have easy access to decision makers. You will have good knowledge of Telecom technologies and systems especially those in RF network planning (4/5G, Wifi), Radio propagation and IoT domains. You will be responsible to architect and execute a sales strategy for the assigned accounts which both successfully manages Siradel’s current business and succeeds to enable key growth initiatives.  You will succeed by having a keen understanding of the customer’s key business challenges and you will work with the client to develop solutions which deliver real value. You will thrive under your own initiative. Your customer base will expect you to know their business – frequent travel to them will form a large part of your work.  You will be an effective internal communicator and collaborator working successfully with all appropriate Siradel business functions. You will be responsible to adhere to appropriate sales approval and reporting processes.  As Sales Account Manager you will have clear business development and sales responsibilities for the Siradel connectivity portfolio of Products, Services and Solutions.  This will involve the following main responsibilities :  Progress and achieve the annual and quarterly business sales target for Chinese Telecom Market Develop and support new and existing business and technical partnerships across Mainland China, Hong Kong, Tai wan and Macao Prospection, follow up and develop new sales opportunities in China Build company and product line brand awareness in China Build, negotiate and close sales offer Participate in customer presentations, exhibitions, seminars and marketing activities   QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS  Minimum 5 years B2B sales experience in Chinese Telecom Market  BS/MS Degree level in Telecom, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent. Consistent achievement of Sales Targets Good commercial awareness, skill in communication and customer relationship maintenance, well spoken, confident and outgoing Team player who is driven by achievement and success Strong internal leader and collaborator Knowledge market : mobile Telecom, GIS, ITS, smart city. Fluent english is essential and the mastering of French is prioritized. Availability to travel frequently, for short time period.   PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS  Customer service orientation – a strong sense of customer service is required towards both internal and external customers Communication – clearly express ideas, listen, adjust language or terminology to suit the needs of the audience Initiative – the ability to perform duties before being told to do so. This will require a self-starter who is proactive in trying to achieve business unit goals Sense of urgency – react quickly to customer requests Teamwork – work effectively within the Siradel team structure    STATUS  Location: Shanghai, China Status: Full-Time. Compensation: package (fix + commission) based on experience and qualifications   CONTACT  CV and cover letter to jobs@siradel.com Reference SALES/LZ/02-2021

A. Purpose /Role of the job： Supports the global/regional key account business/transplants in East China. Maintain key account sales & service within the territory. Business develop in Key accounts, explore new business opportunity; develop Electronics & Household customers and new applications to achieve even beyond the existing sales target.  B. Environment/Context/Complexity of the job: •  Internal: Account managers, CSO, Plant QC, R&D, Technical Managers, RHQ •   External: Customers, compounding service providers, distributors, test centers, Associations  C. Responsibilities/ Accountabilities of the job: •  Key Result Areas : East China Key account business activity Major Activities : - Operational actions for E&H EC and global key account local support. - Develops & reviews contractual agreements, supply chain & product flow concepts & service - partner management for E&H business. Outcome : Deliver annual target CM1 result at premium margins and direct/guide local E&H key account managers.  • Key Result Areas : Maintain existing business (East China) Major Activities : - Communication with existing customers and regular visit to ensure order collection - follow customers’ inquires - Maintain all technical and service record and case history on customer sales. - Maintain good relationship with customer related key persons to stable business share Outcome : Achieve target of sales volume and profit  •  Key Result Areas : Business Development (East China) Major Activities : - Work with Key account managers to scout the market trend to seek new business chances both for customers and Styrolution. - Coordinate customers' seminars to promote new products and solutions from Styrolution. - Contact related industry associations to collect market and industry information - Identify and visit potential customers and lead the development process until business achieved Outcome : Open up new business successfully  •   Key Result Areas : Technical consultant     Major Activities : - Verify the customers’ complaint on site, and contact internal and external related parties to lead the whole process until problems solved.       - Serve customers’ concern such as material selection, process optimization, mould optimization, etc. - Manage local compounding service providers in the region to ensure them delivering qualified service and products to end customers  Outcome : Solve customers’ technical related issues and achieve sales target  •    Key Result Areas : Reporting Major Activities : - Obtain, update and evaluate market of responsible customer/industry - on time sales activity report, forecast or any requested report accurately and punctually - GKA business support and reporting. Outcome : Make management understanding market / customers for decision making   D. Required profile:  Level of education & Knowledge: Bachelor degree, preferably Polymer Science and Engineering  Experience in general: Min. 5 years in plastics industry related technical service, business development etc. Preferably having work experience in an international company  Technical skills: Fundamental knowledge about polymers and polymerization process Plastics processing trouble shooting. Fluent in English and Chinese, both writing and speaking  Competencies, Behavioral skills: Strong customer focus Very good negotiation skills Good interpersonal and presentation skills

Demonstrating exceptional operational awareness and as a people management role of the front-line team, the Customer Service Supervisor is primarily responsible for ensuring schedule adherence and efficient ways of working across all contact channels, providing Manager on Duty (MOD) support to the customer service center and provide effective coaching and mentoring to the front-line staff to generate key results including service level, customer satisfaction and revenue.  Responsibilities • To monitor, guiding and assessing CS daily work based on SOP and FAQ; • Daily resource organisation and planning to ensure adequate resource is available for contact volumes on all channels; • People management including individual coaching, offering corrective action and keep team morale in good status by creating a positive environment to support the front-line members and team in achieving the targets; • Quality assessment to maintain the team’s delivery quality and customer relationship development from building good customer experience; • Establish and update the training document and deliver training to the whole team; • Provide administrative support to consultants and other departments in the completion of departmental processes and procedures when necessary; • Process improvement and optimization; • To investigate and handle complex customer cases and escalations thoroughly, liaising with other departments where necessary, to make solutions-focused and helpful recommendations for resolution; • Customer insight collection; • Prepare for regular business review and follow up the to-do tasks. Qualifications • Diploma degree or above • At least 1-year experience of supervisory role in contact centre environment, including daily operational management, supporting front-line staff, coaching and developing front-line team members • Working experience in a contact center where sales is one of the KPIs is a plus • Must be able to work flexible shifts • Being fluent in oral and written English • Fast learner and being able to deliver knowledge to others • Being able to work under pressure and in dynamic environment with multi-tasking skill • Being flexible with adaption to changes and trends • Good computer and Microsoft Office Software skills

Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Aug 23, 2021 Travel: No

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

description: The ideal candidate will be responsible for supporting our sales time activities. You will be a key contributor to our sales team’s success by providing outstanding customer service.  Job Description   Support Sales team on operation works with ERP system.  Assist in creating sales material for sales preparation and success.  Support documentation related in order placing.  Prepare and provide shipping documents to customers.  Support on maintaining a high level of customer satisfaction through high-quality after-sales service.  Perform other duties as requested or necessary to meet business conditions and changes.   Qualifications Required   Bachelor degree in International Trade, Business Administration, Commercial English, or related.  1-2 years export sales experience is preferred, fresh graduate is also welcomed.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other office productivity tools, with aptitude to learn new software and systems.  Good English reading & writing skill, as well as oral English capabilities.  Well-organized, have great time management skills and ability to multi-task.  Excellent communication skill, stable, patient and detailed.

PureLiving’s Qlear.io cloud is software as a service (SaaS) that creates value for businesses by bringing building data to life, through providing real-time analysis and display of indoor environmental quality (IEQ).  IEQ data is collected by monitoring hardware, streamed to the cloud, and instantly accessed via smart phone, tablet, laptop, desktop, or any other device with an internet connection. Qlear is the trusted data provider for 30% of Fortune 500 companies, who are leaders in their respective industries.   The Qlear International Sales Manager works to improve PureLiving’s Qlear software market position and achieve financial growth. This person defines long term strategic sales goals, builds key customer relationships, identifies business opportunities, negotiates and closes business deals and maintains extensive knowledge of current market conditions. To achieve this, you find potential new customers or partners, present to them, to ultimately convert them into clients, and continue to grow business in the future.  You see the bigger picture and love to find win-win, innovative solutions. You are a connector, known for brokering great relationships. You possess high IQ and EQ. You can effectively influence senior executives and junior operation executers alike. You may well have been a consultant or business development lead in the past.   业务拓展经理的工作是提高境纯的市场地位，实现财务增长。业务拓展经理需要定义长期的组织战略目标，建立关键客户关系，确定商业机会，谈判并完成商业交易，保持对当前市场环境的广泛了解。  你着眼于大局，寻找双赢、创新的解决方案。你是一个联系人，善于协调良好的关系。你有很高的智商和情商。你可以有效地影响高管和初级运营执行人。你曾经很可能是一名咨询师或业务开发主管。  业务开发经理在公司内部担任高级销售职务。你的工作是与客户经理、内部职能团队、营销人员和其他经理合作，以增加销售机会，从而最大限度地提高公司收益。为了实现这一点，你需要找到潜在的新客户或合作伙伴，与客户经理一起或独自呈现给他们，最终将他们转化为客户，并在未来继续发展业务。  Responsibilities ·       Prospecting new clients to ensure a robust pipeline opportunity ·       Creating and maintaining strong relationships with key contacts in new accounts, as well as existing customers to develop new opportunities ·       Strategic planning and implementation of new business development initiatives ·       Understanding competitor offerings and sharing relevant industry insights within teams ·       Meeting the agreed sales target for the position ·       Ongoing point of contact for key house accounts and oversight of long term account management ·       专注于寻找新客户，以确保一个庞大的渠道机会，并与客户服务团队合作，将这些转化为增加的业务。 ·       与新客户中的关键联系人以及现有未分配的客户建立并保持良好的关系，以开发新的机会。 ·       新业务发展计划的战略规划和实施。 ·       展示公司资质，并与潜在客户讨论潜在简报。 ·       作为一个团队，为整体战略做出贡献，在有机会的时候赢得客户。 ·       了解竞争对手的产品，并在团队内部分享相关行业见解。 ·       完成该职位商定的销售目标，包括但不限于产生直接收入或以项目平均利润率将渠道业务重新定向给客户经理，签署合作框架，推广展示厅项目等。   Qualifications ·       Over 3 years of sales and/or marketing experience or minimum 3 years of work experience related to business development ·       3-5年以上销售或市场经验 ·       或至少3年与业务发展相关的工作经验·        ·       A passion for executing live brand experiences ·       Self-motivation, a hunter who likes taking on challenges ·       Strong network and ability to leverage network ·       Strategic thinking, problem solving, communication & negotiation skills ·       Excellent presentation skills, ability to make sensible presentations which trigger sales opportunity ·       Excellent teamwork skills, time management and organization skills ·       Chinese passport or current (foreign) residents only ·       Proficient in English and Chinese ·       Qualifications in business management, environmental science, or HVAC are a plus ·       热爱推广和建设品牌 ·       自我激励，像猎人一样喜欢接受挑战 ·       有较强的人际关系和利用人际关系的能力 ·       战略思维、解决问题、沟通和谈判技巧 ·       优秀的演示技巧，能够做出合理的演示，从而激发销售机会 ·       优秀的团队合作能力，时间管理和组织能力 ·       仅限中国护照或目前居住在中国的（外国）居民 ·       精通英语和汉语 ·       商业管理、环境科学或暖通空调的资格证书拥有者优先考虑

Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. description: WHY DUPONT ELECTRONICS & INDUSTRIAL (E&I)?  There’s never been a more exciting time to join us. It's a time of incredible progress at DuPont — a time of momentum. It's the time for change makers, for the doers and pioneers, to create essential innovations the world needs. We pursue new technologies and performance materials that enable your designs to be smaller, more complex and more powerful than you could ever imagine.  DuPont is a technology leader, serving the semiconductor, circuit board, display, digital and flexographic printing, healthcare, aerospace, industrial and transportation industries. Why wait for a better future? Invent a better n ow. Build the next thing that changes everything!  Job Description Responsible for overall demand forecast accuracy, customer needs, problems and troubleshooting, interests, competitor activities, and positive/negative potential for existing or new products and services. Achieve agreed upon sales targets and key project milestones within schedule. Present, promote and sell products/services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers. Responsible for developing and maintaining relationships through all management levels with key customers Manage the balance between price, customer value, and cost to achieve the company’s profitability objectives. Proactively alert potential supply risk and co-work with supply chain for issue resolution. Effectively work with functional teams within DuPont to drive satisfaction both within DuPont and at customers. Teams include Quality, Demand/Supply chain, R&D, manufacture and marketing, etc. Responsible for making deals, negotiating contracts, managing conflicts, and tackling problems. Resolve customer complaints by investigating problems; developing solutions; preparing reports; making recommendations to management. Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, competitor’s activities, sample delivery schedule and result. Introducing the product offering and customer value proposition to customers Distributor management JOB QUALIFICATION More than 5 year of successful experience in display industry for Sales and Field Service. Experience in OLED is plus. Knowledge in OLED material, panel manufacture, processes and value chain or general consumer electronics. Experience working directly with China OLED panel makers is highly desirable. Proven work experience as a sales representative or field/customer service role. Experience on distributor management is preferred. Excellent selling, communication, time management and negotiation skills. Good interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to quickly and effectively build relationships, interact, and communicate information with internal and external stakeholders. Good strategic thinking, an influencer, communicator, problem-solver with strong customer-orientation, and execution. Highly self-motivated and target driven. Good team player. Degree in Business/Marketing/Engineering/Material science or related fields Demonstrated ability to build relationships and communicate across the organization Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to travel up to 50% of the time Location Beijing, Chengdu, Wuhan, Shanghai Fluent English skills. Korean is plus DuPont is an equal opportunity employer. Daily management of administrative and business operational matters - Daily OA process - Daily administrative management within the global teams - Coordinating and following-up to solve CRM, IPO, compliance, Internal control, HR, ERP implementation etc. related matters internally and externally - Others Unify/maintain/update/optimize sales and marketing team management policy/system/procedure 6 Regularly checking operational risks, avoiding operational risks and ensuring the compliance of business operations 7 Trouble shooting and support the whole global sales and marketing team in all aspects. About Us  Inspectorio is a cloud-based SaaS solution focused on creating a dynamic and risk-assessment based Quality and Compliance program with the goal of generating more sustainable and transparent supply chains. Our network is a one-stop-shop platform where all key stakeholders in the production process can connect to execute, monitor, and report on Quality and Compliance activities.  Our products provide digitization, automation, transparency, and traceability, with a strong focus on advanced analytics & Machine Learning. This enables us to leverage customer data for predictive insights and dynamic risk-based interventions.  Founded in 2016, Inspectorio set out to revolutionize the supply chain industry. Today, we work with many of the world’s leading brands and retailers, and thousands of vendors and factory organizations across the globe to bring unparalleled levels of visibility, transparency, and accuracy to their quality, sustainability, and compliance initiatives!  Job Summary  Customer Success Lead will be mainly responsible for providing consultation and technical support to customers through online communication or telephone, and timely communicating with other teams (Product and Development team) about customer feedbacks so as to drive product development and innovation, which help providing better services to customers.  Responsibilities Deliver consistent training/onboarding experiences for all clients to ensure successful adoption of Inspectorio products Propose, develop, and lead the execution of adoption plans and corrective action plans for customers Support user questions/concerns via email support and chat support channels Escalate and follow-up on system issues/bugs until successful resolution Field and communicate client feedback via Support channels to appropriate internal teams to help drive the user-centric evolution of Inspectorio Collaborate with the Customer Success and Support Teams and across other teams (Product and Development team) to use customer feedback to drive product development and innovation. Execute tasks according to defined processes and procedures consistently.  Requirements At least 2 years in a customer-facing organization Fluent English is a must Presents very organized and structured thinking for planning and execution purposes. Utilize forward-thinking to implement creative ways to solve complex customer challenges.  COMPETENCIES Exceptional organizational and analytical skills Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to analyze and utilize data to drive insights related to product, user education, and support improvements. Ability to make timely decisions and have sound judgment. Ability to collaborate within internal, cross-functional and cross-cultural teams (e.g. product management, other customer success team members, customer support, sales and operations) to deliver effective solutions to customers Strong individual contributor with a commitment to the customer  KEY TRAITS (listed based on importance): Excellent spoken and written English Passionate/excited for new, emerging technologies Creative problem solver- non-linear thinker Willingness to learn (coachable) Clear communicator (written and spoken) Relationship builder Analytical/Critical Thinker Tech-savvy Patient  Preferred Qualifications TEM - 8 in English or major in English Overseas working or education background Proficient in excel  Why it would be awesome to work with us  PERKS  Competitive Salary  At Inspectorio, we only work with the best of the best. That’s why, if we invite you to join us, it’s because we recognize your amazing skills, value, and potential. It probably wasn’t easy for you to become this awesome, so we make sure to reward you for it.  Full Project Ownership  Are you an inventor? Want to start a new internship program? How about a soccer tournament? Or a whole new department within the company? Whatever it is that you want to do, we’re here to listen, and if your idea is good, we’ll give you all the resources you need to make it happen. When any Inspectorian wins, we all win.  Personal and Professional Growth  Inspectorians are our most valuable resource, so we make sure to invest heavily in them. All Inspectorians are eligible for funding to attend conferences, take courses, present their research, and more. This on top of the continuous mentoring and guidance you’ll receive guarantees you’ll grow as a professional and as a human while at Inspectorio.  Fun, Fun, Fun  We put our money where your smiles are. Company-sponsored trips, weekly parties, sporting events, and more. We make sure that Inspectorians enjoy coming to work by promoting as much fun as we can.  International Work Experience  We are going to take over the world... Perhaps not quite, but we are a global company that thrives from the interactions between our different offices. Join us to work alongside Belarusians in Vietnam, Mexicans in Minsk, Filipinos in China, and more.  Our Values  EXCELLENCE  We pursue mastery and craftmanship. “Good enough” is our enemy.  We have a thirst and desire for knowledge and continuous improvement because there’s always an opportunity to be better.  We always find time to help and learn from others.  AUTONOMY  We act independently when we recognize an opportunity for improvement.  We seek guidance, alignment, and clear goals instead of orders or hand-holding.  We self-assess the quality and impact of our work, identify opportunities to improve, and make changes proactively.  COURAGE  We share our opinion and insights, even if it’s uncomfortable.  We are candid and direct with everyone we work with.  We are willing to experiment and try something new, even if we’re not sure it will succeed.  HUMBLENESS  We crave opportunities to learn from the people around us.  We focus on listening to other perspectives because we know we don’t have all the answers or best solutions.  We recognize that vanity and ego are the enemies of great ideas and outstanding products.

About Us 工作职责财务回报 监督竞争对手的活动并协助监察市场动态。 在洲际酒店集团的范围内将销售线索提供给适合的人员。 根据在销售策略中既定目标，向新的、现有的、有可能的客户进行销售，并与其谈判商定最适合的价 格以争取最大的利润。 销售酒店的所有设施。 设立和保持定期的销售拜访模式，与目标市场的主要人物会面。 进行市场调研和分析。 根据酒店的营业需要，与业务联系人、会务策划者、游客和会展局、旅行社、旅游运营商、航空公司、公司客户、政府部门和其它客人发展并保持联系。 需要时出差对酒店进行推销，发展潜在的业务机会。 监测现有业务，并在销售策略会上提出建议以扩大业务。 发展现有业务，并建立和寻找发展业务的机会。员工团队 及时与运营部门进行沟通。 与会务统筹部进行沟通并保持良好的关系。宾客体验 通过客户管理，向现有的客户提供服务。 对客户进行拜访。 招待客户。 策划并实施使客人熟悉环境的现场考察活动。 对客人的需求作出反应以超越客人的期望。 保持高质量的出品和服务以便在向客人销售酒店服务和设施时说明。 当客人提出请求时,协助和陪同客人到达他要去的酒店区域。 了解酒店的特别推广计划和活动以便在客人有需求的时候做出回应。 了解酒店目前的所有信息以便向客人提供咨询。 执行能够提高客人满意体验的工作程序。企业责任 配合酒店的节能计划。 配合人事部，做好酒店对社区的义务工作。 Your day to day 任职要求技能要求 具有代表酒店，品牌和公司与顾客，员工和第三方交往的能力 具有解决问题，推理，号召，组织和培训能力 精通微软办公软件 良好的写作技能学历 最好具有市场营销，酒店管理，商业管理或相关领域的学士学位或大专学历。经验 1-2年相关工作经验，或与此相当的教育与工作经验结合的背景。 Apply

该职位来源于猎聘  Responsibilities Pre-sales activity will include delivery of technical expertise during the sales process including presentations, seminars, individual consultation, and hands-on demo experiments if needed. Executes technical and application based presentations on illumina’s sequencing and microarray platforms, applications and/or workflows. Post-sales activity includes working with post-installation customers providing additional workflow or applications training in strategically important labs. Supporting/assisting customers with sequencing assay design to accelerate adoption of targeted sequencing on illumina’s platforms. Attendance at tradeshows/conferences in relevant fields. Be the point person for dedicated illumina User Group Meetings in collaboration with field marketing and support team to provide sample to data workflow training Assists sales and field marketing on new strategic initiatives requiring both technical and market knowledge Works collaboratively with territory account managers, marketing, service and support teams to ensure effective account/customer management and communication through pre-sales, during and- post-sales cycle, including review and meeting account pull through targets and goals Escalates technical issues to Technical Support for possible resolution for strategically important labs. Develops and maintain positive relationships with customers in assigned territory Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.  Preferred Requirements Life science industry experience preferred Applied Market Knowledge is a plus Extensive experience and understanding of leading genetics technologies and how they can be applied. Detailed knowledge of technological developments and trends in the sequencing markets Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills in Mandarin and English. Strong negotiation skills and ability to persuade Ability to travel within region to carry out primary responsibilities. All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.  Preferred Experience/Education Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 0-2 years of related experience; or equivalent work experience. 岗位概述  Responsibilities 售前活动将包括销售过程中的技术知识演讲，如介绍演讲、研讨会、个别咨询等，在必要时，进行演示实验。 对因美纳测序和微阵列平台的应用或工作流程进行技术层面和应用层面的介绍。 售后活动包括与安装产品后的客户的协调，提供在具有重要战略意义的实验室中所需的工作流程或应用培训 支持/辅助客户的相关测序阵列设计，加快在客户因美纳平台上目标测序进程。 参加相关领域的展览会/大会。 作为与现场营销和支持团队合作的专项人员参加因美纳用户组会议，提供样品数据工作流程培训。 提供销售或现场营销新战略项目时所需有关技术和市场知识。 与区域客户经理、营销、服务和支持团队合作工作，保证有效的大客户/客户管理以及负责售前、售中和售后过程的沟通，包括回访和会面已经取得成果或达成目标的客户。 作为技术支持提供技术升级，为具有重要战略意义的实验室提供可能的解决方案。 提升和维护责任区域内客户的良好关系。 以上所列的任务和职责是本岗位的基本功能。然而，各种商务条件下可能需要完成额外的任务和职责。  Preferred Requirements 有生命科学行业经验者优先 有应用市场知识者加分 具有领先的遗传学技术及其应用方面的丰富经验和充分理解 具有技术发展和测序市场趋势的详细知识 优秀的中文普通话和英文口头和书面交流和介绍演讲技能 良好的谈判技巧和说服能力 能在负责区域内出差并完成主要职责 Preferred Experience/Education 科学学科的硕士以上学历（分子生物学、遗传学、或基因组学和/或生物信息学优先）

Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. jobTitle: Associate Market Development Manager - Global Premium Winery
description: Worldwide Wine Group, China is the most potential market Promising career path, Business has great room for growth  About Our Client  The largest family owned winery in the world, with its established portfolio of wines sold in over 100 countries worldwide, our client is one the most prestigious and renowned producers of US wines globally and has been building its business in Greater China over past 15 years. Active in HK, Shanghai & Guangzhou, they are now looking to expand their business in to the North China market, having recently secured an agreement with a leading local distributor.  Job Description  Working remotely, you will lead the expansion of our clients wholesale business in North China and enable the successful performance of appointed third party distributor(s) or designated Wholesalers by providing marketing support, product and brand education across the China market. Develop and deliver effective marketing presentations to distributor management in partnership Works with distributor management to understand performance expectations and establish necessary sales goals, priorities and incentives.  The Successful Applicant  Experience in beverage (alcohol or non alcohol is highly desirable but not essential. What is essential however, is the ability to demonstrate a track record in building a network of distribution partners serving retailers and a consumer product background. You will be able to showcase your work with Distributors and wholesalers to develop the growth of your product portfolio. Bachelor's degree plus 4-5 years of Sales experience within the consumer products sector or alcohol beverage distributor focused on building brands in the North China market. Established relationships with specialist channels such as On Premise, Premium & E-Retailers. Skilled in positioning high end Premium product to brand appropriate customers. MUST be fluent in English & Mandarin.  What's On Offer  This a wonderful opportunity to work a business steeped in history. You will be joining a company that prides itself on treating its people equitably. As the first person in the North China region, you will have the rare opportunity to build a business that is yours. Our client has the ambition, appetite and resources to continue investing. This means you will have the chance to continue growing with the business. As you grow the business, you will be able to grow your career and continue developing.  Contact: untitled_design.pngCecilia Gong  Quote job ref: 4198631
