Job Profile Summary Supports the implementation of marketing, brand and comms programmes for the business. Supports the development, management and delivery of strategic programmes for the marketing team and adopts and adapts global brand offers, leveraging consumer & customer insights to drive innovation, defining country plans by brand and managing brand guidelines and policy.  Job Advert Key Results/ Accountabilities Expected From Role CVO Insight / Intelligence Build internal and external global and local networks to keep track of market trends and valuable insights to develop in CVO Strategy and annual Marketing Plan 4P Integrated Offer Product --- Handle CVO portfolio and portfolio pricing including ongoing review to identify gaps and build portfolio pipeline Activate new product launches including management of product introduction process (with OMS, Product Quality & Compliance accountabilities elements) internal/external communication and integrated launch activities. Place (Channel Offer) --- Develop / deploy valuable & pioneering channel offer by articulating China PU local channel / customer insight & opportunities and working closely with Global S&M Truck Team. Promotion --- Monitor implementation of programmes as per marketing plans to ensure on time, within budget delivery and adequate return on investments. Innovation & Digitalization --- Build enduring innovation & digital capability in self & works with digital professionals internally & externally to drive digital marketing activities. Marketing Plan Support Line Manager to develop the annual CVO marketing plan, align with sales and trade support teams, and work closely with them to execute the marketing activation plans to support delivery of distribution, volume, turnover, gross margin and market share targets. Plan and implement CVO ASP by key channel and key activities, improve ROI and supervise actual spending on track with ASP phasing plan according to monthly ASP review. Challenges faced on the role Operating in a global and local environment Anticipating market trends to ensure the continued competitiveness of Castrol’s lubricant business The incumbent will need to have digital marketing capability Ability to work in a matrix organization & influencing skills Any Other Relevant Information Critical role in ensuring full compliance with relevant processes (such as Picasso, streamline, pricing) To build strong working relationship with key global contacts Experience & Expertise University degree. Minimum of 3 years working in Auto related industries with B2B2C and B2B marketing experience (having both product marketing & channel marketing experience and have marketing experience in commercial vehicle sector will be a plus) Fast learner with good potential / flexibility Strong communication and analytical skills Proficient in English and Mandarin Good computer and presentation skills Experience in collaborating and influencing sales and functional organizations Self-motivated, high level of passion and drive HSSE Accountabilities Provide leadership in HSSE, consistent with BP values and the code of conduct. Understand and follow BP policies, standards and regulations relating to HSSE. Utilise the HSSE systems, processes and tools necessary to follow HSSE policies, plans and standards relevant to the role. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  Entity Customers & Products  Job Family Group Marketing Group  Relocation available No  Travel Required No  Time Type Full time  Country China  About BP CUSTOMER AND PRODUCTS We’re gearing up for the future. At bp our goal for C&P is to deliver the future of mobility, energy and services for our customers by innovating with new business models and service platforms.  C&P will become a hub, housing our midstream, lubricants, aviation, sale of chemicals, mobility and convenience, marketing and our next-generation businesses, making it a highly integrated and interconnected organisation. And with safety being our core value, our commitment to safe and reliable operations will never change.  Want to join the team? This means: being customer-centric, agile and responsive to changing customer needs and dynamic markets focusing on growth and development of customer offers optimising the chemicals and fuels value chains to maximise integrated value contributing to the reduction of carbon intensity of the products we create, and sell, by 50% by 2050 or sooner creating strategic partnerships that drive long-term value for C&P being digitally enabled and empowered by customer insights and data to deliver solutions. Experience Level Intermediate

Together, we can beat cancer.  At Varian, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions. If you want to be part of this important mission, we want to hear from you.  Improve market awareness and customer preference, support product development and produce go to market activities.  Apply strategic insight and analytical rigor to drive deep-dive market assessments and business case analyses of new, breakthrough growth opportunities and emerging/disruptive industry trends.  Partner with Sales, marketing and technology leaders across Varian to identify new growth initiatives, particularly in Software, IoT and cloud technologies.  Apply strategic insight and analytical rigor to drive deep-dive market  Build and shape Varian Solutions eco-system with Varian current portfolios and solution assets, including radiation therapy treatment Linacs, planning system, oncology information management system, artificial intelligence treatment planning solutions, oncology data analysis tools, the remote Quality assessment solutions, oncology cloud solutions, etc.  Responsible for identifying and driving future business opportunities for Varian Beijing Innovation Center. This role will focus on long term initiatives to help accelerate the BIC ’s goal to build our integrated cancer care solutions to benefit our cancer patients and our customers. It will require market opportunity assessments and collaborations/strategic partnerships with organizations in the oncology industry. These initiatives could focus on product integrations with other companies products, bringing new integrated cancer care solutions to market with some partners, or otherwise increasing the value of Varian products/RT institute Center/1st Varian Internet Hospital to our customers across the oncology industry. This role will directly report to BIC Director, launch efforts to expand and build wider range of Varian intelligent cancer care platform and drive the innovation and digital health growth.  In this role, you’ll be given exposure and the opportunity to contribute cross-functionally with Varian different teams to launch efforts that help Varian realize our mission of a world without fear of cancer. You will be consistently challenged and are expected to learn quickly from your cross-functional teammates as we work to make an impact on cancer care world together.  Fighting cancer calls for big ideas.  We envision a world without fear of cancer. Achieving this vision takes dedication and commitment from all of us, every single day. That's why we celebrate and value the distinctly beautiful and intersectional identities of each of our employees. We are a mirror of our patient-base, which allows us to innovate. Big ideas come from everywhere, and the best ideas are fostered by our unique individual experiences. At Varian, we encourage you to bring your whole self to work and believe your bold and authentic perspective will help to power more victories over cancer.  #TogetherWeFight  Privacy Statement

description: Sales Development Engineer is a full-time role within Sales focused on qualifying sales leads as well as driving new growth through identification of new business opportunities for NI. You will also be accountable for qualifying inbound customer demand and helping shape the future of prospecting initiatives by partnering with Account Managers, Corporate and Regional Marketing, and our evolving Partner Indirect Channel. We are seeking individuals who are driven and passionate, eager and able to build significant new business for NI, and motivated to maintain a high level of impact and activity.  This role offers a fantastic opportunity to shape the future of Sales Development in NI. Customer engagement is key for this position, alongside an ability to utilize industry and application insight to build pipeline, generate growth, and maximize customer relationships by following through on transactional business. Maximizing sales and revenue opportunities through B2B relationship building will be a new focus within the position. Applicants will demonstrate resilience and a passion to excel. The successful applicant will demonstrate confidence in sharing new ideas and strive to keep updated with market developments, competitors, customer demand, and new product lines to develop their business acumen, customer understanding, and soft skills.  Key Responsibilities Deliver best in class customer experience as the primary NI representative for any customer engagement Grow sales pipeline by qualifying inbound sales and marketing demand Generate new demand and connect contacts to NI from outbound prospecting activities Streamline transactional business by providing technical assistance and customer service Demonstrate leadership and regular feedback to scale best practices and behaviors Continuously learn from customers on latest industry trends and applications Partnership with cross functional peers(both local and global) to achieve organization goals You will have an opportunity to: Learn from the industry’s most complex applications and business demand behind Talk NI’s value and your opinion with accounts leading the industry Accelerate pace in developing B2B relationship and sales career Explore diverse values and cultures working at a global scale Voice feedback to improve operational process and productivity Work with the best and brightest talents to win as one team  Basic Requirements BS or MS Degree in EE, Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering or similar Excellent business and technical proficiency in English Strong desire to pursue a long-term career in sales Solid engineering knowledge and skills Time/task management capability prioritized on practical needs

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Key Responsibilities  The HCI Global Sales Leader, Chemicals will have a broad set of responsibilities that will encompass the following: Align HCI to SCA Clients priorities: Align Honeywell’s Connected offering to the client’s strategic and tactical business goals and objectives in the area of Digital Transformation and by doing so creating sales opportunities. Business Improvement: Identify business improvement opportunities within the client’s operation(s) where Honeywell Connected solutions can add business value and turn these into sales opportunities. SCA Customer Relationship: Work in partnership with the HPS & UOP SCA Account manager to develop and sustain strategic relationships with clients at the appropriate levels, such that Honeywell’s Connected solutions become, and are recognized as, strategic to the client. Strategic Partners: Develop mutually beneficial solution, and go-to-market regional partners for effective value proposition and market reach. Solution Selling and Education: Ensure that the value of Honeywell’s Connected solutions are clearly understood and effectively communicated to all appropriate executives and personnel in the client organization. Enterprise Sales: Ensure that business opportunities are converted into closed business. Meet and Beat the HCI Sales quota. KNOWLEDGE; SKILLS & EXPERIENCE Education Required Educated to a minimum of University Degree level or equivalent Postgraduate Business Qualification is advantageous Work Experience Required Customer engagement at senior levels; building long-term strategic and executive relationships Cross selling and consultative selling - experience with collaborating across both client and own organization to drive a One-Honeywell approach Commercial expertise and experience. Technical Skills & Specific Knowledge Required Confirmed and proven Industry & SW expertise in the Chemicals (Batch, Continuous, Specialty Chemicals) industry Establishing and building credibility Strong ability to develop and sustain customer relationships Clearly articulate value Compelling presentation and communication skills Closing the sale Execute effective negotiation strategies and plans Motivate others; high energy individual Be optimistic and tenacious at the same time; while applying experience, and a positive attitude consistently to deliver bottom line results for Honeywell. Prioritize and focus efforts on best opportunities (short and long term) based on business needs. Push self and others to achieve bottom line results Follow through See ahead clearly; can anticipate future trends accurately; learn quickly and think independently to adapt as required Overall Qualifications & Experience required: Energetic Sales Expert - motivated by results and ultimately long-term customer satisfaction At least 8 years of proven direct sales and business development experience for engineering and operations Software in Chemicals Experience in Mass Mid Segment of Chemicals market in China preferred Advanced degree required (preferably in Engineering disciplines) Excellent communicator capable of maintaining relationships with existing accounts at all management levels while also generating new business Capable of quickly translating business requirements into actions by defining "who does what by when" to ensure plans are executed. Remain aware of advances and current thinking in their fields and look for ways to apply the latest technologies and methods to their work. Recognize that the business needs to think differently in order to grow and that the customer is the cornerstone of our success. Motivated, self-organized individual who likes to serve customers & who is passionate about sales Mobility is required, given that the candidate will travel regularly to customer sites

Valid driver’s license with a clean driving history and proficient driving skills. 产品专家  主要职责 保证最佳客户体验：接待所有进店客人，回答问题，热情地为客户和特斯拉粉丝介绍电动汽车的优点,普及电动车知识。 通过良好的沟通，帮助特斯拉爱好者及未来车主更好地了解公司动态，明确特斯拉的发展前景并鼓励顾客试驾，并通过良好的试驾体验使潜在客户向亲朋好友宣传特斯拉。 收集潜在客户，参加市场活动，探索客户购买需求、激发客户需求，配合销售主管完成门店的销售目标。 对现有特斯拉车主提供高质量客户服务。 沟通最新公司讯息，帮助特斯拉爱好者及未来车主更好地了解公司动态。 认真学习了解公司及产品的相关知识，及时了解最新行业发展和最佳实践。 建立良好的客户关系，并在试驾过程中提供完美的客户体验使潜在客户向亲朋好友传递良好特斯拉口碑。 通过公司安排的内部测试，包括但不限于课程培训及测试、驾驶技术测试、店内测试、角色扮演、能力认证、试用期评估等，以达到正式员工的标准和要求。 和外部客户、外部人员，保持清晰、准确、职业、礼貌的沟通, 和内部同事保持良好的沟通和团队协作（包括同部门、跨部门；同门店、跨门店；同地区、跨地区之间）。 保持库存充足和整洁（如适用）。 员工在试用期期间发生的任何职位变更，包括并不限于调岗、晋升等，均不可视为通过试用期，员工需要通过试用期评估。 其他职责：根据业务发展需要，完成管理层指定的其他工作。 职位要求 应届毕业生或1到2年零售、行业销售、以及大客户销售经验或服务经验； 对企业文化高度认可。 出色的沟通能力和客户服务意识。 良好的自我管理能力及自我学习能力，积极热情地参与改变个人交通行业的变革。 深刻理解并传递业务问题和技术概念。 优秀的团队意识，是可靠的团队成员。 能够接受零售业的工作时间，需要晚上和周末工作；有销售经验优先。 持有有效中国驾照，熟练驾驶，且无不良行驶记录。

About CoachHub  CoachHub is the leading global talent development platform that enables organizations to create a personalized, measurable and scalable coaching program for the entire workforce, regardless of department and seniority level.  Listed in LinkedIn’s Top 10 StartUps for 2020, CoachHub is incredibly proud of its reputation as an outstanding place to work. Its vision to ‘help organisations to unleash their people’s full potential’ attracts people from all corners of the globe, with its 400 ‘CoachHubbers’ hailing from 45+ countries worldwide. CoachHub is consistently recognized on Glassdoor for its impact-driven work and thriving company culture.  CoachHub is backed by the world's leading tech investors, including Draper Esprit, HV Capital, Partech, RTP Global, Signals VC and Speedinvest.  The Role  About The Job  Check out our short presentation  bit.ly/JoinCoachHub_Sales  Is the topic of digitisation close to your heart? SaaS exactly your thing? Do you want to support people and companies in the phase of digital transformation? Then CoachHub is the right place for you! In just 2,5 years we have built a passionate team of over +300 people, all on the same mission to democratise coaching to employees at all levels. Come and join one of LinkedIn's top 10 Startups and make your mark!  We are looking for a new team member for our APAC Sales Team. As Enterprise Account Executive at CoachHub you will play a key role in our growth in the Asia Pacific market and as brand ambassador you will represent our mission of professional coaching for everyone. You take over the customers acquired by the Sales Development Representative and accompany them through the closing process. Make phone calls, web demos, on-site appointments, negotiations, and presentations to turn prospects into customers. You will support our clients as a consultant and maintain a constant contact with them You develop long-term customer relationships and build up a trusting and efficient cooperation You take part with the team in fairs & events to strengthen your network and represent our company professionally. You work closely with our Customer Success Managers and Sales Development Representatives You support the optimization of processes, content and success reporting Ideal Profile  YOUR PROFILE You have successfully completed your studies or training and have gained at least +7 years experience in enterprise sales. You have experience with closing deals in the 6-7 figure range ($) You convince through your professional and self-confident appearance as well as through your engaging communication skills. You stand out due to your exceptionally high motivation and enthusiasm. You distinguish yourself through your solution orientation and your independent work style. You speak Korean and English at native-level. A third language is a plus You bring a willingness to travel (up to 20%) What We Offer The opportunity to be part of a fast-growing start-up company from the beginning and to participate significantly in a global success story together Top business customer contacts, including leading top tier and tech groups and communication at management level Direct cooperation with our founders/managing directors Diverse learning and training opportunities and personal coaching from experienced entrepreneurs Your own personal business coach Regular Team Events Fun in a highly motivated team & a High Growth Company A job with Purpose Conveniently from your location (Shanghai, remote) What's on Offer? Work alongside & learn from best in class talent Opportunity within a company with a solid track record of performance Attractive Salary & Benefits

jobTitle: Assistant Director of Sales 助理销售总监
description: About Us JOB OVERVIEW 工作概述﹣(职位概述 ) Assists the Director of Sales and Director of Sales and Marketing in management of all sales activities and events including direct sales, sales solicitation, sales administration, public relations and management of the sale team 协助销售总监和市场销售总监管理所有销售工作与活动，包括直销、销售询价、销售管理、公关活动和销售团队管理。 DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 主要职责﹣(职务的主要工作) Assists in producing the Annual Revenue Plan 协助制定年度收入计划。 Assists in producing, implementing and monitoring action plans to ensure Revenue Plan objectives are achieved 協助制订与收入计划相关的工作计划，以确保收入计划目标得以实现。 Analyses current and potential markets/trends, coordinates all activities to maintain and increase revenue through added business volume and increased rate 对现有的和可能性的市场/趋势进行分析，协调各种活动，以通过增加的业务量和提高的价格来保持并增加收入。 Procures new and repeat business for the hotel by monitoring contact with airlines, travel agencies, commercial houses, private clubs and professional associations within local, domestic and international markets. Maintains contact with planners, corporate accounts, incentive buyers, airlines and wholesalers, through personal sales calls, telephone contacts and written communications 与当地的、国内的和国际市场上的航空公司、旅行社、商行、私人俱乐部和行业协会保持联系，以发展新客户及保持老客户。通过个人销售拜访、电话和书面交流等与策划者、企业客户销售人员、奖励购买者、航空公司、旅游批发商等保持联系。 Creates and implements special programmes to achieve greater productivity through: 设计并实施特别项目，通过如下手段取得更高的效率： o Increasing average rate 提高平均房价。 o Increasing occupancy 增加入住率。 o Increasing business volume during difficult periods 增加淡季的业务量。 o Increasing local food and beverage banqueting sales 增加当地餐饮和宴会的销售。 Manages key accounts 管理大客户。 Oversees the selling and servicing of group business 监管团组业务的销售和服务。 Co-ordinates the development of all promotional material 协调所有促销材料的制作。 Provides direction on and conducts market research 进行市场调研并提供指导。 Monitors competitor activities 监视竞争对手的活动。 Maintains close liaison with Regional/ Corporate Sales teams and those of other ICHG hotels to ensure the hotel receives proper corporate consideration, direction and support 与地区和公司的销售队伍保持紧密联系，确保酒店得到公司适当的考虑、指导和支持。 Plans and executes sales trips to major market areas 计划并实施前往主要市场地区进行销售。 Attends major travel functions to promote sales for the hotel 参加大型旅游活动，促进酒店的销售工作。 Under the guidance of your superior, directs all sales activities for Sales Managers and Sales Executives to ensure they meet the goals of the Revenue Plan 在上级主管的领导下，指示销售经理和销售主管完成收入计划目标。 Produces monthly Sales reports and forecasts 制作每月销售报告及预测。 Meets with guests from major producers/organizers of big events staying in the hotel to ensure customer satisfaction 会见在酒店下榻的大型活动组织者的客户，以保证客户的满意度。 Establishes and continuously updates mailing lists 建立邮寄名单并不断更新。 Your day to day Required Skills – 技能要求 Demonstrated ability to interact with customers, employees and third parties that reflects highly on the hotel, the brand and the Company 具有代表酒店，品牌和公司与顾客，员工和第三方交往的能力。 Problem solving, reasoning, motivating, organizational and training abilities 具有解决问题，推理，号召，组织和培训能力。 Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office 精通微软办公软件。 Good writing skills 良好的写作技能。 Qualifications – 学历 Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Marketing or related field 具有营销，市场或相关领域的学士学位。 Experience – 经历 3 years of relevant experience or similar supervisory role, or an equivalent combination of education and work-related experience 3年相关工作经验或相似的管理经验，或与此相当的教育与工作经验结合的背景。 Apply

description: Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Sep 6, 2021 Travel: Yes, < 50 % of the Time
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Req ID: 69796  Region: Asia  Country: China  State/Province: Shanghai  City: Shanghai  Detailed Description  Work requires application of in-depth knowledge of professional standards, practices and precedents in area of specialty. Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires and in-depth evaluation of various factors. Incumbents are accountable for quality of work delivered. Incumbents have decision-making authority and autonomy to deliver on goals of team and require considerable judgment to interpret policy in planning and implementing major projects or work assignments. Influences others outside of team to ensure goals are met and resolves conflicts in an effective manner. Erroneous decisions or failure to achieve goals results reduced profitability and/or serious delays in overall schedules. May lead a multi-functional work group or project team consisting of one or more support staff and/or tech/professional staff, or may provide advice and guidance in area of specialty. May determine new methods and procedures. Seeks out new avenues for building internal and external relationships; maintains contacts with existing relationships. Interfaces with senior managers on issues related to the area of expertise. Interacts with and influences management and/or customers on significant issues.  Performs tasks such as, but not limited to, the following:  Positions may have direct revenue accountability (personal sales quota).  Technical Sales & Business Development activity within the area of specialization (Memory, Power, Design, Plastics, etc.). Assists in the technical aspects of the strategy, tactics and value proposition development. Collects, reviews and analyzes customer data and market intelligence from all sources. Provides technical support and guidance to the Sales, Business Development and Operations Teams by making technical presentations and interfacing with customer’s technical decision makers. Acts as a key resource to the account team to ensure that Celestica wins and grown business. Integrates Celestica design, repair, DFM, DFx, DFT, agency approvals, safety backplanes, system assembly or other services into new customer projects. Leverages Celestica experience and services of worldwide locations to provide customer/CLS profitable mfg. options. Develops relationship with design services to grow partnership. Participates in and supports customer audits and visits. Provides technical support for customer audits and visits to Celestica. Provides technical assistance to the account's Sr. Business Development team in contract negotiation. May provide operational team guidance on the administration of the technical terms and conditions of contracts. Analyzes business opportunities to determine whether resources should be expended to pursue opportunities and determines which manufacturing locations should be utilized. Participates in Celestica’s win/loss reviews.  Knowledge/Skills/Competencies: Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) Strong business analysis skills Strong interpersonal skills Strong time management/multitasking skills Strong teamwork skills Ability to work with and influence other individuals in a non-confrontational manner. Strong administration, prioritization, and logistics/coordination skills. High level of proficiency with word processing, spreadsheets and presentation software. Some background in complex problem management and resolution. Ability to simultaneously work as a member of several virtual teams. High level of knowledge within area of specialization. Complex customer relationship management abilities Knowledge/skills in service sales (rather than product sales). Physical Demands: Duties of this position are performed in a normal office environment. Duties may require extended periods of sitting and sustained Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law). At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Special arrangements can be made for candidates who need it throughout the hiring process. Please indicate your needs and we will work with you to meet them.  Company Overview  Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) enables the world’s best brands. Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development – from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud.  Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.  Celestica would like to thank all applicants, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.  Celestica does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services.

description: POSITION SUMMARY:  To maximize business opportunities in the assigned region across product portfolios by effectively developing, managing and supporting distribution partners. Lead field sales force to grow the sales of Cepheid product portfolios and provide direct and efficient sales service to increase customer’s satisfaction and loyalty.  ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:  * Develop and manage regional business by providing dynamic leadership for the Sales organization and distributors in the assigned region to ensure that revenue targets are well achieved. * Develop the distribution network to cover the different areas in depth in order to maximize the sales from each area. * Define clear sales objectives and clear performance indicators for the distributors to follow and monitor and report the progress of each distributor on a regular basis. * Plan, manage, and support the distributors to apply a reasonable patient charge and reimbursement for GeneXpert assays in the assigned territories. * Work with marketing team to provide training, academic programs, sales tools, and scientific support to the distributors in order to help them achieve the quarterly and annual sales objectives. * Work closely with the team to search new sales opportunities, input sales opportunities into Funnel Management system in time and review the funnel in a regular way to drive development of new accounts * Drive instrument sales funnel and evaluate related KPIs in order to expand the installation base. * Build the sales team and provide coaching on managing the distributors and the key accounts in their areas. * MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:  Education or Experience (in years):  * Bachelor’s degree, preferably in molecular biology, microbiology, or related life science major. * At least 2 years sales management experience in IVD, medical device or pharmaceutical industry with team leading experience. MNC’s background preferred * 5+ years sales experience in hospitals, clinical laboratories, and/or life science markets Knowledge and skills:  * Excellent understanding of hospital customers and/or Govt. department purchasing process * Good knowledge of the Cepheid product portfolio and the related market * Excellent professional selling skills to laboratory doctors, clinicians and healthcare professionals. * Track record in meeting sales targets, distribution development and team management * Strong interpersonal communication and organizational skills and planning ability. * Strong execution ability in the field and is willing to accept frequent travels * Good team player with open mind, self-motivation. Creative but result oriented, and can work under pressure with optimistic. * Proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint applications * Proficient in Mandarin and acceptable working level of English Physical requirements/abilities:  * Need to afford extensive travels (70% of working time) to see customers, distributors and attend company meetings.

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Main Responsibility   Maintain the existing business in the existing key accounts and develop new product opportunities in the F&B sector;   Working with Customers and Engineering to develop and implement product strategy for all Fluid Control business units;   Providing technical/engineering advice on products to major OEMs and end-users so that our products are specified on customers' preferred vendor list;   Engaging, identifying, motivating and managing a well selected network of key customers to meet sales objectives;   Keep abreast of major projects and ensure the company’s products and services are actively promoted to all decision makers at Food & beverage sector;   Assisting with trade shows, exhibitions and seminars where the company or product is presented and provide professional presentation or product demonstrations to customers;   Formulating strategies and recommendations for the development of OEM customers and markets;   Provide update information on sales, sales forecasts, customer activity and visits, sales activity including progress on projects, target accounts, major and new opportunities, and any specific promotional or marketing activity;   Act in a manner consistent with the scope and principles of all company policies, codes of conduct and core values. Company Description  TeamViewer is a leading global technology company that provides a connectivity platform to remotely access, control, manage, monitor, and repair devices of any kind – from laptops and mobile phones to industrial machines and robots. TeamViewer proactively shapes digital transformation and continuously innovates in the fields of Augmented Reality, Internet of Things or Artificial Intelligence. Since the company’s foundation in 2005, TeamViewer’s software has been installed on more than 2.2 billion devices around the world. The company is headquartered in Goppingen, Germany, and employs more than 1,000 people globally.  Job Description  Identify and onboard potential key partners active in the Enterprise business (System Integrators, Consulting firms, Independent Software Vendors, VARs) Facilitate business development with these partners, assisting them in developing a long-term successful strategy for achieving their business goals Align on a revenue commitment based on the partner program Manage the sales forecast, drive pipeline and registration/escalation process for your region Work closely with the distribution partner to qualify new opportunities and position the best partner, to help build the best offer, and to apply unified approach with partners Work with marketing to execute sales strategy and promote product enhancements and new product features Recruit new partners, build business plan, customer mapping & objectives Develop and implement the sales, certification & technical enablement of partner teams Promote TeamViewer Enterprise products & strategy through product demos, participation in marketing events, developing brand awareness, developing co-marketing with partners in collaboration with TeamViewer marketing team Qualifications  Proven channel sales and account management experience in OT/IT industry including relationship building for 5 years or longer Responsible for the China market Experience selling software/SaaS platform products to enterprise or large organizations via partners is preferable. Experience in managing channel partners for a SaaS vendor Business level English skills plus Mandarin or Cantonese skills Motivated to work with leading-edge technologies and applying those to drive business value to partners Customer focused with the willingness to go the extra mile to exceed partner expectations Ability to work independently and thrive in a fast paced environment Ability to manage multiple tasks and work with different departmental teams Flexibility, adaptability and quick to learn new skills Desire and commitment to do what it takes to be successful in sales Positive outlook and a strong ability to take responsibility and being accountable for own actions and decisions Additional Information  We truly live and celebrate our cultural diversity: our colleagues come from from more than 60 countries and speak more than 40 languages. "If I were CEO, I would..." Say what you're thinking! We live an open-door policy and our managing directors are always open to feedback and suggestions. We work hard, and play harder! Look forward to company celebrations, team events and other social gathering TeamViewer is used even in Space. What else can we achieve with your help? Do you want to work where you can see the results of your contribution - immediately? If you are motivated by excellence; like to get things done; are full of energy and seek opportunities with huge growth potential then you are a perfect fit for TeamViewer.

Huntsman’s PU Elastomers Division is now searching for a Sales Account Manager at Guangzhou. The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving business on the aggressive growth path, penetrate and expand market share of footwear in PU and TPU, Strengthen stakeholder connection in casual and safety shoes field. This role is an individual contributor.  As The Sales Account Manager, You Will  The jobholder is responsible for delivering the budgeted volume and contribution margin for his/her accounts, located in China. He/She would also be responsible for basic technical service to customers.  This Includes Lead and drive account plans, budgets and forecasts which deliver the agreed strategic objectives of value and profit generation from the region, with a strong focus on volume growth in the footwear segment. Timely and effectively report activities using the tools used by the business (e.g. C4C and visit reports) Maintain and review the view on the opportunities by using the tools provided by the business (e.g. C4C and opportunity funnel) Proactively strengthen relationships with molders, shoe makers and brand offices in order to identify new opportunities and projects in a timely fashion. Emphasis on new customers in China Work closely with colleagues in other regions (GA) for transfer customers/projects from China to GA or vice versa. Gather relevant market information for the Footwear team which provides the basis to recommend strategies for action / growth in the strategic markets consistent with delivering the agreed strategic positioning. Establish a high standard of Market Intelligence for Footwear in his region, in market shares, penetration of all Huntsman Footwear products in target markets and relative competitive positions with alternative competition. Support Marketing and Communication in the development of a plan aiming at increasing brand awareness and value proposition of relevant Footwear brands in the region. Take an active interest in the EHS standards at all customers. Act personally all times in a safe manner including adherence to the Safe Drive policy. Skills And Experiences Required The jobholder is required to act and communicate effectively across functional, cultural and international boundaries and therefore needs to demonstrate strong interpersonal skills and well-developed thinking and influencing competencies. He/she will need to act and take decisions independently whereby keeping alignment to the overall business strategies. The jobholder also must possess excellent tact and diplomacy to effectively interact with senior personnel internally and externally and must demonstrate self-managing and initiative competencies to maintain effectiveness under pressure. The job holder needs to be a professional combining a university degree in chemistry (or similar through experience) with a minimum of 5 to 7 years of sound professional experience in sales functions and possess a good understanding of the Specialty Polymer Market and a deep and broad value chain understanding, particularly in the Footwear industry. Detailed knowledge of PU/TPU application technology, the Footwear industry and Footwear value chain customer needs is essential. Basic technical service to customers is also expected. A sound social and psychological approach and the ability to work in different cultures is a key requirement. Fluency in English and/or Chinese, both written and spoken, is essential. Willingness to travel frequently within China and occasionally to Greater Asia is essential. Huntsman offers unsurpassed opportunities to build a successful future. Our diverse portfolio creates a range of career fields including manufacturing, research and development, technical services, sales and marketing, customer service – and the list goes on.  Here, you can make an impact and make a difference. Come join us.  Huntsman is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all qualified applicants for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, gender identification, sexual orientation and/or expression or any other characteristic protected by law in every location in which we have facilities national or local.  Please refer to https : // www . huntsman . com / privacy / online-privacy-notice for Company’s Data Privacy and Protection information.  All unsolicited resumes presented by recruitment agencies are treated as pro bono information or service.  Huntsman is aware of a scam involving fraudulent job offers. Huntsman does not make job offers until after a candidate has submitted a job application and has participated in a face-to-face interview. Please be advised that emails from Huntsman always end in “@huntsman.com” and that any job offer that requires payment or requires you to deposit a check is likely a scam. If you have questions about any open positions at Huntsman, please visit our Careers website at  http : / /www . huntsman . com / corporate / a / Careers.

jobTitle: Key Account Manager, Electronics, South China
description: Guangzhou, China; Remote;  H.B. Fuller is a leading global adhesives provider focusing on perfecting adhesives, sealants and other specialty chemicals across all industries throughout the world. While our products are virtually invisible, they play a vital role in ensuring the quality of modern life and we are committed to connecting what matters to solve some of the world's biggest adhesion challenges.  Position Overview  As part of a cross-functional team, the successful candidate will be responsible for the business development and Strategic Account activities for Electronics adhesive market. This position will focus on identifying new opportunities and then rapidly growing product sales to meet agreed business targets. The regional focus will be primarily South China, with support to Greater China. This position will be based in Shenzhen or Surroundings, reports to Sales Manager.  The Key Account Manager will have a broad experience and excellent relationships within the electronics industry and key accounts, along with a strong technical knowledge of the applications and materials employed. S/He must be able to articulate a clear strategy and implementation plan, and then execute to deliver sales growth in line with the agreed business plan.  Primary Duties New business development in global key account in South China: OEM (Apple, Google, Amazon and etc.), EMS (Foxconn Global and etc.,) Drive sustainable sales and profit growth in line with agreed business objectives. Actively manage and coordinate all aspects of the sales process and act as focal point for information flow between the company and target accounts. Identify and validate new sales targets and develop pipeline of opportunities in line with agreed business objectives, develop and execute high profit promotion strategy. Act as project manager throughout all phases of sales project, driving key actions, setting priorities and managing risks. Partner with relevant global resources (R&D, Marketing, Operations, Customer Service, and Applications. Engineering) to deliver solutions that fully meet customer’s needs and timeline. Timely accurate monthly reports, CRM database updates, project update etc., Minimum Requirements BS degree, preferably Technical/Science. 5+ years key account management experience in the electronics industry or related technical field. Demonstrated ability to prepare and deliver compelling technical sales presentations. Team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills. 80+% travels expected, including domestic & international trip. PHYSICAL ENVIRONMENT Significant business travel across the countries responsible for. The working conditions for this position would be anticipated to be those typical to an office. There may be minimal need to visit laboratories or manufacturing sites. There is minimal physical effort required for this position other than typing. The types of hazards would be typical to those seen in an office environment. At H.B. Fuller, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to providing all applicants and employees with equal employment opportunity. We subscribe to the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) policy of employing and promoting individuals based on their merits, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship status, or any other protected classification.

description: Position:  Inside Sales Specialist  Job Description:  What You’ll Be Doing  Setting direction, coping with change, listening, coaching and motivating the team. Serves as an escalation point for Arrow’s internal departments, vendor resources and customers. Serves as the customer contact for handling all elements of the returns and maintenance termination process, entering the Service Request and RMA in the business system, sending the return/cancellation request for management approval and ensuring customers are credited for the return. Responsible for receiving, confirming and tracking customer orders and other related tasks in the order processing and post sales flow to include: order entry; material procurement; coordination with the vendor, integration facilities and shippers to identify and track delivery schedules; creation and update order status reports; resolution of incoming invoices and denied claims. Order Processing: Processes customer orders accurately and timely by reviewing customer purchase orders for accuracy, freight terms, transportation methods, pricing, technical specifications, part numbers and any other unique customer requirements ; resolving any discrepancies with customer prior to order entry; entering sales orders accurately and quickly into the Arrow ERP system, working with shared services teams to resolve more complex issues on orders or customer requests. Places purchase orders with the vendors and anticipates additional requirements or obstacles for orders and works toward a solution proactively. Research and resolve vendor invoice variances and warehouse receipt discrepancies caused by price, quantity, goods/services receipts, freight and tax code discrepancies. Works with the warehouse team to ensure that all inventory purchase orders are received in full. Research and resolve vendor denied claims or variances caused by program requirements, price, quantity and point of sale reporting. Processes any shipment variances or damages with the vendors for resolution and updates the Oracle ERP system accordingly. Work with suppliers, sales teams and shared services teams to troubleshoot and resolve invoice and claims exceptions within defined service level agreements. Takes ownership of issues and sees that they are fully resolved. Monitors inventory to identify slow moving, aging and non-sellable product to determine the proper disposition. Negotiates special pricing, returns, programs and other exceptions with the vendor. Ensures that our SMI (slow moving inventory), obsolescence and write-offs are within our established financial goals. Proactively resolves problem situations, often complex, with our suppliers and Arrow departments related to selection of source, price, delivery, etc while remaining within inventory guidelines. Mentors and assists in training of team members. Analyzes training needs of team members and develops and provides input for a solution. Acts as the backup for the manager for assigned responsibilities.  What We Are Looking For  Bachelor's Degree or above Minimum 2 years’ client-facing working experience Fluent in English and Mandarin Candidates with electronic industry experience is a plus Strong communication skills and interpersonal skills Highly self-driven and able to work under pressure and independently.  What’s In It For You  At Arrow, we recognize that financial rewards and great benefits are important aspects of an ideal job. That’s why we offer competitive financial compensation, including various compensation plans, and a solid benefits package. description: Responsibilities Maintain close working relationship with insurance partners at different level within the responsible region Implementation of regional programs on promoting penetration and marketing activities to drive business growth; Maintain constant communication with stakeholders on key partner strengths, differentiating products, developments, etc.; Support commercial negotiations for responsible partners; Maintain and refine processes and tools to facilitate better engagement of partners; Setup and implement KPI to effectively measure and monitor partners’ performance; Continuous improvement of partners’ service level and efficiency through technology; Ensure continued success in driving sales for Tesla with partners as well as continued success of the partner portfolio. About Us  Gore is a materials science company focused on improving lives through discovery, product innovation and rewarding careers for our Associates.  About The Industry  Saving lives and improving the quality of life for patients is at the core of everything we do. This meaningful work gives purpose to our lives and inspires us to create solutions that make a difference in the lives of others. Learn more at gore.com/products/industries  About The Role  We are looking for a Field Sales Associate to join our Medical Product Division Sale Team in Hangzhou, Zhejiang who will be accountable for meeting or exceeding the sales forecast in Zhejiang, Fujian & Anhui provinces.  Responsibilities: Develop profitable sales opportunities, proactively make sales calls Develop new business to align with Gore business needs Ensure the KOL management, market data collection, etc., are effective, builds, maintains and defends long-term customer relationships Ensure the cooperation with other product specialists are active and constructive, to achieve team goals and objectives Implement value pricing principle, be a value seller, skilled in the use of premise-based forecasting techniques Implement Gore’s product strategy, understands the needs of the customer  Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in medical or medicine Proven sales background, preferably with a minimum of 5 years in the medical devices sales area Will have worked in or able to demonstrate an understanding of the imperatives of a business environment Clinical background in interventional areas or sales experience to this environment Strong communication and interpersonal skills A high level of self-motivation and passion, ensuring the ability to work under minimal supervision Commercial acumen High integrity Ability to travel extensively up to 60% and attend weekend conferences as required  What We Offer  At Gore, we want our Associates to have fulfilling careers driven by curiosity and commitment. In return, we commit to our Associates by offering comprehensive, competitive rewards in the form of compensation, benefits, an Associate stock ownership-type plan, and opportunities for growth and development. Learn more at gore.com/careers  We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and inclusive work environment. In support of our values and continued success we are proud of Associates around the world who support an inclusive work environment, strive to reflect the diversity of the communities where we operate, and ensure all Associates and external partners are treated with fairness, dignity and respect.  Our Talent Acquisition Team welcomes your questions via email at AP_TA@wlgore.com  Job  Sales  Primary Location  Asia-Pacific-CN-ZJ-Hangzhou  Travel%  60%  Shift  Day  Schedule  Full-time

A mutually rewarding experience.  Work. Realize your ambitions. And realize there’s more to being in business than just making a profit. That’s the Mars philosophy. And the opportunity we offer every one of our Associates. An opportunity to take what you do and make it mean more for you, for those around you and for the planet. What you get here is challenging, interesting work. You get the tools you need to do a great job and you get to have the best possible people on your side to help you do it. And at the same time as getting to find ways to do business better today than we did it yesterday and driving a great career, you also get to build a more enlightened business and drive sustainability.  Because it’s never just about a single person, a single project or a single brand. It’s about how you can grab everything that’s within your reach here and use it to pursue mutual, long-term gain. It’s about having ideas. And ideals. Being prepared to risk failure because the promise of success means we’ll all be a little better off. It’s that mix of integrity and ambition that makes Mars such a special place to work. And why working here is always about more than just a job.  About Mars, Incorporated  Mars is a family-owned business with more than a century of history making diverse products and offering services for people and the pets people love. With almost $35 billion in sales, the company is a global business that produces some of the world’s best-loved brands: M&M’s®, SNICKERS®, TWIX®, MILKY WAY®, DOVE®, PEDIGREE®, ROYAL CANIN®, WHISKAS®, EXTRA®, ORBIT®, 5™, SKITTLES®, UNCLE BEN’S®, MARS DRINKS and COCOAVIA®. Mars also provides veterinary health services that include BANFIELD® Pet Hospitals, Blue Pearl®, VCA® and Pet Partners™. Headquartered in McLean, VA, Mars operates in more than 80 countries. The Mars Five Principles – Quality, Responsibility, Mutuality, Efficiency and Freedom – inspire its more than 100,000 Associates to create value for all its partners and deliver growth they are proud of every day.  Key Responsibilities/职位描述  1，负责宠物医院、宠物店及繁育渠道等专业渠道分销商客户，对各区域生意管理、了解反馈市场及竞品信息，并对销售目标达成  2，负责客户分级及管理、客情维护，负责制定区域拜访路线和覆盖计划，陈列与活动执行指导  3，负责经销商及其销售人员的沟通、管理和培训工作  4，负责连锁客户及零售客户的洽谈、拓展和卖进工作  5，负责向客户（经销商/既有客户/潜在客户）传递公司的品牌理念和产品专业知识  6，参与区域活动策略制定，独立承接一定测试活动，并持续跟进反馈。  Qualifications/任职条件  1、有宠物行业销售经验或快速消费品销售工作经验，有宠物行业经验优先；  2、有宠物医疗行业工作背景的优先；  3、能够熟练操作常用办公软件；  4、有良好的沟通能力和语言表达能力，有一定创新能力；  5、为人诚实正直，有责任感，有一定抗压能力；  6、具有自我激励、积极上进的精神，有职业发展规划  RN:21  Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request. description: We’re looking for a R&H key account manager to join our R&H sales team in Shanghai.  Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.  As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!  Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.  As a R&H key account sales manager you’ll be responsible for R&H key account management with the system solution promotion and AOP achievement.  We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!  What You’ll Do  Identify, approach and build relationship with national / international key accounts ( sizeable and repeatable)  Supporting, educating and developing various relationship within strategic accounts  Build relateionships with knowledgeable Partners and key-influencers  make sure the deal done and AOP achieved  Your Qualifications  Bachelor degree or above  5+ years of sales experience, 3+ years in lighting or R&H segment echo system experience  Experience for system sales  Ability to work under pressure with positive attitude  Good communication and team work skills  What You’ll Get In Return…  We’re offering multiple opportunities for career development, like mentoring, coaching and stretch assignments, with strong international exposure for dynamic profiles. Learning is fundamental to our culture. Through continuous learning, we are transforming the industry. You have the chance to learn every day, acquire new skills and perspectives through customized online programs, and on-the-job experiences.  See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

As the industry leader in water technology, we’re growing and need talented people like you to help us continue to protect the world’s most vital resource.  Nalco Water, an Ecolab Company, is seeking a Technical Sales Representative to join its industry leading sales team. You’ll be responsible for revenue and profit growth of programs and services in targeted accounts. With a consultative sales approach, you’ll build relationships with existing customers by understanding their key business drivers and executing system assurance programs. With strong account leadership, you’ll also convert strategic competitive accounts and sell new technologies to current customers.  What’s In It For You You will join a growth company offering a competitive base salary, bonus structure and benefits Receive a company vehicle and cell phone Opportunity for a long term, advancing career path in service, sales or management Access to the industry’s most innovative training programs Support from a dedicated technical service team Culture that values safety first, including training and personal protection Feel proud each day to work for a company that provides clean water, safe food, abundant energy and healthy environments What You Will Do Generate and execute sales plans in existing customer base and in assigned competitively-held accounts, to meet profit increase goals. Target % sales time will be approximately Work closely with current and prospective customers to understand business needs and recommend continuous improvement and innovation plans that will maintain and grow sales Develop strong relationships with key stakeholders in current and prospective customers, including plant or facility executives Provide technical support to customers; identifying and resolving customer challenges, escalating as required Engage in problem solving by performing system analysis, interpreting data and providing written recommendations to ensure customer operations are performing at optimal levels. Actively sell and support Nalco Water innovations and technology in assigned customers to promote long-term business relationships with Nalco Water Territory/Location Information: This position is based in Territory covers about a radius of the surrounding area Targeted accounts are within the industries <%> overnight travel required As a trusted partner, your customers will rely on you for their success. Nalco Water is committed to seeing you succeed and provides several exceptional technical training programs to ensure you’re prepared to solve any customer problem.  Training programs are held in the field and at Nalco Water Headquarters in Naperville, IL; travel arranged and paid for by Nalco Water. Based on your skill level, topics covered may include technology, product, service, business and industry acumen, direct coaching and mentoring, management and leadership, classroom training and certifications.  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree Three years of technical sales or field sales support experience Possess a valid Driver's License and acceptable Motor Vehicle Record Immigration sponsorship is not available for this role Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in engineering (chemical, mechanical, industrial) or life sciences (biology, chemistry, etc.) Water treatment or specialty chemical industry experience Working knowledge of OR operations, wet end chemistry, pulp mill operations> About Nalco Water  In a world with increasing water shortage and contamination challenges, Nalco Water, an Ecolab company, helps customers conserve more than 161 billion gallons of water each year. We work with customers across the world in the light industry (institutional, food & beverage, transportation and manufacturing), heavy industry (chemical, power and primary metals industries), paper and mining operations to reduce, reuse, and recycle their water while protecting their systems and equipment. Nalco Water provides the unique opportunity to work with a broad suite of technologies to deliver automated monitoring systems, data analysis and deep technical expertise to increase efficiency, sustainability and performance for our customers.  Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  At Ecolab, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every associate can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.  In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce. Ecolab is a place where you can grow your career, own your future and impact what matters.

Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future. description: Foreign Assistant to General Manager  About us: HB Group (originally starting business from 1986) Raw Material Business (formerly Known as YCHT Technology Co., LTD.) now has 5 sub companies: YC SpB Fragrance Co., LTD., GDZQ Fragrance Factory Co., LTD., YZSX Material Co., LTD., JXXH Biological Technology Co., LTD., Shanghai HQ Trading Co., LTD.  There are more than 400 kinds of products involved in our raw materials business. In order to coordinate with the unified planning of our fragrance raw materials business, YCHT was officially renamed HJ Technology Co., LTD on July, 2020. Our group is making efforts to build the largest production base of fragrance raw materials in Asia.  About the job: Now, our general manager Needs a business assistant, to assist him on domestic and overseas business. This is a full time regular position, we hope you can show your ability and desire, and the company can provide you good promotion chance. This job needs a lot of business travels.  Job Title: Foreign Assistant to General Manager Office: Putuo District, Shanghai Travel: will have business travel mostly in China, and sometime overseas   Main responsibilities: 1/ business negotiation (help the general manager) 2/ related documents preparation work 3/ sometimes work as the meeting interpreter when have meetings with the foreign partners – you need not be a professional translator or interpreter, but will have to take the interpreting or translation tasks when have meetings with our foreign partners. 4/ if you can work well, and show your ability and desire, you can take other business, sales or management related work in the company – it’s up to your desire, and your ability 5/ this job, you will travel a lot in China and sometimes overseas, if you do not want business travel, please DO NOT apply for this job. 6/ other tasks assigned by the GM   Requirements: 1/ come from North America, or West Europe, English native (or very close to native level) speaker, very good English pronunciation is a must 2/ good Chinese language ability – it’s a must 3/ bachelor degree or above 4/ manager assistant or secretary work experience will be a big advantage 5/ business related work experience at least 2 years 6/ Gentleman most welcome, someone now in Shanghai is most welcome 7/ we will have some business meeting with government departments, so you must be a professional employee   The salary related: Open to discuss  If you’re qualified, and want to apply for this job, please email me your cv with picture  david@jobsitechina.com or david_swd@163.com  wechat:swd3rfv  Best regards HR

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Responsibilities Pre-sales activity will include delivery of technical expertise during the sales process including presentations, seminars, individual consultation, and hands-on demo experiments if needed. Executes technical and application based presentations on illumina’s sequencing and microarray platforms, applications and/or workflows. Post-sales activity includes working with post-installation customers providing additional workflow or applications training in strategically important labs. Supporting/assisting customers with sequencing assay design to accelerate adoption of targeted sequencing on illumina’s platforms. Attendance at tradeshows/conferences in relevant fields. Be the point person for dedicated illumina User Group Meetings in collaboration with field marketing and support team to provide sample to data workflow training Assists sales and field marketing on new strategic initiatives requiring both technical and market knowledge Works collaboratively with territory account managers, marketing, service and support teams to ensure effective account/customer management and communication through pre-sales, during and- post-sales cycle, including review and meeting account pull through targets and goals Escalates technical issues to Technical Support for possible resolution for strategically important labs. Develops and maintain positive relationships with customers in assigned territory Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.  Preferred Requirements Life science industry experience preferred Applied Market Knowledge is a plus Extensive experience and understanding of leading genetics technologies and how they can be applied. Detailed knowledge of technological developments and trends in the sequencing markets Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills in Mandarin and English. Strong negotiation skills and ability to persuade Ability to travel within region to carry out primary responsibilities. All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.  Preferred Experience/Education Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 0-2 years of related experience; or equivalent work experience. 岗位概述  Responsibilities 售前活动将包括销售过程中的技术知识演讲，如介绍演讲、研讨会、个别咨询等，在必要时，进行演示实验。 对因美纳测序和微阵列平台的应用或工作流程进行技术层面和应用层面的介绍。 售后活动包括与安装产品后的客户的协调，提供在具有重要战略意义的实验室中所需的工作流程或应用培训 支持/辅助客户的相关测序阵列设计，加快在客户因美纳平台上目标测序进程。 参加相关领域的展览会/大会。 作为与现场营销和支持团队合作的专项人员参加因美纳用户组会议，提供样品数据工作流程培训。 提供销售或现场营销新战略项目时所需有关技术和市场知识。 与区域客户经理、营销、服务和支持团队合作工作，保证有效的大客户/客户管理以及负责售前、售中和售后过程的沟通，包括回访和会面已经取得成果或达成目标的客户。 作为技术支持提供技术升级，为具有重要战略意义的实验室提供可能的解决方案。 提升和维护责任区域内客户的良好关系。 以上所列的任务和职责是本岗位的基本功能。然而，各种商务条件下可能需要完成额外的任务和职责。  Preferred Requirements 有生命科学行业经验者优先 有应用市场知识者加分 具有领先的遗传学技术及其应用方面的丰富经验和充分理解 具有技术发展和测序市场趋势的详细知识 优秀的中文普通话和英文口头和书面交流和介绍演讲技能 良好的谈判技巧和说服能力 能在负责区域内出差并完成主要职责 Preferred Experience/Education 科学学科的硕士以上学历（分子生物学、遗传学、或基因组学和/或生物信息学优先）

该职位来源于猎聘  Main Responsibilities And Key Activities 1.负责完成并完成销售目标 2.开拓传统市场之外的新业务 3.追求、谈判和构建适当的销售条款，并通过与公司和区域计划相一致的竞争策略最大化销售渗透。确保在展会、用户大会等市场活动后系统地跟进销售线索 4.与组织内的跨部门团队合作，直接与客户或战略合作伙伴制定行之有效的销售策略，以推动增长 5.与其他部门团队合作，计划和组织促销活动 6.完成销售活动，订单开发，价格策略，付款 7.通过内部SFDC系统生成销售方案，并确保数据库更新，熟练使用SFDC系统来帮助管理日常销售工作 8.通过每周回顾和更新潜在客户名单，确保销售预测的准确性。通过适当的销售、谈判和收尾技巧，共同努力缩短销售预测实现周期 9.及时向经理提交有意义的销售拜访报告 10.与财务信用控制部门协调跟进客户逾期付款 Qualifications And Professional Knowledge 1.至少3 -5年销售经验，具备销售和谈判技巧 2.至少1年以上软件销售经验 3.敏锐的商业嗅觉，能够在销售谈判和结束中运用实用的商业方法 4.系统地跟进线索并完成 5.良好的人际关系技巧，能够处理多层次关系 6.有丰富的包装行业销售经验尤佳

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Dalian
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, (Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Telecommunications

description: Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: May 31, 2021 Travel: No
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals
