Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Essential Responsibilities 在指定的区域内完成公司下达的销售指标； 执行公司的市场策略和销售政策； 为分销商提供产品支持，协助分销商达成销售指标； 在指定的区域开发/建立并维护良好的分销经营渠道； 建立和维护客户的长期关系，提高客户的满意度； 利用销售工具收集/分析所在区域的市场情况，寻找潜在的机会，提供准确的市场预测； 开展和组织所负责区域的市场推广和销售活动； 任职条件:  Qualifications/Requirements 大学本科或以上学历，医学，临床背景优先； 3年以上医疗器械/耗材分销商管理经验或直接销售经验； 高度诚信和敬业精神，遵守公司相关规定； 较强的市场开拓和沟通能力及优秀的谈判技巧； 能用英语阅读专业资料并写作，熟练操作电脑； 卓越的对内对外沟通技能； 团队工作的技能（包括寻找和利用各种资源达成目标的能力） 良好的演讲技能 能够承受相应压力，并拥有自我学习的意愿和能力。 Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

description: Position Summary, 职位概述  Responsible for building business with key OEM target customers to win adoptions and commercialization of Cabot solutions in their energy storage devices. Work closely with product development teams and be the key interface with OEM target account. Ensure broad communication and alignment of customer account plans and manage all key communication and interactions with target OEM  Job Responsibilities, 工作职责 Build strong working relationships with key target OEM accounts. Identify decision makers and ensure Cabot team is strongly aligned with customer needs and timeframe to solve problems Be the voice of the customer and a strong advocate for their needs internally within the Cabot organization. Play as the key connection point for Cabot to the OEM account. Be responsible for initial sales of target key accounts, including price and contract negotiations, new supplier setup in customer’s supplier management system, etc. Work seamlessly with Cabot product development teams and customer development teams to meet targets for product adoption Build a customer map of all important functions and relationships that will help position Cabot’s offering over the competition Collect and generate information on market and industry trends for energy storage in IT, automotive and grid storage based on interactions with target OEM accounts. Collect customer insights on emerging trends that impact materials needs for energy storage. Provide strategic input for managing price and positioning strategy for Cabot’s offering at the OEM account. Provide detailed reporting and information for internal review of project efforts Interface broadly within the Energy Materials’ team and Regional team to stay coordinated and focused on winning the adoption Work with business and corporate resources to identify and execute on inorganic opportunities Requirements, 要求 Ability to proactively build connections broadly across target OEM organization Strong team player with positive attitude Well organized in keeping notes, writing call reports and driving key customer account plans, etc. Strong verbal and written communication skills/ Strong Presentation skills/ Good command of English in both verbal and written. Willingness to travel Education/Experience Bachelor/University degree in chemical engineering, materials science or related; Relevant experience in energy storage industry and a familiarity with the space is strongly preferred. 3-5 years’ experience in sales and technical service. About The Company  Cabot Corporation is a leading global specialty chemicals and performance materials company headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, USA.  We strive to be the most innovative, respected and responsible leader in our markets — delivering performance that makes a difference. As a market leader we collaborate with customers to find innovative solutions that will help them advance their own products for a wide range of industries, from transportation and infrastructure to environment and consumer goods. Our customers worldwide trust our solutions to help them address their needs and accelerate innovation in key applications — creating value and delivering an advantage over the competition. To learn more about Cabot products and applications please click here .  Our culture is based on four core values: respect, integrity, responsibility and excellence in everything we do. We are committed to diversity and inclusion and place high value in creating an inclusive workplace where all employees can contribute, thrive, and advance. We strive to create an environment that is conducive to the spirit of entrepreneurship, innovation and accountability, and empowers every team member to take responsibility for the execution of our strategy. We support and encourage our people to share ideas and explore ways to do things differently. Our passion for excellence and commitment to creating value and business success creates a culture in which everyone can contribute. We are known as one of the global leaders in safety, health and environmental performance, motivated in large part by the commitment and drive of our colleagues around the world.  Our global network consists of over 40 manufacturing facilities throughout North America, South America, EMEA, and APAC regions.

This is where you save and sustain lives  At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.  Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.  Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.  Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission. description: Market Development - Develop business plan & strategy for assigned market verticals - In-depth / forward looking knowledge of markets and competitors, closely track related market trends - Understand customer business, pain points and logistics processes, link existing solutions to pain points - Conduct market research - Identify Gaps - Identify subsystem, module and product gaps required for best-in-class logistics solutions - Assist in timely development, alliance or acquisition of gaps - Interface with BD-DI, other regional MDD and Global Product Development - Sales & Mkt Support - Initial targeted vertical marketing campaigns to assist sales to access target account prospects and nurture them into opportunities - Coach sales team with market vertical knowledge, develop related sales tools to support sales in customer meetings & presentations. - Develop and present reports to Regional and DI management(monthly VMVR score cards, individual vertical market reports, quarterly lead reports - Follow the KION synergy opportunities (Linde, Dematic, Egemin) and big opportunity projects with sales team, update the status periodically.What we offer: Career Development  We are here to support you for the entirety of your Dematic career. From a fast start of learning Dematic’s history and foundational training to succeed in your role to leadership development programs, technical training and certifications, and Career Navigator to identify challenging new opportunities, our goal is to help you grow beyond your borders.  Competitive Compensation And Benefits  Our attractive and market competitive total rewards packages are designed to reward high performance and to assist in managing your personal and family needs. Dematic offers robust packages based on employment status and national requirements.  Pay Transparency  Dematic is committed to pay transparency. As such, Dematic will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant.  However, Dematic will still maintain confidentiality of your pay information. Employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by Dematic, or (c) consistent with Dematic’s legal duty to furnish information.  Global Opportunities  As a global company, our employees are exposed to different ideas and perspectives from around the world. We offer international assignments for qualified employees and wherever possible, we offer flexible working hours and modern workspace design.  Learn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/  Tasks And Qualifications Bachelor's degree, major in business management or equivalent ; 5 years related experience in multinational company; Self-motivated, independent; Customer and Results-Oriented; Systematic and structured working style; Fluent in English writing, speaking and listening; Strong presentation, communication and interpersonal skills.

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey! As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners. You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met. The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential. 主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws. No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Main Responsibilities And Key Activities 1.负责完成并完成销售目标 2.开拓传统市场之外的新业务 3.追求、谈判和构建适当的销售条款，并通过与公司和区域计划相一致的竞争策略最大化销售渗透。确保在展会、用户大会等市场活动后系统地跟进销售线索 4.与组织内的跨部门团队合作，直接与客户或战略合作伙伴制定行之有效的销售策略，以推动增长 5.与其他部门团队合作，计划和组织促销活动 6.完成销售活动，订单开发，价格策略，付款 7.通过内部SFDC系统生成销售方案，并确保数据库更新，熟练使用SFDC系统来帮助管理日常销售工作 8.通过每周回顾和更新潜在客户名单，确保销售预测的准确性。通过适当的销售、谈判和收尾技巧，共同努力缩短销售预测实现周期 9.及时向经理提交有意义的销售拜访报告 10.与财务信用控制部门协调跟进客户逾期付款 Qualifications And Professional Knowledge 1.至少3 -5年销售经验，具备销售和谈判技巧 2.至少1年以上软件销售经验 3.敏锐的商业嗅觉，能够在销售谈判和结束中运用实用的商业方法 4.系统地跟进线索并完成 5.良好的人际关系技巧，能够处理多层次关系 6.有丰富的包装行业销售经验尤佳

description: Job Summary: The Area Sales Manager is directly responsible to grow the sales of products and services in the assigned geographic territory through identifying opportunities early in the sales cycle to maximize the sales revenue for the Company. He/She will partner and support the National Sales Manager by managing the assigned customer accounts within the specified territory. The Area Sales Manager will also focus on prospecting and developing new accounts and expanding business with the current accounts.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Achieve sales and revenue targets through identifying opportunities early in the sales cycle to convert accounts and penetrate existing accounts to maximize the sales revenue for the Company Work in collaboration with the National Sales Manager to optimize sales opportunities from customer accounts assigned Acquire new customers to exceed sales expectations Build and strengthen relationships with key stakeholders and influencers at growth-oriented accounts Proactively promote West products and solutions by utilizing marketing programmes and providing relevant end-user product trainings Manage and build on internal cross-functional team relationships; bring in Technical Customer Support Specialists when appropriate Understand customer needs to uncover additional opportunities within accounts across all products and solutions Ensure adoption of CRM system and data integrity on CRM Other duties as assigned by Manager  Basic Qualifications:  Degree in Pharmaceutical Science, Chemical Engineering or equivalent Minimum 5 years of relevant technical sales experience in a related industry Strong proficiency in English (written and spoken) languages  Preferred Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Technical knowledge of pharmaceutical primary packaging (plungers, stoppers etc.) would be preferred Prior sales experience in pharmaceutical, biochemistry and/or related process industries will be highly advantageous Knowledge of pharmaceutical industrial standards will be a plus Strong communications and relationship building skills that can successfully translate leads to sales and is able to work collaboratively with internal resources Exhibit strong competency in sales process and strategic account planning by regularly achieving business results that accurately mirror or exceed forecast Ability to strategically prioritize and suitably adapt and improve on account management approach as and when necessary to focus on successful and profitable “win-win” situations Understand customer needs and able to leverage on both West’s product portfolio and internal resources to identify cross-selling opportunities across accounts to create additional value to customers and maximize the Company’s sales revenue Proactive in learning more on the West product portfolio and understanding how to differentiate product offerings competitively Shows understanding of market trends and the impacts on customers for the assigned geographical territory Resourceful and is comfortable in navigating through internal resources by collaborating cross-functionally and can utilize resources effectively Able to comply with the company’s safety policy at all times Able to comply with the company’s quality policy at all times.  Travel Requirements:  Must be able to travel at least 60%

description: Careers that Change Lives  A Day in the Life  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and /or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets. Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals. Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services. Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services. Conducts market research including customers and competitors activities. Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed. Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing. Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelors degree required Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience and working knowledge of company products and services Nice to Have  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: May 24, 2021 Travel: No

description: Job Description  As the Strategy & Operation lead, you will provide high-level operation & strategic support to MSBU commercialization activities, support BU head to drive strategic objective, sales operation, performance acceleration and work with internal and external partners for priority projects.  Accountability Support on designing MSBU portfolio strategy and work out operation goals MSBU operation strategic analysis, incl. concrete business analysis, internal & external data analysis, sales analysis, work out suggestions/solutions, initiate follow up as needed Lead task force on BU level priority initiatives to support business optimization, portfolio integration, performance acceleration. Initiate and drive MS digital strategy & implementation to accelerate MS portfolio presence and reach in digital channels. Lead and manage BU sales operation process incl. KPI setting & tracking, launch readiness, business operation review; Effectively collaborates with x-functional teams to identify, mitigate & solve potential business operation issues Support BU head for business strategy development and reporting, BU governance and leadership team meeting management Ethical and compliance champion for MSBU Qualifications Bachelor’s degree (or above) in medicine, pharmacy, life science or related field Strong performance mindset with proven record in pharm sales or marketing, 8 years industry experience is typical Strategic project management skill with ability to lead, plan, collaborate and drive execution of business strategy and tactics Deep understanding of pharm market and solid experience in driving digital projects Strong team player, self-starter and high learning agility Strong inter-personal communication skills, influence and manage w/o authority Adapt to change and work in VUCA environment Bi-lingual sufficiency, both Chinese and English Excellent PPT and Excel skills Highest ethical standard Additional Information  As the global leader in MS, Biogen has accumulated more than 30 years of clinical experience in MS treatment, built widest portfolio in MS and served more than half of MS patients worldwide. Looking forward, Biogen continue to explore new medicine, device and data solution to support MS patients to conquer the disease.  The Strategy & Operation lead, will support BU head and work closely with x-functional teams to launch MS portfolio in China. He/She will work with different types of players to design and implement innovative go-to-market models to bring our portfolio to benefit Chinese MS patients.

Job Description Summary The Commercial Manager (CM) is responsible for the leadership and coordination of all aspects in the Inquiry to Order (ITO) phase of proposal management. This includes proposal development, risk management and mitigation, specification compliance, scope development, pricing and issue resolution for proposals to which he/she will own.  The Commercial Manager will manage the R-Process, Policy 5.0 compliance, proposal and contract negotiation including Master Agreements and new Multi-year Maintenance Program Agreements (MMP), and R3 turnover processes for all Transactional Services offerings in the assigned countries. These include Upgrades, Field Services, MMP’s, Complex Parts & Repairs packages, Contractual Services (CS) extra work, digital and cyber quote support where needed, for GE Gas Turbines, Combined Cycle Steam Turbine Generators & HRSG installed base.  Job Description  Role Summary  The Commercial Manager (CM) is responsible for the leadership and coordination of all aspects in the Inquiry to Order (ITO) phase of proposal management. This includes proposal development, risk management and mitigation, specification compliance, scope development, pricing and issue resolution for proposals to which he/she will own.  The Commercial Manager will manage the R-Process, Policy 5.0 compliance, proposal and contract negotiation including Master Agreements and new Multi-year Maintenance Program Agreements (MMP), and R3 turnover processes for all Transactional Services offerings in the assigned countries. These include Upgrades, Field Services, MMP’s, Complex Parts & Repairs packages, Contractual Services (CS) extra work, digital and cyber quote support where needed, for GE Gas Turbines, Combined Cycle Steam Turbine Generators & HRSG installed base.  Key Responsibilities Include Provide full proposal leadership from initial inquiry to deal closure and handover (track key dates, manage stakeholders and proposal submission deadlines). Responsible for running an efficient, consistent and compliant Policy 5.0 Risk Management process starting from deal screening (R0), resource allocation (R1), deal reviews (R2), and contract hand over (R3). Perform initial risk evaluation, determine feasibility and bid compliance concerns. Tight coordination with internal stakeholders in completing the technical & commercial aspects of the proposal development phase – sales, finance, execution, risk, legal, engineering, etc. Ensure Risk Checklist & DOA are reviewed & completed for all proposals. Review, respond and negotiate terms & conditions. Propose and support formal R2 to obtain pricing and contract deviation approvals (regional and HQ). Generate final proposal with approved deviations/language as required. Manage all deal related documentation prior to handover to execution team. Use appropriate business tools e.g. NEX, Tableau, CMR, JCE, FINSUM, CPQ, SC workflows, etc. Support sales team in deal negotiation and closure Prepare order acknowledgements, obtain contract signatures and ensure internal order booking is completed on-time. Conduct formal R3 review to handover execution requirements/documents.  Qualifications / Requirements Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college Exceptional oral and written communication skills in English Strong influencing skills towards internal and external stakeholders Ability to work with country teams and customers predominantly in the China region Voracious Learner with a Growth Mindset Proactive, Dynamic, Energetic and Can-Do attitude Strong Collaborator, Meticulous and Organized Able to effectively facilitate meetings and discussions with key stakeholders across the globe Minimum 3 years of experience in industry-related commercial / tendering / application engineering/ contract management/ project management. To be based in Beijing or Shanghai. jobTitle: Account Executive (Sales/BD), China 硬件业务经理 - 中国深圳（销售/业务拓展）
description: 硬件业务经理 - 深圳（销售/业务拓展）  深圳，中国  销售 - Indiegogo中国项目部  INDIEGOGO 是一个先于主流发掘巧妙设计与创新科技的地方。每周都有包括巧妙技术和匠心设计在内的多项项目上线，成千上万的产品从我们的平台上走向世界。  作为全世界最大的众筹和产品首发平台之一，INDIEGOGO在中国市场的设计与消费科技领域正经历爆炸式增长。我们有意在深圳寻找一位有业务拓展工作经验人才来帮助建立和扩大我们的中国区业务。在这一职位上，您将负责在大中华区寻找优质产品，帮助其通过Indiegogo在国际范围内开展众筹，并建立紧密合作关系，确保他们的产品成功发布。您将定期参与活动和各项沟通交流，推进大中华区Indiegogo品牌发展。  理想的候选人熟悉电子消费产品圈，并热衷于更新中国品牌在国际平台发布趋势。该候选人应具备中文母语水平，并应达到商务英文水平。  优先考虑可在深圳工作的候选人；对于特别优秀的候选人，北京、上海、杭州也可给予考虑为录用地点。  更多关于Indiegogo目前与中国创业者合作信息请参见：Indiegogo中国项目出海绿色通道  工作职责 达成短线与长线销售目标 发现并锁定高质量项目与合作伙伴关系，从而推进企业与垂直领域的发展 善于调配资源，并为众筹项目方提供优质咨询服务以确保其完成众筹目标 拓展INDIEGOGO中国业务。通过关系拓展、社会活动、媒体发布等方式建立关键性社会联系和商业机会，以此提高INDIEGOGO品牌影响力 与国际营销策略顾问合作共同推进项目发展 积极并准确反馈项目进度与各项表现 任职资格 3-5年以上客户服务经验，销售方向优先考虑 中文 （普通话）母语水平，商务英文读写流利 能够远端独立工作，並且在正常工作时间之外工作，以便与美国团队进行沟通 具备消费电子产品硬件、设计和技术空间之内的纵向产品知识、个人经验、优良口碑和社会网络；深刻理解中国硬件生态系统。主要能力包括： 销售：具备开发与完成高质量的众筹项目能力  咨询：能够跟客户和未来客户建立良好、以信任为基础的关系，为其提供营销策略指导与推广支持  客户发展：新客户的锁定到长期战略关系建立的“端对端”客户发展管理的实际经验 具备有限时间内高压环境下分优先级处理多项任务的能力 有说服力、积极与自信的工作态度，优秀的领导力，并有能给出建议并接受建议的能力 卓越的人际沟通和表达能力 加分条件 众筹经验 对硬件/技术产品设计有深刻理解与个人经验 流利的书面和口头英文 消费电子产品硬件、设计和技术空间具备现有资源和关系网 Indiegogo is the place to discover clever and unique innovations in tech and design before they go mainstream, including hundreds of products shipping right away. With thousands of projects launching every week, there’s ingenious tech, creative design, and much more around every corner.  Indiegogo is experiencing explosive growth in our Technology and Design vertical. We're looking for someone to help build and grow that business based in Shenzhen, China. Within this role, you'll source quality products in Greater China to help launch internationally via Indiegogo and will work with these clients to ensure their launches are successful. You'll regularly attend events, network, and speak to grow the Indiegogo brand in Greater China.  The ideal candidate understands product development and is passionate about changing how Chinese brands launch internationally, with native fluency in Mandarin Chinese and good command in business-level English.  The ideal candidate would be based in Shenzhen, China; however, Beijing, Shanghai, or Hangzhou may be considered as alternative hiring locations for particularly outstanding candidates.  Learn more about what Indiegogo is doing with entrepreneurs in China  You Will Achieve near and long-term sales targets. Identify, target, pitch, and close high-quality campaigns and partnerships that will advance our business overall, as well as in specific verticals Marshall cross-functional resources and provide high-impact consultative input to campaigners to help ensure they reach their goals Grow Indiegogo outreach in China by identifying key relationships and business opportunities, whether through networking, speaking engagements, events, press, or other opportunities, to successfully grow Indiegogo’s presence Work with U.S.-based campaign strategist team to aid the development of campaigns Actively and accurately report pipeline and performance  Qualifications 3-5 years of client-facing experience, emphasis on sales highly preferred Chinese (Mandarin) fluency and English proficiency Willing to travel in Greater China region and work flexible hours to accommodate coordination with U.S. headquarters Product vertical knowledge, experience, reputation, and network within the consumer hardware, design, and technology space; and familiarity with the Chinese hardware ecosystem. Core capabilities include: Sales: Ability to source and close high-quality campaigns Consultative: Ability to build strong, trust-based high impact relationships with clients and prospects, and educate them on innovative techniques Client development: Hands-on experience managing the end-to-end client development process, from securing initial engagements at new clients, to successfully growing long-term strategic accounts Experience and demonstrated ability to prioritize and multitask in a deadline-driven, high-pressure environment Persuasive, positive and confident disposition with strong leadership skills and ability to provide and receive constructive criticism Superior communication and public speaking skills.  Bonus Points Past professional or personal experience with crowdfunding Past professional or personal experience with, and a deep understanding of hardware/technology product design Fluency in English, written and verbal, is a plus! Existing strong network in hardware, design and consumer technology Indiegogo is committed to respecting your privacy as a job applicant. Please visit our Job Applicant Privacy Statement in our Privacy Portal for more information on your privacy rights and how Indiegogo processes your personal information.

jobTitle: Strategy & Market Development Leader - China market
description: Title : Strategy & Market Development Leader  Reports To : VP/GM Applied Market  Summary  Purpose  In this role, the Strategy & Market Development Leader will be responsible for developing and executing on market and application development strategies to drive penetration and expand market share for Applied markets and associated technology platforms. This senior leader will lead a team of Segment Managers to develop and execute on market development strategies with a focus in Pharma.  Responsibilities include developing organizational capability that brings clear understanding of end market needs & trends, upcoming regulatory requirements and builds a stream of applications and solutions to best position our current and future portfolio. The role includes developing upstream market understanding and aligning the global market penetration strategy and progress them through new product development stages to product launch.  In this role, the incumbent is expected to build and drive relationships with key opinion leaders, professional organizations and strategic accounts within our target markets, and relevant internal functions, to enrich and strengthen the overall innovation agenda throughout the strategic plan horizon.  Key Responsibilities Champions and leads overall End Market/Segment growth strategies based on fact-based analysis of market trends; competitive applications portfolios; technology advancements; and customer needs assessment and regulatory requirements Lead the development of best practices for effective value propositions and sales tools that are practical to use and aligned to segmentation and regional specific requirements; Focal point within the organization to ensure marketing collateral, applications and solutions support our overall growth strategy and aligned across Segment, R&D and Commercial organizations. Leads development and prioritization of focus segment applications that enable our solutions to be differentiated and value-add to our customers Develop deep bench of technical knowledge around applications and market segment customer needs across Instruments, Consumables & Service, and translate this knowledge into technology and solution landscaping activities Lead penetration of targeted market segments and customers Drive assessment of new product launches and current portfolio by effectiveness to sales plan, strategic intent on share of demand, pricing and value proposition. Drive marketing and application development to counter deviation from plan. Own the lessons learned feedback process and implement effective change processes to maximize the effectiveness and rigor of future new product launches Architect application support strategy to reflect market focus initiatives including establishing and managing collaborator agreements/relationships on global basis Actively develop relationships with KOLs and key customers in priority end market segments Basic Qualifications Bachelor Science degree in Science, or Business; MBA preferred Successful 10+ year track record in various strategic roles in life science tools; experience in R&D, customer and market segmentation, creating portfolio roadmaps, robust business cases, and commercialization of solutions. Preferred Qualifications Native fluency in Mandarin Experience leading cross-functional teams to drive business results Ability to develop customer needs into applications, solutions driving business growth Experience in analytical instruments is a plus PerkinElmer provides competitive compensation plans

Job ID  22479  Posted  12-Apr-2021  Areas of Interest  Administrative  Location(s)  Shanghai - Shanghai - China  Job Title: Divisional Commercial Manager  Location: Shanghai, China  Division: Data Center Solutions  Reports To: Divisional Commercial Director  Role Statement  To support the Business by educating, influencing and advising key stakeholders on commercial best practice in order to contribute to long-term growth and profitability.  Overview  Regional commercial role dedicated to DCS in APAC to support new and existing business and growth together with providing day-to-day support to the DCS team and accounts. Be the subject matter expert on the DCS commercial agreements, including but not limited to: commercial terms, areas of risk and reward, operational compliance, cost control, financial responsibilities and liabilities, milestone obligations. Work with the business subject matter experts (SMEs) and legal team to support the DCS business.  Take the lead on the commercial position of the accounts, including attending regular customer meetings, review meetings, reporting and rolling out commercial training as well as developing bespoke training for the large accounts as required.  Support the transition of new wins, including the education and influence of the operational and procurement teams in managing, mitigating and flowing down risk, managing change on the accounts, supporting change and sharing best practice.  Key Responsibilities  1 – Commercial Negotiation and Agreement of Contracts  To agree contracts on a timely basis to the mutual satisfaction of both parties. Involved with the sales, tender or re-tender process Adopting and agreeing the best negotiation strategy with internal stakeholders Leading the commercial negotiation Achieving a signed contract document Influencing internal and external stakeholders Complying with the GWS contracting standards and policies Success Criteria CBRE wins new contracts Signed Contract on best possible terms and compliant with GWS governance Clearly defined scope and obligations Good Customer Relationship 2 – Commercial Policy/Procedure Compliance.  To promote compliance with policy and procedures. Attending Business Unit, Account, Contract or Project Reviews to promote best practice Providing and maintaining standard documentation Checking processes for compliance Success Criteria Risks mitigated and offset Profits maximised Promotes positive behaviours Reduction in disputes and issues 3 – Educate and advise on commercial best practice  To develop internal stakeholders’ commercial awareness. Advising on contractual obligations Running commercial training courses Providing commercial guidance at tender stage and through the contract life cycle Presenting at Company, Divisional and BU management meetings Staying abreast of changes in relevant laws and commercial practice Success Criteria Practical and useful contract summaries/abstracts/deliverables (terms, pricing and scope) Contractual compliance Commercially astute colleagues Good account/contract/project management Minimise claims/disputes/issues 4 – Providing commercial solutions To provide commercial solutions to minimise risk and maximise opportunities. Analysing the circumstances Articulating the options and potential outcomes Influence and motivate stakeholders to take the best commercial solution Building key customer contacts to strengthen CBRE’s position in the development of long term customer relationships Considering innovative solutions Taking the lead on business issues which could lead to high risk or litigation/disputes – co-ordinating with the operators and legal team as required Success Criteria Achieving the most commercially advantageous outcome Avoid margin erosion Customer acceptance Agreed Change Control, Contract extension and/or renewal Avoid formal disputes 5 – Promote Best Practice Supplier Engagement To promote best practice in the appointment of suppliers. Timely and contractually robust order placement Transferring risk by back to back obligations Supporting the negotiation of Supplier agreements Success Criteria Dispute avoidance Meets CBRE contract requirements Protects and promotes CBRE’s service Job Requirements, Knowledge, Skills & Experience Degree qualified (or higher) or equivalent in a relevant discipline. At least five years relevant experience in a commercial role – i.e. relevant contract management experience in facilities management service providers, or trained legal & law background Sales focused negotiation skills Able to work independently with experience of working in a regional or global organization Self-motivated individual experienced and comfortable with complex problem solving and providing solutions-based advice and guidance to multiple stakeholders Customer focused approach Proven track record of working with, educating and influencing a broad range of internal and external stakeholders at all levels Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written with fluency in English & local language - Chinese (role will be based in China). Strong understanding of local laws & legalities in the relevant field Thrive on fast-pace working in a regional and global business Able to understand and anticipate business needs. description: 作为销售主任，您需要能够完成以下工作内容：  工作概述﹣(职位概述)  参与销售工作和活动来协助销售经理成功的完成客房收入和其它创收方面的预算。  主要职责﹣(职务的主要工作)  与销售经理一起计划并执行销售策略，完成预算。  销售酒店的所有设施，并跨酒店销售其它洲际酒店。  通过制定和执行工作方案来开发新业务客戶，维护现有业务客戶。  转化销售线索。  与高职位员工一起处理客户或可能成为客户的业务。  根据建立起来的监测数据接收和拒绝业务。  执行使客人熟悉环境的现场考察活动。  保持定期的电话销售模式。  监测同档次酒店并与经理就策略的更改进行交流。  参加例会。  招待潜在客户和现有重要客户以获得业务和创造更多销售额。  按要求汇报销售工作和战绩。  参加客户拜访。  与所在区域内的洲际酒店集团成员和区域预订办公室保持定期联系。  监测竞争对手的工作。  在市场上创造声誉。  协助销售经理分发宣传品和直邮广告。  与业务供应方，会展策划人，游客或会展旅行代理，旅行社，航空公司，公司，政府部门及其它与酒店业务密切相关方建立和保持联系。  依照业务需求开展工作。 除了以上职位描述中我们阐述的岗位要求外，您还要符合以下条件：  技能要求  具有代表酒店，品牌和公司与顾客，员工和第三方交往的能力。  具有解决问题和组织能力。  精通微软办公软件  良好的写作技能  学历  最好具有市场营销，酒店管理，商业管理或相关领域的大专学历或职业证书。  经验  1年相关工作经验，或与此相当的教育与工作经验结合的背景。 NULL

Key Responsibilities主要职责： 管理客户关系并提供相关服务，根据既定的市场开发原则在指定区域开拓新的客户，并保持从现有客户获得持续的销售业绩。 提供销售，活动及成本预算方面的信息，以利于销售经理做出有效的判断。 在既定的客户中，根据系统的调研和沟通，最大可能的发现影响客户现在及未来的商业机会及购买决定。 制定客户开发计划，并达到销售目标。 随时给医疗专家提供产品技术支持。 在负责的相关销售区域，了解当地的医疗市场及影响客户选择的竞争对手策略。 学习以保持对公司产品、临床应用、管理法规要求的质量标准和业务政策的及时理解。 Professional Knowledge, Skills & Qualifications任职要求： 2年及以上稳定的医药产品销售经验 (药品，耗材，设备均可） 本科及以上学历 (医学/药学/生物学等专业背景优先） 良好的沟通能力 良好的人际交往能力 良好的团队意识 良好的英文基础（CET-6，书写及口语） 可适应长短期出差

primary means of communicating with clients on a daily basis. 具有优秀的电话推销技巧；愿意每日使用电话与客户进行沟通 Strong project management skills with an ability to interact with and motivate others to succeed on several fronts simultaneously. 具备优秀的项目管理技巧，能够与他人互动、激励他人，具备多任务处理能力 High level of initiative and works well in a team environment. 工作积极性高、善于与他人合作 Strong consultative and problem-solving skills. 具备强大的咨询和问题解决能力 description: Job Title: Inside Sales Associate  Function: Inside Sales  Reports To: Inside Sales Manager or Team Lead  The Inside Sales Associate is responsible for handling sales leads and converting them to new business opportunities for internal Veeam sellers. The ISA prospects by making outbound calls, connecting end users with their local Veeam resources to drive revenue. May utilize e-mail and other electronic sales techniques in support of the prospecting effort.  Responsibilities  Makes a high level of outbound calling to potential prospects Receives and responds to inbound sales leads and converts them to new business. Maximizes coverage within a defined region and penetrates organizations with Veeam products Initiates telephone and email contact with potential prospects from developed web and lead generation lists; cold calling as needed Provides support to qualified prospects and customers including follow up, product information, quotations, and supporting the regional team in closing Veeam business. Develops a solid working knowledge of Veeam Software products and the benefits they provide to potential customers Updates and maintains notes/next step actions in the Veeam CRM system to continually advance sales cycle  Qualifications  Veeam Software is an equal opportunity employer and does not tolerate discrimination in any form on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law. All your information will be kept confidential.

In this role, you will actively contribute towards digitalization of sales analytics efforts to optimize productivity and performance of sales team.  Main Responsibilities & Tasks Develop sales dashboards with actionable/personalized insights based on statistical/mathematical modeling to accelerate growth in support of Sartorius' 2025 vision Perform quantitative analyses on large data sets from ERP, CRM, and a few other data sources to evaluate scenarios challenging status quo for informed decision making Create and maintain data pipelines to empower the sales teams with insights of high relevance and freshness Perform master data maintenance, and sales compensation activities to ensure complete ownership of sales analytics activities A critical element to success is to forge healthy relationships with the Sales & Customer Service functions to comprehend pain points and needs, and together innovate to improve intelligence offerings Curiosity to entertain new problems and an eye to deliver solutions with simplicity will be highly valued  Qualifications & Skills Bachelor's Degree required, Master´s Degree preferred in Mathematics, Bioinformatics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science or related field Profound analytical skills to deconstruct a business problem and translate it into a mathematical form Academic/Industry experience with statistical modeling/data mining projects Strong identification with our core values: Sustainability, Openness, Enjoyment Driving our future growth requires talented people. description: 该职位来源于猎聘  About This Position  We are looking for a Business Development Representative to expand business network in the key geographical region as North America and Europe. Your role will be to seek new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers.  To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience in business development and sales. You will use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from first contact until you close the deal. You will build up distribution network. If you are motivated and results-driven, and enjoy working in a team environment, we’d like to meet you.  Ultimately, you will boost sales and contribute to our long-term business growth.  Responsibilities Qualify leads from marketing campaigns as sales opportunities; Contact potential clients through cold calls and emails; Present our company to potential clients; Identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services; Customize product solutions to increase customer satisfaction; Build long-term trusting relationships with clients; Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market; Establish the distribution network through business development; Coordinate internally with other departments to ensure the delivery of the products; Report to the International Business Development Director on weekly basis with sales results; Stay up-to-date with new products/services and new pricing. Requirements Proven work experience as a Business Development Representative, Sales Account Executive or similar role; Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls); Track record of achieving sales quotas; Track record of setting up distribution/wholesales is a plus; Familiarity with MS Excel (analyzing spreadsheets and charts); Understanding of sales performance metrics; Excellent communication and negotiation skills; Ability to deliver engaging presentations; BSc degree in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field; Language skill (preferred in Chinese or German) is a plus.

description: About VERITAS  Veritas solves what no one else can. With an industry-leading product portfolio, we offer proven, modern, and integrated technology that brings together availability, protection, and insights. Our Veritas Enterprise Data Services Platform addresses current and future data issues end-to-end – keeping mission-critical workloads highly available, protecting data everywhere, and providing insights to optimize costs and maintain regulatory readiness.  Veritas supports 500+ data sources, 150+ storage targets, 50+ clouds, and any deployment model imaginable. We serve 99% of the Fortune 100, 90% of the Fortune 500, and are the market leader in Software-defined Storage, Data Protection, and Archiving.  Veritas’ Worldwide Field Operations (WFO) propels company growth by driving all aspects of new business and channel sales and includes global sales operations and global sales enablement for all new business and renewal sales.  Responsibilities The Sales Account Manager is distinguished by their deep knowledge of the IT industry and Veritas’ Information Management Portfolio. This industry expert will be assigned to large, complex, high visibility, strategic, named accounts. Sells Veritas’ entire information management portfolio (backup/recovery, high availability, clustering, archiving, eDiscovery, etc.) and maintains relationships with existing named accounts that are of substantial strategic importance to the organization. Develops strategies and orchestrates company resources to maximize sales volume and profit goals within assigned accounts. The territory is comprised of accounts that are strategic to the long-term success of the organization. The candidate is expected to cultivate and maintain executive level relationships in IT and various Lines of Business (LOB), focusing on the strategic nature of the relationship. Represents Veritas to the customer and the customer to Veritas. Responsible for expanding Veritas’ footprint in the assigned territory and ensuring ongoing customer satisfaction. Primary point-of-contact sales manager for account regardless of account’s geographic location. Meeting and/or exceeding sales quota and customer satisfaction metrics. Assigned to large, complex, high visibility, strategic, or tactically important accounts. Ability to collaborate with extended Veritas and partner teams but also to work independently to accomplish required tasks. Interface with all levels of management. Negotiating and influencing to build consensus. Present programs internally and externally. Work is focused on operational plans in support of strategic goals. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience. 4+ years’ sales and/or account management experience in IT software/hardware sales. TS/SCI clearance may be required. Strong, documented track record of achievement against quota. Current contacts/relationships and working business knowledge of assigned customers. Strong business and executive level sales acumen. Tangible examples required. Excellent time management, presentation, written and oral skills. At Veritas, we care about the causes close to your heart and enable you to volunteer, donate, and do good. We also value uniqueness and know that a more diverse and inclusive workforce makes a winning team, so come as you are! Interested? Then apply and find out more about #TeamVTAS!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Your Main Duties Will Be As Follows  As our business is expending and operating in 40-countries, we need you to provide administrative and practical support to our global sales team. You will be based in the center of the action at our Shanghai HQ. Prepare ready-to-send answers to prospective client’s questions. Mainly about HR & Tax regulations in the relevant country. Prepare quotations for our PEO services using our internal system. Support the sales managers by being the link between prospective clients and our legal team to confirm terms & conditions. Manage the contract signing process (contract scan, delivery, signature, stamp, prepare supplier registration documents, if necessary, etc.). Ensure that clients’ profile in our CRM are up to date (contacts, last activity, contract expiration date, etc.). Requirements MUST-HAVES Bachelor’s degree or above. Open to recent graduates 1-year work experience in Consulting and HR services Excellent command of English Excel and Word and Power Point proficient Extremely well organized and methodical A strong communicator, an outgoing personality, and a motivation to learn Business acumen, thrive in a high paced work environment, like to take on challenges, ability to meet deadlines LIKE-To-HAVES: Any other language would be a plus Fresh graduate will be considered Familiar with Teams, Zoom and Zoho Experience with sales assistant or operation assistant is preferred BenefitsPersonal health insurance  Birthday cake  Team building

description: At a Glance:  With strong aspirations in China, and a growing footprint of stores across the country, we are looking for a City Lead to build our brand awareness and footprint in South-Western China, with a focus on Shenzhen. In this role, you will be part of our Sales and store expansion team, and at the same time work in close collaboration with our local retail team, operating the Shenzhen store and the marketing team in Shanghai. With fresh, tactical and innovative thinking, your mission will be to grow On’s brand awareness in the region and welcome new customers to On, both through physical and digital channels. Your blend between entrepreneurial spirit, customer centricity and business performance will open new ways to drive On into the next growth phase in China. You will be sitting in Shenzhen, with frequent travel to our office in Shanghai.  Your Team:  As you might expect from a sports brand with running at its core, the China team at On is a fast-paced place to be. You’ll be part of the China Sales team and co-working with a group of highly motivated individuals. The shared goal? Efficient growth at high speed- what else?  This role is based in Shenzhen, China.  Your Mission: Build On’s brand awareness in Shenzhen and the surrounding South-West region, with a focus on acquiring new customers to the brand - runners, fitness omnivores, outdoor lovers and everyday explorers Develop On’s local ambassador program and maintain an active network of brand ambassadors in Shenzhen Build local partnerships Lead the organization of local events, e.g., running events, mixed work-outs, outdoor events, brand and ambassador events Support sell-through from our retail and wholesale stores in the region by building meaningful partnerships, a local ambassador network and social media presence that will drive traffic to our points of sale In partnership with the store expansion, marketing team and digital team, develop our city growth strategy, including store expansion, brand collab opportunities and digital growth plans Your Story: 5 years hands-on experience in either Sales, Marketing or Retail for a DtC-oriented brand in China A passion for running and/or sports in general An entrepreneurial spirit which expects the unexpected and takes calculated risks to deliver results Goal-oriented mindset with ability to drive sell-through results from a network of stores Experience in brand strategy, community marketing and/or retail marketing a plus A collaborative team player with strong interpersonal and communication skills An out-of-the-box thinker and resourceful problem-solver when faced with challenges Strong performer in previous roles Ability to read, write and speak English fluently What we offer:  We offer a dynamic, challenging and sportive environment that has been ranked as the ‘fastest growing sports company’ of its time. With offices across the globe, we are an international team who is hungry to innovate and build something incredible. We foster an active environment where each individual thrives for excellence and can achieve their full potential. This is where your work matters, you’re hands-on and your team members are amongst the very best in their respective disciplines and fields.  If you are driven to bring On to the next level, curious about the opportunity and want to be part of our growing team send us your application, and join the ONiverse!

description: Senior / Sales Associate - Patek Philippe Shanghai Beijing Maison 资深销售 / 销售 - 百达翡丽北京源邸  MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES主要职责： 1.    Introduce/present products in line with company standards to customers. 根据公司的服务标准向客户介绍、展示商品。 2.    Maintain long-term good relationships with customers. Reflect the brand spirit, report the communication with the guests to the supervisor, and feedback the information requirements of the customers to the company in time, to ensure better service and deepen the customer relationship. 维护与客户的长期良好关系。体现品牌精神，向主管汇报与客人沟通情况，及时将客人的信息要求反馈给公司，确保更好的服务和加深客户关系。 3.    Understand market trends, competitive brands, and other related information, give customers professional analysis, enhance brand awareness and image. 了解市场动态、竞争品牌等相关信息，给予客户专业的分析，提升品牌的知名度和形象。 4.    Strictly follow the brand requirements to ensure that personal image and behavior meet the brand requirement 严格遵照品牌要求，确保个人形象和行为符合品牌要求。 5.    Have a complete understanding and interpretation of brand history, background, culture and works. 对品牌历史、背景、文化及作品有完整认知和诠释。 6.    Be familiar with Maison service standard and strictly abide by it, ensure to provide customers with considerate service and good shopping experience. 熟悉源邸服务标准并严格遵守，确保给予顾客周到的服务和美好的购物体验。 7.    Strictly implement every content of Maison operation manual to ensure effective implementation in daily work. 严格源邸运营手册的每一项内容，确保有效实施在日常工作中。 8.    Register and maintain customer information according to company requirements. 按照公司要求登记客户信息并做好客户信息维护工作。 9．Daily stock-take execution and prevent stock loss. 每日货品盘点及防止货物损失。 10．Assist to maintain store clean, tidy, and visual merchandising. 帮助保持店内的清洁、整齐，做好商品的陈列展示。 11．Build strong cross-functional relationship and good communication within the organization在公司内部构建跨部门的联系 12．Any other duties/matters may be assigned from time to time. 完成其他临时交办的工作  PROFESSIONAL REQUIREMENTS岗位要求： 1.    At least 3 years of work experiences in luxury retail/hotel/aviation industry 三年以上奢侈品零售/酒店/航空行业工作经验 2.    Good communication ability, presentation, and interpersonal skills 良好的沟通能力，商品介绍能力及人际交往的技巧 3.    Fluent Mandarin, English listening and speaking 普通话、英文听说流利 4.    Service-oriented, dynamic, hardworking, and willing to learn 有服务意识，有活力，工作勤奋，乐于学习 5.    Self-motivated and result-driven 有上进心，注重结果 6.    Service-oriented, attentive, able to work under pressure 以服务为导向，细心周到，能承受压力 7.    Strong implementation, teamwork spirit, and enthusiasm 高效的执行力，具备团队合作精神，拥有工作热诚

Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Total Rewards Statement  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. description: About Us  Gore is a materials science company focused on improving lives through discovery, product innovation and rewarding careers for our Associates. 该职位来源于猎聘  We are now looking for a (Senior) Sales Expert Ports to join our team, Sales Asia Pacific.  The primary responsibility of the (Senior) Sales Expert, Ports is to increase order intake by actively seeking new customers and developing a lasting relationship with existing clients through excellent service. He/she also act as a Subject Matter Expert in the area of Ship Traffic Control (Vessel Traffic Monitoring Systems), executing the regional Smart Ports strategy, providing consultation and solutions to our customer, potential customer and the sales team.  As a (Senior) Sales Expert Ports, reporting to ASM of China, your work will focus on these responsibilities:  Sales & Business development Achieve the successful sales development and agreed targets; Identify new target customers/distributors and new sales opportunities in the assigned territory by meeting potential and existing customers; Realization of Order intake value targets in assigned region / accounts Build, maintain, broaden and strengthen good relationships with customers and partners. Selection, acquisition and retention of key accounts (partners / end-users) Apply Strategic Selling Techniques to engage prospective customers towards Wartsila Voyage on multi departmental and management levels. Manage the technical and commercial process: create proposals, quotations, organize bidding, conduct negotiations and close deals Cooperate with service and PMO team to provide good after sales service to customers and achieve customer satisfaction; Provide all necessary information, training and support to key accounts and distributors; Communicate with product team in obtaining product support Cooperate with Finance department to improve the performance of receivables Account Management Building Strategic Account Plans for assigned key Partners and End-Users Conduct Order intake analysis and Pipeline management Gain Executive Level Account Involvement both internally and externally Managing the Contract Renewal Process Manage virtual account / project teams related to assigned Customer base, using Internal and external (customer) departments. Monitor the output of the teams. Work closely with APAC regional sales and PMO team Manage possible complaints and escalations and Channel Conflicts. Reporting & Marketing Manage the sales opportunity pipeline and monthly report to management Monitor market development and innovation trend and feedback to product/solution development team in HQ Attend sales meetings and ensure that all subsequent action required is undertaken Provide Customer information / feedback on a regular basis To be successful in this role, we expect you to have: Computer, transportation engineering, information management, communication and other related professional backgrounds, master's degree or above MBA/Master’s degree in technical field or equivalent experience, with a minimum 5 years of international sales experience. Essential experience selling complex solutions and multimillion projects to governmental authority or systems integrators, primarily in the MSA, Ports, Coast guards, etc. Strong understanding of the Maritime Authority and knowledge of port operations, maritime logistics, vessel monitoring sensors and technology You should have the mind set for creating solutions and willingness to learn strategic selling methodology. Speaking in public and keeping presentation are familiar to you and you enjoy it. You already use Office tools and can easily use ERP and CRM applications. Travelling both nationally and internationally is included in this job (estimated 30% to 50%), where the situation allows it. We highly value an entrepreneurial style in working and you should be able to work autonomously. We still work as a team, so the communicational skills and a want to work together is important. Interest for new technologies and all new is needed as well as analytical skills.

jobTitle: Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , Hubei
description: Work is no longer a place. It’s what you do. And how you do it. More fluid, more flexible, powered by your imagination and by some amazing technology! That’s where we come in. We’re Poly. We’re a global outfitter of pro-grade audio and video technology so that employees everywhere can look and sound their best from anywhere. Join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to bring professional audio and video meeting technology and services to everyone. Be a part of our journey!  As an Inside Sales Channel Account Manager , (ICAM) you will work as part of our APAC Inside Sales Team. You will workwithin a defined geographical territory, ( Mainland China) and initiate, own and close sales opportunities on Products and New Service through interacting with a nominated set of Poly Channel Partners , as well as being responsible for the successful on-boarding, development and retention of such Partners.  You will be expected to generate and drive a sufficient pipeline of deals to ensure financial targets are met.  The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws.  No matter where you’re based, you’ll experience a company that believes that teamwork and collaboration drive maximum impact, seeks well-rounded talent to focused on providing the best customer experience, and understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint. And, top of mind to us is continuously and purposefully building an inclusive culture that empowers all of our team members, across the globe, to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.

description: Location: Hangzhou  Responsibilities Provide technical leadership on new product development programs, works closely with global product leadership team on the key product innovation projects; Work closely with Manufacturing, Sourcing, Commercial and AP S&T team to understand local business requirement for new and improve product development to enhance OC product performance in the use of composites; Network with other R&D leaders throughout global innovation organization to drive Projects, best practices and leveraging talent, tools, and equipment; Requirements: PhD in Polymer Science or Chemistry 5~8 years’ experience in polymer material industry is required Experience working in a multinational business environment Experience leading innovation project portfolio and driving business results Brings senior level expertise in field of composite application & design with priority on composite application Ability to build & upgrade our capabilities in the area of product development which increases impact to external stakeholders Synthesis or formulation design experience on polymer is a must Formulation design experience on fiber sizing is preferred Understanding of downstream application and market in thermoset or/and thermoplastics composite, is preferred Knowledge and experience with fiber reinforcements for industrial applications is preferred.

The job allows modification of procedures and practices covering work as long as the end results meet standards of acceptability (typically annual volume, margin and compliance requirements). Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  角色与职责 向指定客户销售时，新增客户通常很少，并且通常需要经过审查。包括单个业务组/P&L 中的关键客户 利用自身和他人的销售领域、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户群的深入知识，并运用分析思维和商业经验来执行政策/策略。 具有最佳实践知识以及了解自己的领域如何与他人融合；了解竞争以及在市场上与众不同的因素 运用判断力，并具有在设定参数之外提出不同解决方案的能力，以解决项目、产品线、市场、销售流程或客户的更复杂的日常问题。为决策制定信息优先级的能力。利用技术经验和分析思维。使用多种内部资源和自身团队之外有限的外部资源来帮助做出决定。 这些销售职位将主要由个人贡献者担任。 此级别的职位需要强大的人际交往能力。充当经验较少的同事的资源。可能会领导具有低风险和资源需求的小型项目。说明信息；培养使团队成员就领域的话题达成共识的技能。传达绩效期望，并可以处理敏感问题。  任职条件:  基本资格 该岗位要求在领域具有较丰富的工作经验。学力水平相当于从正规高等院校取得学士学位 （或根据相应工作经验具有高中学历） 所需特性 优秀的口头和书面沟通能力。优秀的人际关系和领导能力。能够影响他人并领导小型团队。领导中等范围和影响的计划。能够同时协调多个项目。有效的问题识别和解决技能。可靠的分析和组织能力。 Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Total Rewards Statement  Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.

jobTitle: BEV Sales Ops Digital Product Lead
description: 福特中国电动车事业部  福特中国电动车事业部是基于福特全球新能源战略及福特中国“电气化、智能化”战略，而专门建立的全新业务部门。  依托位于南京的福特汽车研发中心，福特中国电动车事业部将充分利用福特的全球资源和本土技术优势，以更加灵活的业务模式，推出面向中国市场的电动车产品以及智能驾驶体验，并打造以用户为中心的销售与客户服务体验。  团队鼓励创新，通过吸收多元背景人才，为福特电动车发展提供创新思维。除汽车与电动车领域的专业人才外，还吸引了众多来自快消、科技、互联网领域的优秀人才加入。  岗位职责 协同电动车销售部门，分析业务需求转换为数字产品需求和功能设计，覆盖端到端用户车辆销售、OTD流程、金融、销售用户沟通、门店活动等销售领域业务。 通过竞品分析、产品需求文档、用户体验调研等过程设计面向体验的销售数字化产品。 对内部用户及外部门店合作商进行数字产品的培训。 负责数字产品的持续运营，运营流程的制定与执行快速迭代。 通过数字化技术驱动直销模式下销售运营管理的创新。 跨部门协同，与业务、技术及设计团队共同构建项目管理规范，按时交付数字产品与服务。 基本要求 本科以上5年以上工作经验，3年以上数字化产品项目管理交付经验。 熟悉敏捷项目交付过程。 熟悉销售运营领域流程。 熟练使用原型设计，项目管理等工具软件。 熟练英语沟通与写作。 优先条件 拥有互联网产品、企业微信平台交付经验优先。 熟悉整车销售业务优先。

The role requires an active cooperation with multiple departments in Poly and so relationship building, and people skills are essential.  主要职责： 根据公司业务方向，开拓三四级城市渠道 渠道认证：渠道客户的选择、认证； 新产品上市的渠道规划与沟通； 管理负责渠道中 Poly耳机音频和视频业务，完成公司销售目标 完成负责渠道的策略和任务规划 善于利用和整合资源，促进不同团队合作，共同高效完成业绩目标 职位要求： 有一定的 IT 行业渠道销售经验优先 优秀的沟通、协作、谈判能力 勤奋，能够在快节奏的环境中工作和成长 2 年以上相关销售工作经验 全日制本科及以上学历，英语可作为工作语言优先 Our Culture  At Poly, leadership principles aren't just something we talk about, they're something we live and breathe. We believe in creating a work environment where people feel empowered, supported, and included –where trust and transparency are built into the way we work - where creativity, curiosity, and continuous improvement are encouraged and nurtured every day. C3 – Customer. Customer. Customer: Customer obsession is everyone’s job. You enjoy solving customers’ problems - big or small. You work closely with customers, channel partners and their teams to deliver innovative solutions. Raise the Bar: You take pride in your work and know details matter. You know that shavings make a pile. You seek every opportunity to continuously improve teams, products, and processes. Communicate Courageously: You speak with candor but aren't a jerk. You constructively challenge your teammates to get to the best possible outcome or decision. Once a decision is made, you fully align and stay aligned. Onward and Upward: You learn from the past but focus on the future. You rapidly adapt to changes in the marketplace. You help to create solutions that move the company forward with energy, momentum, and results. Own It: You know your business, your customers, and your team – inside and out. You don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. You act with integrity, spend money like it’s your own, and put Poly first. Take the Leap: Speed matters in business. You encourage and require those around you to think strategically and act decisively. Poly values calculated risk taking. Ride Together: We are one team. We do what we say we’ll do, we treat each other with respect, we have each other’s back, and we hold each other accountable. Leaders Lead: You know you are part of a larger global community and make decisions as good stewards of the earth, its resources and its people. Our Commitment as an Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity or expression, race, age, religious creed, national origin, physical or mental disability, ancestry, color, marital status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking, medical condition, genetic information, accessibility needs, or any other protected class or category recognized by applicable equal employment opportunity or other similar laws. jobTitle: Inside Sales Manager Ports & Maritime Far East
description: Cavotec is a leading cleantech company that designs and delivers connection and electrification solutions to enable the decarbonization of ports and industrial applications. Backed by more than 40 years of experience, our systems ensure safe, efficient and sustainable operations for a wide variety of customers and applications worldwide.   Please check out our latest video on the following link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tsuKXpMOLwE  Summary  Achieves the order intake target for spare parts and standard products Proactively expands the customer base by targeting spare parts and standard product sales opportunities to existing and new accounts Ensures high level of customer service is maintained at all times  Main tasks & key responsibilities  Regularly contact current, former and prospective customers to generate sales (e.g. Service, spare parts, standard products etc…) against the order intake target Identify prospective customers through market evaluations, business intelligence tools (e.g. Bid Prime) and other lead generation tools including cold calling Follow up on all sales leads from existing clients, RFQs and RFPs, develops a compliant offer Provides pricing and lead time of spare parts and standard products to the Sales Support Manager for project tender submission preparation Actively promote our portfolio (e.g. Service, spare parts, standard products etc…). Identify potential business opportunities based on list of references, past orders, etc. Perform market analysis for Parts and Equipment pricing Assesses competitors by analyzing competitor information and maintain and expand the company’s database of prospects Monitors the conversion rate, identifies irregularities to adapt the pricing and the lead time to consistently improving the conversion rate Proactively tracks orders with the COE to ensure timely delivery of spare parts and standard products  Key internal and external interfaces  Customers Regional Sales Director Area Sales Managers COE Sales Centre Order Management Technical Sales Support COE Logistics for outbound Procurement Service Managers Sales Support Managers  Hard skills  Outstanding phone skills Logical thought process Effective sales techniques and process Strong Product Knowledge Excel Salesforce Knowledge Reporting and documentation management Knowledge and experience of ERP systems  Soft Skills  Analysis Detail orientation Interpersonal skills Communication skills Active listening Team working Organization Proactivity Flexibility Problem solving Confident Determination Willingness to learn  Qualifications  Bachelor degree – recommended but not required, technical background will be an advantage Sales training preferred, but can be provided High energy, teamwork, and passion for driving sales Strong understanding of sales order process Technical knowledge of main products Knowledge and experience of ERP systems (Microsoft Navision knowledge will be an advantage) Well versed in Sales Force CRM tool. Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint Fluency in English  Key performance indicators Spare parts and standard products order Intake Conversion rate for quote to order On-time and in-full deliveries On-time quotations within 48 hours Quantity and quality of calls  Mobility requirements Some travel may be required  PLEASE NOTE  To be considered for this role, Cavotec requires a sales assessment that takes 30 to 45 minutes. The assessment can be taken by clicking the link below. Please kindly ensure a reliable internet connection before taking the assessment.  https://eval.objectivemanagement.com/XYNTTJP
