工作职责: Works in direct collaboration with the Product Management organization to identify, develop and launch market development programs. Gathers market intelligence, interfaces with external stakeholders and collaborates with UL Product Managers, Marketing, and Operational teams in engineering, sales, and field engineering services, with the intent of driving demand for UL’s products and services. Develops account strategies by working with product and sales for regional and vertical markets to support growth of new services and deepen penetration of core services. Focuses on organic growth, share gain, customer experience, product/service demand creation and profitability. Improves adoption rate for new and core recurring businesses, and tracks success metrics (i.e.: win ratio, revenue). Leads team to increase revenue driven by demand drivers (vs. customer push-through). Leads development of success metrics, demand driver target account establishment, and tracking methods to measure success with existing customers and new customers created by demand driver activity. Champions an engaged, inclusive and attractive work environment for UL employees with a winning culture. 任职条件:  Technical Capabilities Business and financial acumen Ability to drive growth through various business models (TIC and SaaS) Ability to effectively execute in a matrix organization Ability to drive demand in non-established (new) industries and services In-depth knowledge of TIC markets and stakeholders within Engineered Materials industries Industry savvy – can foresee the impact of industry trends on UL, product/service, and customers Demonstrated ability to establish new relationships with new accounts/influencers Experience with complex customer interactions, products, and services Experience selling into major accounts both deeper into the account and wider across functions within the account Track record of building strong teams Global experience (culture, market, business practices, etc.) Required Experience University Degree (Equivalent to Bachelor's degree) in Sales, Business, Engineering or a related discipline or related, equivalent experience. 5+ years of technical or business experience Wire & Cable and Plastics and Materials 5+ years of related experience or demonstrated competency in sales or stakeholder engagement Working with remote teams is highly valued.

Who We Are And What We Do  The Straumann Group is a global leader in tooth replacement and orthodontic solutions. It unites global and international brands that stand for excellence, innovation and quality in tooth replacement and esthetics, including Straumann, Neodent, Medentika, ClearCorrect, Dental Wings and other fully or partly owned companies and partners.  As a total solution provider, we take a holistic approach, offering training, support and a wide range of services to dental practitioners, clinics and laboratories all over the world. It is recognized as a leading innovator and works together with universities, clinics, research institutes, networks and communities to enhance the standard of patient care.  Key Responsibilities Engage certified doctors and develop potential for new cases Work qualified contracts to drive more cases Manage accounts in assigned territory Report back to District manager with all assigned reports. Maintain a personal level of product knowledge and competence in Dental and/or Orthodontia medical equipment. Provide on-site consulting/support service to the dentists in treatment. Develop relations with key accounts into lasting business partnerships, Contribute to image-building in your territory Improve market penetration by developing high potential Orthodontists and Dentists Support and evaluate account specific marketing plans Strive for commitment and action by your customer Develop, present and discuss quarterly territory plan for the different customer segments Participation in congresses and exhibitions Work closely with Regional Sales Manager and Distributors to achieve sales target and excellence customer services; Skills And Competencies 4+ years in sales/sales management experience in mainland China, preferably in orthodontic, and/or dental sales and/or marketing experience preferred. BS or BA preferred and/or equivalent experience. A degree in Stomatology or a related science discipline would be an advantage. Alternatively, background as dental therapist/hygienist and acquired valuable knowledge of the industry and its products Excellent oral and written communication skills Pride in excelling and self-directed individual. Well-developed business analysis skills including opportunity and risk assessment. Strong solutions knowledge with business understanding & market knowledge; Computer knowledge is required. Good at English Brilliant team player ready to grow in a cross-cultural environment  Furthermore You  You have a well-developed intercultural understanding and are seasoned in building and maintaining productive partnerships across borders and functions. As some of your stakeholders are working in different time zones you understand that the best time to meet is not always 9-5. And as a true team player you are aware of the potential that lies in a group who share a common will to fight, laugh, win and celebrate as a team.  Open doors and open minds  In Straumann you will join a team of highly dedicated people who share the common understanding that helping each other is key to succeeding in our daily work. Our ambition is to create value for the organization and our colleagues by continuously developing smarter tools, processes and systems that can support an attractive, productive, engaging and compliant workplace. We believe that everyone can contribute to our success.  Remuneration And Benefits Of Working At Straumann Salary and Total Package Straumann uses mercer data to establish competitive benchmarks for pay & benefits We will make a competitive offer based on external and internal benchmarks, your current remuneration and your assessed skills and abilities. Allowances and Benefits Social insurance and housing fund A comprehensive commercial insurance Mobile phone expense claim Mobile phone subsidy Company annual leave Full-pay sick leave …….and we are still adding the list with creativity and humanity. Labor Contract and Probation  A formal offer will be presented to the successful candidate and once agreed a permanent /fixed contract will be entered into with an appropriate probation period.  What is the Recruitment Process?  Based on the role and responsibilities of this position, we are looking forward to assessing our potential candidates with a comprehensive evaluation. If your resume is selected the following process will apply. Screening Interview with HR colleague 1-1 interview with line manager 1-1 interview with 2nd line manager and APAC Leaders Anticipated Start Date  Corporate Culture  The right mindset is a prerequisite for the high-performance culture we are striving to build. Our main thrust over the past years has been to inspire and foster a player-learner mindset throughout our workforce.  Learner  You and I see the world differently. The way in which you deal with such differences defines you as a “learner” or a “knower”. Are you acting as a “knower” pushing your knowledge and opinions on to others? Or are you a “learner” where the approach is to, in a more humble way, use questions to understand the person you are dealing with?  Player  You have it in your hands how you respond to a situation. If you take responsibility or if you act self-disempowering defines you as a “player” or a “victim”. Are you taking the role of a “victim”, always in the hands of external forces and not able to influence the outcome yourself? Or are you more of a “player”, where you are in control of what is happening and could affect the outcome?  Player-Learner  This works best when everyone in the company takes responsibility for their own response to any situation (player mindset) and is truly curious about the opinions and ideas of others (learner mindset).  Player-Learners inspire trust; they are energized and embrace change; they listen, find out, share, collaborate, take risks, find solutions, learn by doing, encourage and celebrate.  Want to know more?  Check out http://www.straumann.com/careers  1409

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Responsibilities Pre-sales activity will include delivery of technical expertise during the sales process including presentations, seminars, individual consultation, and hands-on demo experiments if needed. Executes technical and application based presentations on illumina’s sequencing and microarray platforms, applications and/or workflows. Post-sales activity includes working with post-installation customers providing additional workflow or applications training in strategically important labs. Supporting/assisting customers with sequencing assay design to accelerate adoption of targeted sequencing on illumina’s platforms. Attendance at tradeshows/conferences in relevant fields. Be the point person for dedicated illumina User Group Meetings in collaboration with field marketing and support team to provide sample to data workflow training Assists sales and field marketing on new strategic initiatives requiring both technical and market knowledge Works collaboratively with territory account managers, marketing, service and support teams to ensure effective account/customer management and communication through pre-sales, during and- post-sales cycle, including review and meeting account pull through targets and goals Escalates technical issues to Technical Support for possible resolution for strategically important labs. Develops and maintain positive relationships with customers in assigned territory Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs.  Preferred Requirements Life science industry experience preferred Applied Market Knowledge is a plus Extensive experience and understanding of leading genetics technologies and how they can be applied. Detailed knowledge of technological developments and trends in the sequencing markets Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills in Mandarin and English. Strong negotiation skills and ability to persuade Ability to travel within region to carry out primary responsibilities. All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.  Preferred Experience/Education Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree and a minimum of 0-2 years of related experience; or equivalent work experience. 岗位概述  Responsibilities 售前活动将包括销售过程中的技术知识演讲，如介绍演讲、研讨会、个别咨询等，在必要时，进行演示实验。 对因美纳测序和微阵列平台的应用或工作流程进行技术层面和应用层面的介绍。 售后活动包括与安装产品后的客户的协调，提供在具有重要战略意义的实验室中所需的工作流程或应用培训 支持/辅助客户的相关测序阵列设计，加快在客户因美纳平台上目标测序进程。 参加相关领域的展览会/大会。 作为与现场营销和支持团队合作的专项人员参加因美纳用户组会议，提供样品数据工作流程培训。 提供销售或现场营销新战略项目时所需有关技术和市场知识。 与区域客户经理、营销、服务和支持团队合作工作，保证有效的大客户/客户管理以及负责售前、售中和售后过程的沟通，包括回访和会面已经取得成果或达成目标的客户。 作为技术支持提供技术升级，为具有重要战略意义的实验室提供可能的解决方案。 提升和维护责任区域内客户的良好关系。 以上所列的任务和职责是本岗位的基本功能。然而，各种商务条件下可能需要完成额外的任务和职责。  Preferred Requirements 有生命科学行业经验者优先 有应用市场知识者加分 具有领先的遗传学技术及其应用方面的丰富经验和充分理解 具有技术发展和测序市场趋势的详细知识 优秀的中文普通话和英文口头和书面交流和介绍演讲技能 良好的谈判技巧和说服能力 能在负责区域内出差并完成主要职责 Preferred Experience/Education 科学学科的硕士以上学历（分子生物学、遗传学、或基因组学和/或生物信息学优先）

jobTitle: Assistant Manager, Sales, Standard Surfactant Greater China
description: BASF has been a committed partner to Greater China since 1885. With large production sites in Shanghai, Nanjing and Chongqing, as well as a global and regional research and development hub in Shanghai, BASF is a major foreign investor in the country’s chemical industry. BASF posted sales of approximately €8.5 billion in 2020 to customers in Greater China and employed 8,948 people as of the end of the year. For further information, please visit www.basf.com/cn/en.  Objectives Manage sales and customers and achieve the sales and profit targets Support business development by identifying sales potentials, new customers and applications Research and update market intelligence to supervisor/team Main Tasks Plan and manage EMO (Oleo Chemicals & Alcohols) business including key accounts and direct accounts/dealers/distributors to meet sales target; ensure account strategies are exploited consistently including new opportunities. Report all opportunities into DynaMO process at least one month in advance. Maximize profitability by contributing to the full utilization of assets in Asia Pacific and not limited by local view Enhance account relationships and meet sales targets for each assigned account and as per KPI’s via replacement or project activities including calling and visiting existing/prospective customers to fully understand and identify their needs to create a long-term customer supplier relationship. Timely response to customer request including product information, technical support via coordination with technical, customer services, logistics, Regional Pricing and Margin Management, regulatory affairs, etc as necessary to solve customer problem/NCM and to enhance customer service and satisfaction Develop strong client relationships over time that provide significant inputs to product planning, price and service strategies, manage and share relevant information, and update in systems Consolidate data and prepare analysis e.g. customer needs, including product application, sales potentials, services requirements, buying cycles, delivery schedules and internal regulations like pricing structure for defined, customer credibility/ profiles to help secure/enhance business opportunities and identify future customers. Coordinate with the personnel of customer services, logistics and inventory control to support the delivery of sales. Carry out pricing and payment policies as per strategies and advice given by Regional Pricing and Margin Management and update database of customer creditability according to company credit policies. Trace the customers’ payment process to ensure timely payment of receivables to meet established sales targets and revenue goals and follow-up overdue payments. Collect data to establish a database to obtain, update, maintain and evaluate market trends, application of products/technology and service needs, etc in order to support identifying new business opportunities. Conduct initial analysis as necessary and requested. Collect and monitor competitor activities, initially analyze data for market research to develop competitor grid and benchmarking on competitors’ positioning and the performance of their competitive products. Analyze monthly sales/profit performance, proactively prevent business lost and initiate action for recovering Provide timely reports to supervisor/ team members Requirements Education: Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry or related discipline Working Experience: Proven successful performance with minimum 6 years’ working experience in sales & marketing Result oriented, able to identify and exploit business opportunities Good communication and presentation skills Selling and negotiation skills Primary Location  CN-Guangdong-Guangzhou  Job  Sales / Technical Sales  Ongoing  For BASF, diversity is one of the essential keys to business success and the well-being of our employees. We promote an inclusive culture that accepts the diversity of people, experiences and capabilities. Join the team and connect with more than 117,000 other minds. Stay alert for possible recruitment fraud!  This can include fake websites, fake job offers, or contact from a person falsely claiming to represent BASF.

Who You Are Bachelor degree and above with medical related majors More than 5 years’ experience in sales and marketing management in pharmaceutical industrial International working experience and network Medical and pharmaceutical related knowledge of relevant market segments Strong strategic initiative Strong leadership and influence power Marketing related competencies YOUR APPLICATION  If your background and personal experience fit this profile, please send us your complete application at www.career.bayer.cn If you have any recommendations, please kindly send mail to cnreferral@bayer.com  L ocation:  China : BeiJing : BeiJing  Division:  Pharmaceuticals  Reference Code:  478401

Customer Success Manager - Remote  App Annie is always looking for extraordinary candidates with Mobile, SaaS, analytics background and we'd love to get to know you! We do not have any current openings for a Customer Success Manager in this location, however, in the event that a position opens up, we'd love for you to be the first person to know! Below is what we traditionally look for:  Something About Us...  App Annie is the industry’s most trusted mobile data and analytics platform. Our mission is to help customers create winning mobile experiences and achieve excellence. We created the mobile app data market and are committed to delivering the industry’s most complete mobile performance offering. We are headquartered in San Francisco with 12 offices worldwide. More than 1,200 enterprise clients and 1 million registered users across the globe and spanning all industries rely on App Annie as the standard to revolutionize their mobile business.  Along with a market defining product, we take great pride in our culture and values and strive to embody them daily! We set a high bar for our success and have made Excellence as our our standard, hold each other Accountable, continuously push Innovation and Win with Style.  What can you tell your friends when they ask you what you do?  As a Customer Success Manager at App Annie, you will work with a portfolio of clients and be accountable for driving adoption, engagement, renewal, and growth of the App Annie platform and data set. You will partner with the Account Management Team to build relationships and uncover pain points of your clients and show them how they can drive business value while using App Annie.  We are an exceedingly collaborative team with a focus on results and client-centricity. This position will put you at the forefront of the fast-growing mobile and big-data industries and give you the opportunity to work with the most dynamic companies in the world—those who are working on the next big thing.  Our team members exhibit strong customer-facing skills, have an entrepreneurial spirit, remain calm under pressure and thrive on driving results with our customers. This is a sales and client relationship role, not technical support  You will be responsible for and take pride in… Develop trusted advisor relationships with decision makers and executives from local tech companies. Leverage digital tools to develop your customer success plans, help customer drive business value from App Annie platform Ensure the customer success plan is being executed. Able to manage client on-boarding process: have a strong knowledgeable of our data, methodology, and visualization tools and be able to explain these to internal and external stakeholders Develop best practices for App Annie’s various verticals and share with your customer efficiently Able to identify at-risk accounts and turn around those accounts Responsible for key customer success metrics, including customer churn and renewals You should recognize yourself in the following... At least 5+ years in a client success, account management, or management consulting role, working with enterprise and strategic clients. Bonus points if you have experience in Mobile or Data industry Business savvy; ability to translate business needs into data and product requirements Excellent verbal and written communication skills Extremely strong presentation and communication skills Polish and credibility with C-level executives - ability to develop Exec alignment within strategic accounts You are a passionate, driven, caring, customer-obsessed individual who is also naturally curious with a mature personality and a great team player Energy and creativity are key characteristics that describe you and the projects you lead. You make it happen. Boom! This Is What We Have To Offer… We provide a WFH allowance to set you up for remote work success. Internet allowance for stable internet connection, so your video does not freeze on Zoom. Flexible working days. We love to meet, but if you need to get your kids behind school-zoom, need to leave early to get to your band repetition or gym classes, do your thing. Paid leave, so long as you promise to come back! Health and dental benefits. An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations. Wellbeing allowance for any activity that matters to your wellbeing; (online) gym classes, fitness equipment, mindfulness apps or even childcare support! Unlimited access to online learning platform Udemy to help you develop your skills. Virtual initiatives and events to keep you connected with your colleagues. Yes, I want this job!

All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.  Preferred Educational Background Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required. Preferred Experience & Skills Open, flexible, and positive can-do attitude with strong interpersonal skills Good verbal and written communication skills Quick learner 0-2 years of direct work experience, related industry a plus but not required Exposure of commercial organization processes and data analytics Ability to understand and articulate complex topics with strong written and verbal communication skills Demonstrated ability to multi-task, work in team settings, and work independently when required Strong attention to detail and commitment to deliver quality work in a timely manner Self-motivated with a desire to innovate and improve on current state Knowledge of Microsoft Office and Outlook and possess an innate ability to navigate through new software applications. Experience with SAP and Salesforce.com a plus.

Mendix Is a Low-code App Development Platform  First, what is low-code? Low-code is a visual approach to software development that enables you to abstract and automate every step of the application lifecycle. Gartner predicts that “by 2024, low-code application development will be responsible for more than 65% of application development activity.” Mendix is repeatedly ranked a Leader in analyst reports from Gartner and Forrester. In the 2021 Gartner® Magic Quadrant for Multiexperience Development Platforms, Mendix placed at the very top of the Leaders quadrant.  Mendix, the global leader in enterprise low-code, was created to promote collaboration between Business & IT teams. Thousands of forward-thinking companies around the world like Ford Auto, Rabobank Netherlands, Zurich Insurance, and Red Bull, can unleash their best ideas faster with the help of the Mendix Platform.  Mendix Is a Siemens Business  Siemens is a Top 10 Global Software Company and a leader on Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in the World! With the acquisition of Mendix in 2018, Siemens Digital Industries Software is driving transformation to enhance the digital enterprise where engineering, manufacturing and electronics meet the future of innovation. Mendix employees have the opportunity to work in a hyper-growth environment with the support of Siemens’ unbeatable market position and resources.  As part of the Partner Sales Execution team, you support and facilitate the successful growth of revenue derived through the Indirect Channel in terms of supporting Partners directly through the sales cycle, coaching on account management, opportunity management and deal closure to meet revenue objectives.  You’ll Help Our Customers Drive Digital Innovation By Working closely with our partners including system integrators, consulting companies and SaaS vendors to generate pipeline & meet/exceed channel revenue in a co-sell motion Build productive relationships with Channel Solution Partners, Partner Management Executives and Partner Development Executives within a territory Execute on the sales and marketing strategies to communicate the differentiated value of Mendix to the customer at both the technical and business levels Consistently communicating and brainstorming with extended team around all aspects of account and opportunity development. You’re The Innovator We Need If You Have 3+ years of demonstrated direct sales experience in enterprise software with a proven track-record of consistently exceeding annual quota & performance targets Experience of enabling and selling with Channel Partners. Proven ability to handle complex sales cycles including the ability to provide coordination and direction to your extended team You follow a proven and repeatable process to achieve your success and have leveraged your process to overachieve in multiple roles Ability to travel as needed Working at Mendix  Mendix has been recognized as a Best Cloud Computing Company to Work For by Forbes. With offices in 16+ countries including headquarters in Rotterdam and Boston, Mendix provides an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.  While Each Employee Brings Their Own Unique Cultures And Personalities To The Workplace, We Collectively Live By Our Mendix Blue Guiding Principles  While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.  We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.  We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.  We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.  We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.  We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.  We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.  We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

Envista and its family of companies (Envista) will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Envista will consider unsolicited referrals and/or resumes submitted by vendors such as search firms, staffing agencies, professional recruiters, fee-based referral services and recruiting agencies (Agency) to have been referred by the Agency free of charge and Envista will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt such unsolicited resumes. An Agency must obtain advance written approval from Envista's internal Talent Acquisition or Human Resources team to submit resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully-executed contract approved by the Global Talent Acquisition leader and in response to a specific job opening. Envista will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement and written approval in place.  About Us  Envista is a global family of more than 30 trusted dental brands, united by a shared purpose: to partner with professionals to improve lives. Envista helps its customers deliver the best possible patient care through industry-leading dental consumables, solutions, technology, and services. Our comprehensive portfolio, including dental implants and treatment options, orthodontics, and digital imaging technologies, covers an estimated 90% of dentists' clinical needs for diagnosing, treating, and preventing dental conditions as well as improving the aesthetics of the human smile. Envista companies, including KaVo, Kerr, Nobel Biocare, Implant Direct and Ormco, partner with dental professionals to help them deliver the best possible patient care.  Envista separated from Danaher as an independent company in 2019. We brought with us the proven Envista Business System (EBS) methodology, an experienced leadership team, and a strong culture grounded in continuous improvement, commitment to innovation, and deep customer focus to meet the end-to-end needs of dental professionals worldwide. Envista is now one of the largest global dental products companies, with significant market positions in some of the most attractive segments of the dental products industry. For more information, please visit www.envistaco.com .  By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

MACOM designs and manufactures semiconductor products for Data Center, Telecommunication and Industrial and Defense applications. Headquartered in Lowell, Massachusetts, MACOM has design centers and sales offices throughout North America, Europe and Asia. MACOM is certified to the ISO9001 international quality standard and ISO14001 environmental management standard.  MACOM has more than 65 years of application expertise with multiple design centers, Si, GaAs and InP fabrication, manufacturing, assembly and test, and operational facilities throughout North America, Europe, and Asia. Click here to view our facilities. In addition, MACOM offers foundry services that represents a key core competency within our business.  MACOM sells and distributes products globally via a sales channel comprised of a direct field sales force, authorized sales representatives and leading industry distributors. Our sales team is trained across all of our products to give our customers insights into our entire portfolio.  MACOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer  We consider applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital status or veteran status or any other legally protected status  China Business Development Manager  Responsibilities Build and manage team of business development professionals to drive business growth for MACOM’s RF and Microwave product portfolio in China. Engage with the sales team and key customers to understand system and market requirements Develop complete product roadmap to address future customer and market needs based on key industry trends and leveraging MACOM capabilities Develop deep understanding of customer needs and competitor portfolios with a view to defining highly differentiated products with clear competitive advantages Work closely with engineering management to define new capabilities which need to be developed to address future needs of market and customers Key Attributes: Ability to manage a team of high performers. Strong technical knowledge of RF and Microwave components (high frequency MMICs, RF diodes, RF power devices) and communications systems Ability to work closely with engineering teams to evaluate tradeoffs and make decisions for optimum business success A desire to work across organizational functions to innovate and provide differentiated solutions to customer problems Ability to communicate well at all levels of customer organization from executive management to technical leadership Team player who enjoys solving problems collaboratively Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering with 10+ years of industry experience Previous experience in RF/Microwave integrated circuit design or applications engineering Experience managing teams of engineers or sales professionals Some experience in communications system design an advantage Proficiency in English with strong verbal and written communication skills and experience presenting to customers and executive management

jobTitle: Sr. Account Manager - Shanghai (Customer Development Manager)
description: At Kids II, we’re really good at what we do. And when we’re great at our jobs, we help parents be great at their jobs.  Parenting is demanding, and that’s where we come in. We want to reimagine how brands can make it easier for early stage parents – not by just selling them products, but by providing holistic solutions that transcend borders, categories and aisles.  No matter our title or department, at Kids II, our job is to create more tiny wins for parents, so they can create bright futures for their little ones. That’s a big task!  We’re serious about what we do, AND we love to have fun. Our team is hardworking, entrepreneurial, and passionate about helping families create millions, if not billions of tiny wins.  Summary  This role is responsible for leading business results across Kids2 Asia distributors and key accounts including sales volume, spending within budget and share growth. This role requires the ability to execute in both eCommerce and brick and mortar environments.  Primary Responsibilities And Essential Functions Responsible for achieving profitable sales and share growth in alignment with sales plan goals/objectives. Primary contact on items relating to daily operations of the business Achieve merchandising/traffic/conversion objectives, new item acceptance and budget adherence Fiscal responsibility, specifically associated with developing, and delivering a financial plan that achieves planned spend and delivers a positive ROI contribution on trade spending. Develop effective and productive relationships with distributors, customers, as well as with cross-functional teams. Work with cross functional / sales business unit resources to develop execution plans that align with the sales business unit strategies. Analyze business opportunities and provide input into the development of go-to-market (e.g., new channels, new item launches, trade deployment, pack creation, etc.) plans and activity sets. Understand distributor customer’s market, shopper & shopping mission, retail & category challenge and opportunity, and provide shopper specific category story helping customers to sell and manage business; Get involved in big selling or promotion planning events of distributor customer’s business. Work collaboratively with demand planning to provide annual and ongoing distributor and customer forecasting for new product concepts, initiatives, and annual brand plans. Manage and evaluate the distribution network to maximize the sales opportunity and drive efficiencies across the network. Comfortable negotiating and ensuring delivery of agreed upon metrics and contract value; secure terms for contracts, with the ability to bargain and negotiate concessions in the interest of parsing out a final contract containing terms by which all parties agree to abide. Manage supply chain initiatives through S&OP process to optimize ship point mix, new fulfillment opportunities, planning for peak periods and improvements on scorecard/chargebacks. Qualifications & Experience A minimum of 3 years’ experience selling consumer products. Proven experience to develop collaborative relationships and manage distributors and retailers, and across internal cross-functional departments is required. Experience managing accounts profitability and investments is required. Experience in customer marketing and e-commerce experience in consumer products is highly desired. Education & Skills Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university in Sales, Business Administration, eCommerce or related field. Creative, highly motivated, self-starter, detail-oriented, organized, can efficiently work in an extremely fast-paced environment, a team player and possesses excellent verbal and visual communication skills. Ability to deliver consistent results Ability to create highly collaborative relationships internally and externally Strategic agility Influencing Problem solving Fluent in English. LOCATION  Shanghai  Computer/Typing Skills  Must be proficient in PowerPoint, Excel and Word.  PHYSICAL DEMANDS  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; have flexible use of hands; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and color vision.  WORK ENVIRONMENT  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  General office environment. Some travel required.  We offer competitive pay, flexible hours, and generous benefits. Plus, to keep things fun (because we are all kids at heart), we offer a host of team member activities and philanthropic efforts throughout the year and company-wide awards and recognition for a job well done!  Check out our website at www.kidsii.com and our social media pages on LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram for more information and open positions in the career section.  Drug Free Workplace M/F/D/V

description: 职位：房产案场销售 Site sales 汇报上级：案场经理 Site Manager 工作地点：项目所在地（江苏宜兴/安徽九华山/浙江千岛湖/吉林北大湖） 薪资待遇：面议，待遇从优，另有佣金，年终奖金，五险一金，补充医疗险等  公司介绍： PVCP璞蔚房地产，欧洲知名旅游地产开发及管理集团Pierre & Vacances-Center Parcs集团（PVCP集团）中国全资房地产投资子公司。 法国PVCP集团（全称：Pierre & Vacances-Center Parcs集团）成立于1967年，集度假房产开发及销售和旅游度假经营两大业务于一体，至今已有超过50年历史。集团旗下逾280座度假村和度假酒店，分布于全球21个国家和地区。2018-2019 财年，集团总收入约为16.72亿欧元，每年接待约800万游客。 2016 年，PVCP集团正式进军亚洲市场，在上海成立其亚洲全资房地产投资子公司——PVCP 璞蔚房地产。PVCP璞蔚房地产秉承诚信关怀的经营原则和集团超过 50 年的行业成功经验，专注于旅游度假地产的销售业务，希望在亚洲市场重新打造“旅游度假地产投资”的行业形象。 PVCP璞蔚房地产精选 PVCP 集团在海内外自主开发及运营的度假房产，同时代理销售其它国际一线品牌的度假房产项目，满足中国家庭不同的投资及度假需要。  岗位职责： ·        在项目案场为客户提供专业细致的房产投资咨询服务 ·        为客户制定合适的投资及度假方案 ·        项目周边渠道开发及合作关系维护 ·        陪伴客户完成投资 ·        熟练掌握区域楼盘详细情况, 带客看房 ·        协助客户完成签约、资金转账，贷款等全部投资流程 ·        客户关系维护，挖掘推荐客户 ·        及时跟踪客户信息并录入CRM系统 ·        定期组织公开展会及现场说明会活动 ·        及时向公司反映客户反馈及市场动态  岗位要求： ·        有房地产销售相关经验优先，有案场售楼处销售经验者优先 ·        学历专业不限，国际贸易，房地产，旅游，奢侈品，市场营销等专业优先 ·        销售能力强，拥有优秀的沟通和谈判技能，有驾照者优先 ·        对地产销售工作充满激情，正直诚信，有责任感 有潜在客户资源优先

description: 朝阳行业头部品牌，公司在国内市场份额逐年扩大，前景光明 直接汇报VP，汇报对象高阶，个人发挥成长空间极佳  About Our Client  我的客户以高品质的奶源以及多品类的产品（常温奶，奶粉，奶酪等）闻名于全世界，在欧洲市场达到50%的以上的市场占有率。 进入中国4年的时间，每年以100%的速度增长销售额，2020年电商业务大约4亿人民币.  Job Description  该职位的主要职责为与公司高层、市场、销售部门合作输出企业商业战略，并跟进战略落地及重大项目的推进和执行  The Successful Applicant  理想的候选人应具备以下条件： - 在FMCG行业具备扎实的商业战略规划能力 - 5-8年FMCG行业商业战略方向工作经历或服务FMCG客户的乙方咨询公司顾问从业经历 - 极强的PPT及演讲展示技能 - 英文可以作为工作语言 - 奶制品行业经验及M&A经验均为加分项  What's On Offer  我的客户为朝阳行业知名公司，可以为候选人提供稳定上扬的职业发展路径，且直接汇报VP，汇报线高阶，为公司核心成员，附加优厚的薪资待遇  Contact: Kexin Gao  Quote job ref: 4174229

Who We Are And What We Do  The Straumann Group is a global leader in tooth replacement and orthodontic solutions. It unites global and international brands that stand for excellence, innovation and quality in tooth replacement and esthetics, including Straumann, Neodent, Medentika, ClearCorrect, Dental Wings and other fully or partly owned companies and partners.  As a total solution provider, we take a holistic approach, offering training, support and a wide range of services to dental practitioners, clinics and laboratories all over the world. It is recognized as a leading innovator and works together with universities, clinics, research institutes, networks and communities to enhance the standard of patient care.  Key Responsibilities Engage certified doctors and develop potential for new cases Work qualified contracts to drive more cases Manage accounts in assigned territory Report back to District manager with all assigned reports. Maintain a personal level of product knowledge and competence in Dental and/or Orthodontia medical equipment. Provide on-site consulting/support service to the dentists in treatment. Develop relations with key accounts into lasting business partnerships, Contribute to image-building in your territory Improve market penetration by developing high potential Orthodontists and Dentists Support and evaluate account specific marketing plans Strive for commitment and action by your customer Develop, present and discuss quarterly territory plan for the different customer segments Participation in congresses and exhibitions Work closely with Regional Sales Manager and Distributors to achieve sales target and excellence customer services; Skills And Competencies 4+ years in sales/sales management experience in mainland China, preferably in orthodontic, and/or dental sales and/or marketing experience preferred. BS or BA preferred and/or equivalent experience. A degree in Stomatology or a related science discipline would be an advantage. Alternatively, background as dental therapist/hygienist and acquired valuable knowledge of the industry and its products Excellent oral and written communication skills Pride in excelling and self-directed individual. Well-developed business analysis skills including opportunity and risk assessment. Strong solutions knowledge with business understanding & market knowledge; Computer knowledge is required. Good at English Brilliant team player ready to grow in a cross-cultural environment  Furthermore You  You have a well-developed intercultural understanding and are seasoned in building and maintaining productive partnerships across borders and functions. As some of your stakeholders are working in different time zones you understand that the best time to meet is not always 9-5. And as a true team player you are aware of the potential that lies in a group who share a common will to fight, laugh, win and celebrate as a team.  Open doors and open minds  In Straumann you will join a team of highly dedicated people who share the common understanding that helping each other is key to succeeding in our daily work. Our ambition is to create value for the organization and our colleagues by continuously developing smarter tools, processes and systems that can support an attractive, productive, engaging and compliant workplace. We believe that everyone can contribute to our success.  Remuneration And Benefits Of Working At Straumann Salary and Total Package Straumann uses mercer data to establish competitive benchmarks for pay & benefits We will make a competitive offer based on external and internal benchmarks, your current remuneration and your assessed skills and abilities. Allowances and Benefits Social insurance and housing fund A comprehensive commercial insurance Mobile phone expense claim Mobile phone subsidy Company annual leave Full-pay sick leave …….and we are still adding the list with creativity and humanity. Labor Contract and Probation  A formal offer will be presented to the successful candidate and once agreed a permanent /fixed contract will be entered into with an appropriate probation period.  What is the Recruitment Process?  Based on the role and responsibilities of this position, we are looking forward to assessing our potential candidates with a comprehensive evaluation. If your resume is selected the following process will apply. Screening Interview with HR colleague 1-1 interview with line manager 1-1 interview with 2nd line manager and APAC Leaders Anticipated Start Date  Corporate Culture  The right mindset is a prerequisite for the high-performance culture we are striving to build. Our main thrust over the past years has been to inspire and foster a player-learner mindset throughout our workforce.  Learner  You and I see the world differently. The way in which you deal with such differences defines you as a “learner” or a “knower”. Are you acting as a “knower” pushing your knowledge and opinions on to others? Or are you a “learner” where the approach is to, in a more humble way, use questions to understand the person you are dealing with?  Player  You have it in your hands how you respond to a situation. If you take responsibility or if you act self-disempowering defines you as a “player” or a “victim”. Are you taking the role of a “victim”, always in the hands of external forces and not able to influence the outcome yourself? Or are you more of a “player”, where you are in control of what is happening and could affect the outcome?  Player-Learner  This works best when everyone in the company takes responsibility for their own response to any situation (player mindset) and is truly curious about the opinions and ideas of others (learner mindset).  Player-Learners inspire trust; they are energized and embrace change; they listen, find out, share, collaborate, take risks, find solutions, learn by doing, encourage and celebrate.  Want to know more?  Check out http://www.straumann.com/careers  1407

description: 该职位来源于猎聘  Job Description  This is a commissioned sales position. Responsible for Influencing and advocating Intel based products and solutions for all of Intel's Business units through a vertically oriented, solutions led approach to Business and IT. Responsible for working with a few named accounts in specific industry segments or territories where deep engagements require a multi year strategy with the customer around transformation and territory engagements take the more traditional approach. Impact should result in executive level trusted advisor status which should drive our relevance, preference and pull for our strategic focus areas. This role covers both ICs AND those Managing the teams.  Qualifications  Driving the adoption and preference for Intel-based cloud infrastructure, cloud services, and cloud solutions.  Cultivate, educate, and engage senior-level decision makers responsible for determining and selecting workload placement with Cloud Service Providers (CSPs) and Cloud services [IaaS and PaaS].  Manage Intel's engagement with peer technical sales executives from partner CSP's [cloud service providers] and ISV [software vendors] to drive the preference of workload placement and adoption on Intel based instances and solutions.  Understand the customers business use cases for cloud, the technical merits of cloud vs. on premise, and the TCO value proposition; identify gaps or opportunities, and execute sales strategies that result in wining and deploying solutions on Intel based Cloud Solutions  Exhibit a solid understanding of Datacenter hardware and software trends and solutions, including Virtualization/Software-Defined Data Center, Containers/Function-as-a-Service, Big Data Analytics, Database, Application Middleware, HPC, Machine Learning, Security, Storage and Networking as well as general Enterprise IT/applications knowledge  Work in a collaborative team environment, within the account team and with business unit and partner teams, coordinating the right resources to produce preference for Intel.  Be the voice of the customer; encapsulate customer-/market-feedback into the Intel business-units/development teams to shape future product/technologies and customer engagement.  Stay current and familiar with emerging vertical and horizontal technologies, products and technology trends  Demonstrate strong verbal and written communication, presentation and collaboration skills. Good relationship building skills are necessary, including the ability to build a rapport and communicate effectively with all levels of Intel and the customer.  Minimum Qualifications 10+ years of enterprise consultative sales. Knowledge of the ISV players, solutions, and Intel product offerings within the cloud ecosystem. 10+ years of experience in delivering sales or marketing programs to accomplish joint business objectives and solution selling. Bachelor's degree in relevant technical or business field, MBA preferred.  Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research.

Why Patients Need You  Through the power of our seven portfolios, we have an unparalleled opportunity to learn faster, act quicker, and be bolder. Whether you are responsible for leading commercial strategies or supporting the development and implementation, your role can transform the way we launch our products to get them into the hands of patients faster and with more impact.  What You Will Achieve  You will apply your business and analytical expertise to financial, resource and portfolio data to improve business decision making to elevate our operating model. You will manage periodic and adhoc financial and resource analytics and dashboards, aggregating and interpreting data into meaningful and timely information, proposing options, recommendations and actions. You will partner with the Business Director and other leaders to plan and execute against business strategy, managing assigned financial and sourcing aspects of strategic initiatives relating to advances in our operating model.  As a Manager, you provide guidance to operational teams for managing projects. Your planning skills will help in preparing forecasts for resource requirements, and providing areas of improvement for products, processes or services. Through your comprehensive knowledge of principles, concepts and theories of the discipline, you will also work towards advancing new concepts and methodologies. You will be able to take a leadership role to facilitate agreements between different teams.  Through your expertise and extensive knowledge, you will be able to foster a culture that promotes innovation and thrives on doing better for patients.  How You Will Achieve It Provide guidance, lead/co-lead projects, manage own time to meet objectives and plan resource requirements for projects across the Department. Leverage Business Operations and sales force business applications to achieve organization goals. Support the activities of vendor oversight as needed in partnership with Global Procurement and CoE (Center of Excellence). Support in the oversight of key metrics and quality measures and provide analytical support and expertise for key projects. Serve as operational support lead and point of contact for various cross-functional partners. Collaborate with internal teams to create landing pages and optimize customer experience, instrument conversion/engagement points and optimize user funnels / analyzes web traffic and customer engagement metrics. Support team communication effectiveness via team meetings, intranet sites and regular communications. Review best practices resulting from programs conducted in the country. Work closely with delivery partner to enhance delivery service and drive adherence to contract Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Assess records, prioritize, assign, follow-up, and report on open and closed actions and issues associated with local market implementation. Partner with local business units, providing expertise in the development of digital channels that meet business requirements. Qualifications  Must-Have Bachelor's Degree 5+ years’ experience Proven ability to drive execution of strategies. training design and delivery experience in the pharmaceutical industry Proficient in project management skills Market business acumen and ability to lead innovation Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize Excellent command of both written and spoken English Proficiency in utilizing MS Office Applications Nice-to-Have Master's degree Experience in commercial operations and/or sales & marketing Experience in a promoted position with people leadership and/or developmental role with demonstrated leadership across peer and manager groups Structured Query Language knowledge would be desirable Pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.  Mkt & Sales/Commercial Bus

Are you looking to build a long-term sales career with a leader in forwarding and logistics? Join our international seafreight/airfreight team at cargo-partner, be a part of our ongoing success story. To support our rapid growth in Asia Pacific, we are hiring highly motivated individuals who are sales savvy, and believe in delivering quality service to fulfil customer needs.  If you are excited about meeting sales challenges, and has a proven track record of opening doors and closing sales, let’s talk!  Descriptions Of Key Responsibilities/ Tasks  Business Development- To coordinate, direct and lead sales within defined field of responsibility To own business development activities To be responsible for route management and development of Intra-Asia lanes To manage, develop and oversee global agents relationship for defined markets and trade lanes To retain & keep good relationship with existing clients To represent interests of the Company before third parties To coordinate the relations with other sections in the Company To follow and accomplish Business Development department common targets To persuade a profit policy at all the time Route Development- To perform partner development for the well-defined geographical area; display of partner network; inform and update them about our products; build up a versatile network, monitor profitability of the partner and area To attract target partners for the entire cargo-partner network To expertise in country facts and knowledge, economic geography skills, competitor information, key and target accounts To perform sales lead management To expert sales pressure to the partner and also with the cargo-partner group to sell the sales areas vice versa To monitor risk management and payment term agreements To publish the system partners in all areas and sections of the Company To assist superior route management and development of defined markets and trade lanes To take up additional assignments/tasks as required to meet with the Company needs. Minimum Education /Qualifications/Experience: University degree in Business Administration/ Logistics or equivalent . Approximately 3 years’ business development/ sales experience. Fluency in both English & Mandarin.  Company Introduction  cargo-partner is a privately owned full-range info-logistics provider offering a comprehensive portfolio of air, sea, land transport and warehousing services, with special expertise in information technology and supply chain optimization. The company operates over 130 offices in 40 countries around the world to create fast and efficient solutions for a wide range of industries. With the SPOT platform, cargo-partner ensures easy cooperation and full transparency throughout the supply chain.  As a family-owned business, we are very employee-oriented and want to work with you to develop your career and personal goals. Take a look at our Mission & Vision.  If you are looking for a challenging position in an innovative and dynamic international company, we want to get to know you!  Privacy Policy  Apply now! It will only take a minute, we promise!

Our client is a top tier investment bank with business pans through the globe. They are targeting at setting up a full-fledged business based here in Shanghai or Shezhen..  As a New Private Banker, you will apprentice with a team to source and develop new business opportunities, as well as to support existing client relationships. The Private Banker Development Framework allows new advisors to work as part of a team to gain a comprehensive level of general knowledge and to acquire specialized expertise within the team. Throughout this apprenticeship program, Private Banker will attain the skills needed to build relationships with clients and prospective clients, develop a strong network of intermediaries, and create asset allocation strategies and holistic wealth advisory recommendations to clients.  Responsibilities Private Banker serve as trusted advisors to their clients, including wealthy individuals and families, corporate executives, entrepreneurs, and select institutions, including foundations and endowments. Private Banker not only deliver a high level of service and an unparalleled investment platform, but also serve as their clients' bridge to the full product and service offerings and beyond, which may include tax and estate planning, philanthropic planning, and private banking services. Private Banker and their teams offer specialized support and advice tailored to meet the specific needs and goals of each client. This investment advice is based on analytic rigor, taking into account a client's investment objectives, liquidity needs, and risk tolerance. Requirements: Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to build and foster a strong network of relationships Demonstrated interest in and knowledge of financial, economic and global capital markets Possess knowledge of investment products and be able to execute trades for equities, derivatives, fixed income, bonds, warrants and mutual funds Strong client focus, business development and relationship management skills. Fluent in Mandarin and English. Proven leadership ability. Strong analytical and communication (oral and written) skills. Creative approach to problem solving and developing innovative solutions for clients. Commitment to excellence and a high-level integrity. Prior sales, marketing or investing experience a plus, but not required Graduated with a university degree.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Staffing and Recruiting, and Financial Services

During the probationary period, including not limited to transfer, promotion, etc., are not considered to pass the probationary period and the employee is required to pass the probationary period. Valid driver’s license with a clean driving history and proficient driving skills. 主要职责 保证最佳客户体验：接待所有进店客人，回答问题，热情地为客户和特斯拉粉丝介绍电动汽车的优点,普及电动车知识。 通过良好的沟通，帮助特斯拉爱好者及未来车主更好地了解公司动态，明确特斯拉的发展前景并鼓励顾客试驾，并通过良好的试驾体验使潜在客户向亲朋好友宣传特斯拉。 收集潜在客户，参加市场活动，探索客户购买需求、激发客户需求，配合销售主管完成门店的销售目标。 对现有特斯拉车主提供高质量客户服务。 沟通最新公司讯息，帮助特斯拉爱好者及未来车主更好地了解公司动态。 认真学习了解公司及产品的相关知识，及时了解最新行业发展和最佳实践。 建立良好的客户关系，并在试驾过程中提供完美的客户体验使潜在客户向亲朋好友传递良好特斯拉口碑。 通过公司安排的内部测试，包括但不限于课程培训及测试、驾驶技术测试、店内测试、角色扮演、能力认证、试用期评估等，以达到正式员工的标准和要求。 和外部客户、外部人员，保持清晰、准确、职业、礼貌的沟通, 和内部同事保持良好的沟通和团队协作（包括同部门、跨部门；同门店、跨门店；同地区、跨地区之间）。 保持库存充足和整洁（如适用）。 员工在试用期期间发生的任何职位变更，包括并不限于调岗、晋升等，均不可视为通过试用期，员工需要通过试用期评估。 其他职责：根据业务发展需要，完成管理层指定的其他工作。 职位要求 应届毕业生或1到2年零售、行业销售、以及大客户销售经验或服务经验； 对企业文化高度认可。 出色的沟通能力和客户服务意识。 良好的自我管理能力及自我学习能力，积极热情地参与改变个人交通行业的变革。 深刻理解并传递业务问题和技术概念。 优秀的团队意识，是可靠的团队成员。 能够接受零售业的工作时间，需要晚上和周末工作；有销售经验优先。 持有有效中国驾照，熟练驾驶，且无不良行驶记录。

description: Epredia, a global leader in providing solutions for cancer diagnostics, is dedicated to improving lives by enabling our customers to achieve diagnostic excellence. We’re growing quickly and constantly expanding our team. Find a rewarding career with a diverse group of individuals that share a passion to do work that matters and positively impacts patient lives.  Reporting  Report to Area sales manager, East Region, China  Position Summary Achieve sales targets of sales and financial targets; Visit potential and existing company customers; Solve the customer's problems in the use of equipment; Participate in the designation and planning of regional sales and marketing plans; Responsible for some markets in Southwest China, Base Chengdu or Chong Qing About Anatomical Pathology  Improving lives by enabling better cancer diagnostics. Epredia offers a complete line of cancer diagnostic instruments and consumables from specimen collection to diagnosis. Epredia`s collaborative team of employees are delivering critical answers and strive to provide Pathology labs a more efficient, safe and productive environment.  How will you make an impact? Be good at learning products and related professional knowledge Use logical methods in analysis Reasonably allocate time and do a good job in regional optimization management Identify and take advantage of opportunities to improve their performance and seek challenging tasks to continue learning 5. Focus on achieving key objectives to achieve high quality results Communicate effectively with external contacts to ensure positive results Learn to analyze business processes and customer needs Work reliably with team members, solve problems and achieve goals, and respect all team members Use the understanding of customer needs and expectations to identify and recommend ideas or improvements to improve customer satisfaction Good communication skills, able to work under pressure, self-control What will you do?  The incumbent will also be responsible for, but not limited to the following duties: Follows standard practices and procedures in analyzing situations or data from which answers can be readily obtained Achieves the sales target for responsible area Develops and explore business opportunities in different market segment in the territory ,Develops relationships with key accounts and general customers Attends seminars, exhibitions and demonstrations by close work with marketing team within the territory in order to promote company’s business Calls on prospective and current company customers, Involves technical personnel to resolve customers' issues and problems as needed Works reliably with team member to resolve problems and achieve goals Provides quality assurance for adherence to technical standards Adheres to policies and procedures This description is a summary of principle responsibilities and is not intended to include all duties may be assigned.  How will you get here? Bachelor degree or above, major in medicine or marketing is preferred. Proficient in using outlook, PowerPoint and Excel for computer application. English writing skills More than 3 years sales experience in life science field is preferred Travel frequently. Be able to develop with the company for a long time Self-driven, result oriented, good team player YOUR APPLICATION  Epredia offers a wide variety of competitive compensation and benefits programs. If you meet the requirements of this unique opportunity, and are driven by innovation and the desire to improve the lives of our patients, we encourage you to apply now. Job postings will remain open for a minimum of five business days and are subject to immediate closure thereafter without additional notice.  TO ALL RECRUITMENT AGENCIES  Epredia does not accept unsolicited third party resumes.  Epredia is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Our Journey. Epredia is on a journey to create an inclusive environment where we celebrate multiple approaches and points of view. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain the best and brightest from all walks of life and backgrounds. Your candidacy will be reviewed regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status.

Job Description  Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?  Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.  You create and implement the innovation/renovation strategy that is aligned with the brand vision to drive sustainable growth.  How You Will Contribute  You will work with others in Mondelēz International to determine an innovation strategy and priorities to enable consumer-centric brand growth and execute commercial innovation plans on innovation based on identified goals. In partnership with brand teams, you will define and deliver plans to renovate the core brand and to strengthen the entire portfolio through innovation and renovation. You will also manage the portfolio (which includes brand architecture). In this role, you are accountable for revenue and profit, sharing objectives as they relate to innovation, and monitoring performance against key performance indicators. Based on your deep consumer insights, brand strategy and positioning, you will integrate innovation into marketing communication plans and campaigns.  What You Will Bring  A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Marketing, ideally in a matrix environment in the consumer goods industry Developing and marketing product innovations at a cross-country level Working effectively with other marketing disciplines and with cross-functional teams Working with design, innovation and research agencies Analytical and creative skills—a balance of commercial and strategic acumen Understanding consumers Communicating effectively, verbally and in writing, and executive presentation skills  其它职位信息  关于此职位，您需要了解：  您还将带来什么额外价值：  教育背景/资历证书：  工作制定要求：  差旅要求：  正常  工作安排：  No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary We’ve been bringing our products to Greater China for over 35 years, making, marketing and selling our mouth-watering, well-loved local and global brands such as Oreo, LU and Chips Ahoy! biscuits, Pacific wafers, Stride gumand Milka chocolate. Headquartered in Shanghai, our 4,000 employees proudly work in sales offices and in our Research & Development Technical Centre in Suzhou. We are also proud to be awarded China’s 2020 Top Employer certification.  Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Fluency in English and computer skills. Good team player, good execution, find and problem-solving skills, and teamwork abilities. Strong communication skills.

description: Join Waygate Technologies - Digital Inspection Solutions Team  As a Digital Solutions business, we provide intelligent, connected hardware technologies to sense, control, and inspect assets across many industries. Customers are provided with peace of mind to reliably and efficiently improve operations. Our team has a collaborative sales mind-set, a technical understanding of our products, providing highly customizable solutions.  Partner with the best  As a Lead Sales Specialist, you'll collaborate with customers contributing to long-term planning and sales initiatives. In a high-impact, fast-paced environment you'll integrate yourself into the process of developing new markets and customers to meet business needs. You'll find joy in delivering successful outcomes for customers through innovation, strategic technology solutions.  As a Lead Sales Specialist, you will be responsible for:  Selling product(s), services, parts, solutions, or projects within an assigned geographic area. Handing standardized products with pre-defined options for low - medium size stable region with pre-established market presence. Handling targeted clients. Works on the basis of predefined contracts and frameworks. Developing regional sales strategies upon discussion with the manager to scope/plan in delivering winning proposals for customers. Leading a medium - large team to work towards in achieving sales goal.  Fuel your passion  To be successful in this role you will:  Have Bachelor's degree from an accredited university Have minimum 7 years experience in Sales Familiar with Ultrasonic and inspection products Good sense of responsibilty and full of passion Good English skills in both Oral and Written  About Us  With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we're committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we're always looking for the right people to help us get there. Join Us  Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you! description: Job Description  Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?  Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.  You create and implement the innovation/renovation strategy that is aligned with the brand vision to drive sustainable growth.  How You Will Contribute  You will work with others in Mondelēz International to determine an innovation strategy and priorities to enable consumer-centric brand growth and execute commercial innovation plans on innovation based on identified goals. In partnership with brand teams, you will define and deliver plans to renovate the core brand and to strengthen the entire portfolio through innovation and renovation. You will also manage the portfolio (which includes brand architecture). In this role, you are accountable for revenue and profit, sharing objectives as they relate to innovation, and monitoring performance against key performance indicators. Based on your deep consumer insights, brand strategy and positioning, you will integrate innovation into marketing communication plans and campaigns.  What You Will Bring  A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge: Marketing, ideally in a matrix environment in the consumer goods industry Developing and marketing product innovations at a cross-country level Working effectively with other marketing disciplines and with cross-functional teams Working with design, innovation and research agencies Analytical and creative skills—a balance of commercial and strategic acumen Understanding consumers Communicating effectively, verbally and in writing, and executive presentation skills  其它职位信息  关于此职位，您需要了解：  您还将带来什么额外价值：new platform strategy thinking and project managment with product launch  教育背景/资历证书：bachelor or above  工作制定要求：shanghai  差旅要求：no  工作安排： new platrform exploration and deepdive analyisis from market understanding, consumer understanding. project management from product idea to product launch cross fuction communication and colleberation. No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary We’ve been bringing our products to Greater China for over 35 years, making, marketing and selling our mouth-watering, well-loved local and global brands such as Oreo, LU and Chips Ahoy! biscuits, Pacific wafers, Stride gumand Milka chocolate. Headquartered in Shanghai, our 4,000 employees proudly work in sales offices and in our Research & Development Technical Centre in Suzhou. We are also proud to be awarded China’s 2020 Top Employer certification. Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
